description: One person was killed and seven others injured in a four car crash on the Franklin D. Roosevelt Drive at 49th Street last night, the police reported.

title: Four Sign Saints' Pacts
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 8 (UPI) The New Orleans Saints have signed a free agent running back and three defensive ends to 1972 pro football contracts. A Saints' spokesman announced yesterday the signing of Tom Smiley, former Houston run ning back, Lawrence Estes, Leo Carroll and Bart Graves.

title: Cloisters Still Fighting Vatican II
description: UNION CITYTorn by the dissent following Vatican II, New Jersey's most secluded orders, the cloistered nuns are undergoing a series of changes reflecting in minia ture the polarization that is affecting the Roman Catholic Church as a whole.

title: Monica Horan Married
description: DOBBS FERRY, N.Y., July 8Miss Monica Debra Horan, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John J. Horan, was married here this morning to Joseph W. Henneberry, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Henneberry. The bride is a graduate of Mount Mercy College here, where Msgr. Henry Cauley performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass in the chapel. She has a mas ter's degree from Lehman College in the Bronx. Her husband, who has bachelor's and law degrees from Ford ham University, is an assist ant district attorney for New York City.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: TORONTOThe Canadian securities market is in some ways merely a smaller ver sion of the market in the United States. At least, it has some of the same prob lems.

title: Provisions Industry, a Victim of Violence, Threatens a Stoppage
description: Labor and Management in the provisions industry yesterday threatened a citywide stoppage unless the police and the rest of the city government made commitment to a program to stop muggings and truck hijack ings in the city's poverty areas.

title: The Amenities of a Country Club Right in the Heart of Manhattan
description: Country living in Manhattan?

title: The World
description: Nearing completion in Seattle is a sleek Boeing 707 jetliner that is to be the personal plane of the President of the United States. Last week the pos sibility arose that by the end of 1973 sister ships of the President's plane will be flying international routes for the Government of Communist China.

title: Gardens
description: EXOTIC ferns from far away lands provide new potentialities and challenges for the gar dener. Their leaves and color readily adapt themselves to new locations. In general, they prefer moderate shade and little attention other than spring garden cleanup, oc casional watering in dry spells, and fall mulching.

title: Horse Show News
description: Money is the name of the equine game these days. Even the oneday shows area put ting up enough cash to make it worthwhile for exhibitors to bring their best stock. Less than two months ago, Prim rose Farms in Somers, N.Y., offered a $1,000 stake for jumpers. As little as five years ago, that would have been an unheard of sum because one day shows tradi tionally have been used more to give horses experience than to win money.

title: Housing Policeman Is Shot Near Williamsburg Project
description: An offduty Housing Author ity patrolman was shot and critically wounded at 145 Mau jer Street in Brooklyn last night, the police reported.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Congratulations to Peter E. Black for writing and to you for printing his July 2 letter headed Stay Out of the Flood Plain. It was all good sense and very well put. Restricting flood relief for rebuilding to those who would agree to move to locations out side the flood plain is a great idea that suggests the following idea. Ex tend the responsibility of the Army Engineers and the U.S. Geological Survey to mapping and marking these flood plain areas. Nextto protect the unsophisticated buyerno sale of land in the flood plain should be final unless the statement that it is in the flood plain appears in the agreement. By such warning the Federal Govern ment will protect itself against paying for flood relief.

title: MISS FARKAS WINS UNDER19 FENCING
description: WALTHAM, Mass., July 8 Iza Farkas of New Brunswick, N. J., defeated Mrs. Vincent Hurley of Houston, 43, in a fenceoff today to gain the women's under 19 national fencing championship.

title: WALL STREET
description: The results of the mutual fund derby for the first half of this year are now avail able, and some remarkable gains are listed. So are some remarkable losses.

title: Connally Greeted in Iran
description: TEHERAN, Iran, July 8 (AP) Mr. Connally was received today by the Shah, Moham mad Reza Pahlavi, at Sada bad Palace for talks and luncheon.

title: An Easterner Out West Finds Endless Empty Stretches Then a Biggie: Albuquerque
description: IT is empty in the West. Endless stretches of dry, caked infinity. Prairie. Sagebrush. Entire states of hard, red dirt The visitor from the East, driving to Albuquerque, the mod em cowboy's dream scene, has no con cept of space out West. In the East a lonely stretch of road is interspersed with house lights, Dairy Queens, gas stations and towns. The orange roofs of Howard Johnsons dot the country side like plastic hotels on Monopoly boards. In the West there is nothing. Not a house. Not a building. In Kansas and Nebraska, for long stretches, not even a hill. Occasionally a highway sign tells how far away civilization lies. Little towns you've never heard of be fore begin to seem like Mecca when foreshadowed by a hundred miles of an almost cosmic countdown of high way announcements. Fast cars become sacred, for speed is the one element that can beat the tyranny of space and distance.

title: The 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 8On the eve of the. Democratic Na tional Convention, top party financial officials were engaged today in a lastminute drive for cash to meet an estimated $100,000 deficit from their $2 million extravaganza.

title: MISSISSIPPI DISPUTE IS WON BY LOYALISTS
description: JACKSON, Miss., July 8  A Federal Appeals Court panel here today turned down Mis sissippi's regular Democrats in their lastminute effort to block the state's predominantly black loyalist delegation from going to the Democratic National Convention.

title: What's a Bobby Dazzler? It's a Boutique for Men
description: You'd be surprised how many people come in here and say, Where's the Aus tralian? There must be an Australian around here some where It was Brian Hall who was speaking and he was in a recently opened Second Avenue boutique for men.

title: Movies
description: DYING first and succeeding later isn't so uncommon in the arts. For the Romantics it could even carry some prestige, and the popular image of the neglected genius who starves in his garret and then bursts into glory 20 years later has just enough support in reality to give that vulgar lie a look of truth. For poets, for paint ers, maybebut not for filmmakers, In the first place, the nature of the medium virtually demands an audience that at some level likes what you do. And in the second place, you don't get to do what you do unless enough people liked what you did last time so that somebody, for greed or for glory, will put up the money this time.

title: Allende Names New Minister To Replace Censured Aide
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, July 8 (UPI)President Salvador Al lende Gossens named Foreign Minister Clodomiro Almeyda as acting Interior Minister today to replace Hernan del Canto, who was suspended by the Chamber of Deputies.

title: 8 RANGER GAMES ON EXHIBITION LIST
description: A pair of games in Madison Square Garden, against the Boston Bruins and the Montreal Canadiens, will be highlights of the eightgame preseason schedule of the New York Rangers, it was announced by Emile Francis, the club's gen eral manager and coach.

title: Home Builders Explain Their Success
description: To hear home builders of varying sizes tell it, success in an industry that will build 2 million housing units in the United States this year rests on four simple and fairly ob vious rules:

title: LAG IN MEDICARE LAID TO HOSPITALS
description: A State Controller's report indicated yesterday that the city hospital system has had millions of dollars tied up in Medicare bills because of de layed and inaccurate claims submitted to the Social Security Administration.

title: Jordan Estras Have Child
description: A daughter was born June 23 to Mr. and Mrs. Jordan Mark Estra of Riverdale, the Bronx, in the New York Hos pital. Mrs. Estra is the former Miss Amy Insler of Hamden, Conn. Her husband is with the corporate development department of American Metal Climax, Inc. The child has been named Tara Eliza beth.

title: A HAITIAN HERO
description: As Haitians, we are pleased to learn that the story of this great figure of early Haitian history will be brought to the screen. Thus, we congratulate both Ellen Holly and Anthony Quinn on their projects.

title: Child to Mrs. Hershon
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., July 8 A daughter was born June 20 at the North Shore Hos pital in Manhasset to Dr. and Mrs. Stuart J. Hershon.

title: Giammalva Wins Boys Tennis
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., July 8 Tony Giammalva of White Plains, the topseeded player, defeated John McEnroe of Douglaston, Queens, 64, 6.4, to win the boys 14 years and under division title in the East ern boys tennis championships today at the Port Washington Tennis Academy.

title: Suffolk's Ugly Side: Job Dearth
description: Morning after morning, at mailboxes up and down the avenues and lanes of Suffolk County, the longterm unem ployed wait for answers to their job applications. But the only thing they find are bills.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Many American liberals wonder these days why Israelis are so sus picious of Senator McGovern, espe cially after his commitment to visit Israel if elected and to recognize Jerusalem as its capital.

title: Newark's Librarian To Retire
description: NEWARKThe man who brought the library into the streets of the inner city here and persuaded the state and Federal Governments to back the Newark Public Library financially, James E. Bryan, its director, will retire Aug. 1.

title: Letters
description: Miss Maynard's prom article in no way seeks to explain but rather manages to avoid dealing with the problems of today's adolescents in trying to cope with the social aspects of the contemporary world around them. Surely The Times is capable of sponsor ing a more comprehensive analysis of the current youth ful Weltanschauung.

title: Science
description: SEEWIESEN, BavariaThe domes tic problems of the cichlids, a group of tropical fish, have a familiar ring. While one cichlid is away, patrolling the territorial perimeter of the cou ple's province, the other stays home to care for the young. Tour of duty done, the guardian returns home filled with aggressive feelingsfor all the world like a human breadwinner fresh from office battles.

title: Judge Imposes Hiring Ratio On the Philadelphia Police
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 8 (AP)  Federal District Judge John R. Fullam has imposed formal hiring and promotion re strictions on the Philadelphia Police Department, ordering that one black be hired for every two whites.

title: PARASITIC BIRDS LEARN HOST SONGS
description: ?? Germany  The aviaries that border the isola ted pond at the research insti tute here are a bedlam of song during the day, but Dr. Jurgen Nicolai's trained ear dissected from it the contact trill of the strawtailed widow bird.

title: Schumann Meets Chinese
description: PEKING, July 8 (Agence FrancePresse)Foreign Minis ter Maurice Schumann of France and Foreign Minister Chi Pengfei of China met for three hours today to discuss Asian and Middle Eastern ques tions. The session followed their first talk yesterday, which was reported to have dealt with Vietnam and Europe. Mr. Schu mann arrived Thursday for a fiveday visit.

title: McGovern Aide Calls Jobs Chief Goal
description: The first priority in economic policy of an Administration headed by Senator George Mc Govern would be to spur the economy back to full employ ment, a key adviser to the South Dakota Democrat said yesterday.

title: Phone Directory Bars Woman's Other Name
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., July 8 (AP)  Bell Telephone balked when Sarah T. Shore tried to have listed in the Philadelphia directory what she said was her other name.

title: Sports Stars to Play In Area Golf Benefit
description: Tom Seaver and Yogi Berra of the Mets, Ron Johnson of the Giants and Brad Park of the Rangers are among the leading sports figures expect ed to compete tomorrow in the sports celebrityamateur golf tournament at the Upper Montclair Country Club in Clifton, N. J.

title: Arlene J. Lane Plans Bridal
description: KINGS POINT, L. I., July 8 Mr. and Mrs. Leonard C. Lane have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Arlene J. Lane, to Daniel B. Fisher, son of Mrs. Jack Fisher of Yonkers and the late Mr. Fisher. A December wedding is planned.

title: Notes:. Monte Carlo, N. Y.
description: LIKE any good guest, Jimmy (The Greek) Snyder, the Las Vegas oddsmaker, was in full agree ment with his host, Leon Green berg, the president or the Monti cello Raceway, when he was given a tour of resorts in the Catskills a couple of weeks ago. Green berg, who is a leading proponent of the idea that Sullivan County should have a gambling casino, maintains that it would have to be a Monte Carlo type of operation that was owned and op erated by the state.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: When the President's Mate rials Policy Commission is sued its report 20 years ago, we attempted essentially to answer the question: Has the United States of America the material meansthe coal, minerals, oil, and other re sourcesto supply a vigor ously expanding economy and provide for our security?

title: The Convention
description: WASHINGTONBarely four days ago, when the United States Court of Appeals here held that Senator George McGovern was entitled to retain all 271 of the delegates he won in Cali fornia's Presidential primary, the South Dakotan's senior strategist was on the verge of euphoria. If this decision stands, Frank Mankiewicz said, it's going to be a rollicking convention. You know, we can get some electric canes and whoopee cushions.

title: MRS. KNAUER ASKS COSMETICS DATA
description: WASHINGTON, July 8Mrs. Virginia H. Knauer, President Nixon's special assistant for consumer affairs, is applying new pressure on cosmetics man ufacturers to disclose ingredi ents of their products.

title: All over town
description: The Great American Shirtwaist has never looked better. No other fashion has cut across so many generations and weathered so many fashion upheavals. This year, when the accent is on the natural woman and downtoearth garb, the shirtwaist rises to its full glory. The examples shown here follow the classic lines, but have enough innovations to mark them this year's crop.

title: RYUN TAKES 1,500 IN OLYMPIC TRIALS
description: EUGENE, Ore., July 8Jim Ryun won a trip to his third Olympics tonight, but tension took its toll on another giant name in American track and field, Randy Maston.

title: World News Briefs
description: VIENTIANE, Laos July 8 Prince Souvanna Phouma, the Laotian Premier, has agreed to a request from Prince Souphan ouvong, leader of the Lao Pa triotic Front, for a resumption of talks between their repre sentatives toward a ceasefire.

title: Notes on a Minor Major Barbara
description: THE Bernard Shaw prob lem is a bone in everybody's theatrical throat, and the pro duction of his Major Bar bara currently at Stratford, Connecticut, being imperfect ly executed, is not going to settle the bone for anybody one way or the other. People who love Shaw, as I do, are likely to rest content with the pleasure of simply seeing the play, which hasn't been on view professionally in this area for some 15 years. People who find him talky, pompous, old  fashioned, static, boring, spinster ish (you can mix your own plate of derogatives, like anti pasto at the house buffet) are equally likely to stalk out afterwards muttering that They Knew It All Along.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: As an active Democrat for more than sixteen years, I am deeply disap pointed over the foreign policy plank proposed by the Democratic party's Platform Drafting Committee. For the first time in 28 years, according to The Times' excerpts, the Democratic platform fails to mention the United Nations and the Democratic party's commitment to the ideals of the United Nations.

title: Cleaner Gowanus Canal Looms
description: Should it be a foggy day when William Van Pelt looks out his office window at the foot of Court Street, Brook lyn, it takes only one of his senses to remind him of the proximity of the Gowanus Canal.

title: Those of Spanish Origin in City Are Put at 15% by 1970 Census
description: Fifteen per cent of New York City's population  1,202,281 persons identified themselves as of Spanish origin in the 1970 census, according to Cen sus Bureau tabulations still being analyzed.

title: TRIPLE BEND 6TH
description: Key to the Mint bounced back into topperformance form at Aqueduct yesterday. The Rokeby Stable's star, away from the gate first in the field of 12 in the $118,100 Brooklyn Handicap, stayed there all the way and beat his nearest rival, Sigmund Sommer's Autobiogra phy, by two lengths.

title: Son for the Salzes
description: A son was born June 27 at Mount Sinai Hospital to Mr. and Mrs. David Salz of New York. Mrs. Salz is the former Miss Barbara Leavitt of Shaker Heights, Ohio.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: SYDNEY, Australia, July 8 The requirement that Aus tralians wear seat belts has brought what a trafficsafety expert believes is a sharp and dramatic drop in fatali ties in auto accidents.

title: Tanaka: Pragmatist at Helm
description: TOKYO  The election of Kakuei Tanaka as Prime Min ister of Japan has put into this country's top Govern ment position the Japanese political leader most quali fied to deal with Japan's in ternational economic rela tions.

title: King's Bishop Hangs On To Take Arlington Race
description: CHICAGO, July 8 (AP)  King's Bishop hung on to win the $39,150 Round Table Handi cap by a head before 22,190 fans at Arlington Park today.

title: Naval Academy Given Guggenheim Library
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., July 8 (AP)One of the outstand ing private libraries in the United States, the Harry F. Guggenheim Library, has been donated to the United States Naval Academy by the Harry Frank Guggenheim Foundation.

title: BASS NAMED COACH OF MEMPHIS IN A.B.A.
description: MEMPHIS, July 8 (AP)Bob Bass, former coach of the Amer ican Basketball Association's Floridians, was named coach of the Memphis entry in the A.B.A. today by the man he talked into buying the team.

description: TOKYO, July 8 (AP)Ta kashi Yamaguchi struck out 13 batters tonight as Japan de feated the United States, 63, in the opening game of the first United StatesJapan colle giate baseball World Series.

title: MIAMI BEACH
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 8In his inter view with Richard Meryman in Life magazine, George McGovern says he thinks he has earned the Democratic Presidential nomination and adds that if the old established politicians gang up and deny it to him, I would run as an independent or support somebody else on an independent ticket.

title: George Taylor Beebe Marries Nicole Wilson

description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, July 8  Nationalist China watched po litical developments in South Korea and Japan, two of its closest allies, with considerable anxiety this week.

description: To THE EDITOR:

title: An Archeological Vacation: Digging Up the Past in Israel
description: It is hard, dirty, physical labor  stooping, picking, hoeing, lifting stones and heavy baskets of dirt to shoulder height, etc. Both men and women do the same kind of work.

title: New President Named By Nature Conservancy
description: ARLINGTON, Va., July 8 Dr. Everett M. Woodman, president of Colby Junior Col lege, New London, N. H., is the new president of the Na ture Conservancy.

title: From the far erotic left
description: The world would certainly be less disagreeable if there were more peo ple like me in it, declares the nar rator of Italo Svevo's novel The Confessions of Zeno (Vintage Books, paper, $1.95). Composed in a loose, almost languid manner, mounting to no climax or denouement, un moved by considerations of develop ment or suspense, Svevo's book is a relaxed comic masterpiece, one to set beside Kafka's The Castle and Amerika. Less a tale than a record of consciousness, it recounts from the perspective of wry middleage the marriage, love affairs, business career and physiological states of a Trieste businessman rather like Svevo himself, and offers as its imagi native rationale a brilliant wayward sense of self.

title: The Way We Write Now
description: Everyone seems to be agreed lately that the serious novel in Amer ica is going through a change. The realistic novel is dead, one hears; and something exciting is rising from its ashes. I take a dimmer view, but I do think something is happening, and the decline of realism is a super ficial part of it. What is happening is that after a period of cynicism, novelists are strugglingfor the most part in ways doomed by indifference to novelistic formto see their way clear to go heroic, Strange new worlds are in, cynicism and despair are out, replaced not by true affir mation but by psychological survival tactics.

title: Polly Mathias to Be Wed on Aug. 5
description: Edward William Mathias of Washington and Mrs. Mathias of San Francisco have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Anne (Polly) Mathias, to Gregg Peters Monsees, son of Mr. and Mrs. Warren Rehm Monsees of Upper Montclair andOcean City, N. J.

title: Janet Schilke Bride
description: ENGLEWOOD, N.J., July 8 Miss Janet Carol Schilke, daughter of Dr. Albert W. Schilke, a dentist, and Mrs. Schilke of Tenafly and Southold, L.I., was married here this afternoon to Mi chael Joseph Varosky, son of Mr. and Mrs. Michael F. Var osky of Donora, Pa. The Rev. John Van Zanten performed the ceremony at the First Presbyterian Church. He was assisted by the Rev. Ettore DiNapoli, a Roman Catholic priest.

title: The Nation
description: For the last several years, Ronald E. Galella, a selfstyled paparazzo, has made a career of photographing Mrs. Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis and her two children, Caroline and Jahn. Kennedy. Last week, that career came to an end.

title: Opera: Floyd's Sophisticated Of Mice and Men
description: NORFOLK, Conn., July 8 As Carlisle Floyd sees it, apparently, John Steinbeck's Of Mice and Men is a kind of northern California Woz zeck of the nineteenthirties. Mr. Floyd's opera, based on the Steinbeck novel and play, presented last night at the Yale University Summer School of Music and Art, sounded much of the time like a pop version of Berg's masterpiece, complete with Bergian orchestral interludes as scenic bridges.

title: Brigadier Gerard Captures English Race for 14 in Row
description: SANDOWN, England, July 8 (UPI)  Brigadier Gerard won the $125,000 Eclipse Stakes to day for his 14th straight vic tory. The 4yearold colt, owned by John Heslop of Eng land, and ridden by Joe Mer cer, scored by one length over Gold Rod, with Home Guard third.

title: Television
description: ON the Fourth of July 16 years ago, Maureen Collins, then 6 months old, lay gurgling happily in her baby carriage in the back yard of her family's home in the Bay Ridge section of Brooklyn. In the yard next door, three boys were fooling around with firecrackers. They lit one and lobbed it over the fence, just for kicks. A neighbor sitting at her window saw the firecracker land in Maureen's carriage.

title: Patricia Johnson, Teacher, Fiancee
description: NEWARK, July 8  Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Franklin Johnson have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Patricia Ann John son, to Edward Hamilton, son of Mr. and Mrs. Mitchell Hamilton of Cliffwood. The wedding is planned for Aug. 6 in the Metropolitan Bap tist Church here.

title: Beach at Ocean City Takes a Stretch
description: OCEAN CITY  In mid afternoon here last Sunday the water temperature was 70, there was a large week end crowd of bathers for the first time this season, and at 13th Street there was 140 yards of sandy beach be tween the ocean and the boardwalk.

title: 14 N.B.A. Marks Set Last Season By Chamberlain
description: Wilt Chamberlain, who led the Los Angeles Lakers to their first National Basketball Asso ciation championship last sea son, also set 14 league records during the 197172 campaign.

title: Letters
description: Poor Joyce Maynard. She writes an article reminiscing about her personal childhood (An 18YearOld Looks Back on Life, April 23) and rather brilliantly fits it into the broader matrix of our era, and, lo, she is denounced for existential malaise, among other things.

title: Nicklaus: 22 Years At Hard Labor
description: Jack Nicklaus, 32, of Columbus, Ohio, is the best golfer in the world, and he means to improve.

title: New & Novel
description: The time, the place and the mood of this powerful little novel hark back to Liam O'Fla herty's The Informer. Amid the Troubles of the 1920's, perfidy and betrayal fester un der the harsh pressure of the Black and Tans. Mr. Clifford focuses on three rebels, two men and a girl, holed up in a shattered hotel. Armored pa trols by day and a spotlight by night isolate the three, who are sick, hungry and demor alized.

title: ABSURDITY
description: TO ANTHONY QUINN:

title: Home Improvement
description: IN line with today's trend toward the use of plastic in the construction of home furniture and built In units, here is a simply designed, attractive  looking bookcase that uses both wood and clear plastics in its construction. The framework is built of teak plywood and the shelves, as well as some of the vertical parti tions and back, are made of inch thick, clear Plexiglas (this material is now being widely sold by the sheet, in various sizes and thicknesses, in many local paint, hardware and building materials stores.

title: Stottlemyre Is 10 Victor On Allen's Wallop in 11 th
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., July 8Bernie Allen returned home today and gave his old team mates a little remembrance by hitting an 11thinning homer that staked the New York Yankees to a 10 victory over the Minnesota Twins.

title: ExKing Talal of Jordan Dies; Abdicated in '52 in Favor of Son
description: AMMAN, Jordan, July 8 (AP)Former King Talal died in Istanbul today, the Amman radio announced. He was 63 years old.

title: Coolidge Is Recalled By a Son at Memorial
description: PLYMOUTH NOTCH, Vt., July 8 (AP)John Coolidge, son of the 30th President, says it is simply not so that his father, Calvin Coolidge was a hard man to understand not if you knew him.

title: Larchmont Bridal For Karen Byrne
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y. July 8  Miss Karen Louise Byrne, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George P. Byrne Jr., was mar ried here this afternoon to Robert Gibbs Watt, son of Mr. and Mrs. L. Allan Watt of Winchester, Ill. The Rev. Calvin De Vries performed the ceremony at the Larch mont Avenue Presbyterian Church.

title: The Family That Vacations Together...
description: I CAN hear the groan of a bulldozer digging the excavation for a back yard swimming pool Just around the corner. Last week a neighbor up the street had a pool put in. And since February the mailman has dropped off 14 invitations to send my sons to sum mer camps. Hockey camps, nature camps, swimming camps, nudist camps.

title: The Price of Change
description: There is no such thing as a painless revolution. As the Democrats go through the ordeal of drastically reordering the balance of power within their party, they are once again learning that old human truth.

title: Ken Harrelson Clinches Berth in British Open
description: MUIRFIELD, Scotland, July 8 (UPI)Ken Harrelson, for mer major league baseball star, was among the golfers who qualified today for next week's British Open golf tournament.

title: CARI COUNTY, $8.40, WINS BY 1 LENGTHS
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 8 (AP) Cari County splashed through rain and mud today to win the $28,300 Dragoon Stakes for 2yearold thoroughbreds at Liberty Bell Race Track.

title: Newark Sees Airport Helping Economy
description: NEWARKIn this troubled city where the unemploy ment rate is 13.4 per cent, the $400million redevelop ment of Newark Airport is expected by many to trigger an important economic up turn in the city.

title: Hanoi Claims 4 in Day
description: TOKYO, July 8 (UPI)The North Vietnamese press agency said today that five United States warplanes had been shot down over North Vietnam dur ing the day.

title: 42.5% of Hudson's Population Is of Foreign Stock
description: With an ethnic mix equal to Manhattan's, Hudson Countyjust across the river from New York  leads all other New Jersey counties by far in foreignborn popula tion and foreign stock.

title: News of Boating
description: Unlimited usually refers to the kind of hydroplane that can travel at more than 200 miles an hour on a straight away, weighs about three tons and is powered by any kind of power plant that can turn a propaircraft, jet or Wankel.

title: Dance
description: THE Stravinsky Festival staged a couple of weeks ago by the New York City Ballet was one of the most exciting dance events ever to oc cur in New York City. In fact, so far as pure creativity went it must surely be re garded as a virtually unsur passable dance occasion, There is a kind of divine madness to include 20 world premieres in a single week's programing and to add to them 10 revivals and a dif ferent program every night.

title: Bicycle Rider, Mare To Meet in Match Race
description: The Monticello Gold Cup, a onemile race between a bicyclist, Jackie Simes, and Bannarae, a harness horse, will take place Saturday be tween the third and fourth races at Monticello Raceway. The race will conclude the evening's cycling program, which includes the Sullivan County Grand Prix.

title: Cedono Is Best in June
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 8 (AP)  In the tightest ballot ing in more than a decade, Cesar Cedeno, Houston Astro center fielder, has been elected National League player of the month for June. Johnny Bench of the Cincinnati Reds was a point behind.

title: CAPRA TRIUMPHS IN SAIL ON SOUND
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., July 8  Aldo Capra whipped an 11boat Rhodes19 Class fleet today as 83 boats sailed with the Knickerbocker Yacht Club in the Cow Bay area Yacht Racing Association of Long Island Sound competition.

title: Wimbledon Rained Out
description: The men's singles final be tween Stan Smith and Ilie Nastase in the Wimbledon tennis championships in Eng land was rained out yester day and rescheduled for to day. Details on page 4.

title: New & Novel
description: After two years at Syracuse, two at N.Y.U., a summer in Europe, three summers on Fire Island, three analysts, 15 sex partners and one abortion, Sheila Levine decides to kill herself. This is a funny book, but Sheila Levine is serious. Buys a cemetery plot and a casket, arranges for her eulo gy, and swallows an overdose. What's a nice Jewish girl do ing making her own funeral arrangements? That's what Gail Parent goes about disclosing in this feminine rejoinder to Portnoy's Complaint.

title: Letters
description: Since The New York Times reports so little about Latin America, it should at least set reasonable standards for the quality of the material it does print. We are appalled by Barnard Collier's careless and offensive article, The Word in Chile is Tomar (May 7).

title: FIGHT IN PROSPECT
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 8Sen ator George McGovern arrived here today to find himself tantalizingly close to but still disturbingly short of a control ling majority at the Democratic National Convention.

title: This Hamlet Is a Man, Not a Boy
description: IT is not generally noticed how very conventional most of Joseph Papp's Shakespeare productions have been. Sometimes, especially lately, a director has turned up with a conceptI am thinking of Gerald Freedman's Titus Andronicus, A. J. Antoon's Cymbeline, and of course, hors concours, the Mel Shapiro/John Guars Two Gentlemen of Verona. But much of the time it has been a matter of finding an appropriate period for the cos tumes, getting Ming Cho Lee to design another of his scaffoldy settings, and very straightforwardly getting the thing on.

title: Davis Park Weekenders Upset by Patchogue Fee
description: PATCHOGUE, L. I.  The parking lot at the Long Is land Rail Road station was unusually full for a Sunday night. A taxi pulled in and five sunburned women in their mid20's got out and headed toward a parked car.

title: Richard Lasko Weds Charlotte Jane Perry
description: MALVERNE, L.I., July 8 Miss Charlotte Jane. Perry, a graduate of the Roosevelt Hospital School of Nursing and the Columbia University School of General Studies in New York, was married here this morning to Richard Peter Lasko, son of Mrs. Wilbur George Lasko of Merrick and the late Mr. Lasko.

title: Home Improvement
description: A second company has in troduced a compact and in expensive gas welding outfit for home handymenshortly after the first one was de scribed in this column some weeks ago (May 14). At that time this page described the Solidox Apollo Welding Kit (made by Cleanweld Products Co., 9220 So. Atlantic Boule vard, South Gate, Calif. 90280) as being apparently the only one of its kind, but there is another similar unit available. Galled the Pyro 5, and made by Pyronetics, Inc., 10025 Shoemaker Ave., Santa Fe Springs, Calif. 90607, this one also uses disposable pro pane tanks of the kind sold in all hardware stores, and solid oxygen sticks or pel lets to create the high tem peratures required (over 5, 000 degrees) for welding, brazing and cutting. Oxygen is released by the sticks as they burn without use of high pressure cylinders, and, like the model previously de scribed, it too sells for $39.95.

title: Freedom Now Makes Successful Debut at Westbury, Capturing Forbes Pace
Brewer Registers 68 for 205, Leads Canadian Golf by 3 Shots
description: FORT ERIE, Ontarlo, July 8 Gay Brewer worried yester day about a tiny putt he missed for a par at the last hole. This afternoon he was disturbed again when he took three putts at the first hole of the third round in the Canadian Open. But in concluding his round, Brewer sank a putt for a birdie at the 18th for a 68. This gave him a 54hole total of 205 and a three  stroke edge over the rest of the field.

title: Religion
description: GRANBY, Colo,Was it a religious experience for those sitting crossleg ged and naked in patches of sunshine under the spruce trees ... for those whose grimy faces were cut with smiles while the pungent smell of burning marijuana drifted through the mountain air?

title: Cards Top Astros, 21
description: ST. LOUIS, July 8 (AP) Reggie Cleveland of St. Louis posted his sixth straight vic tory with a sevenhitter tonight as the Cardinals defeated Hous ton, 21.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: About this time every year, irate consumers are heard complaining bitterly to salesclerks that they can't find their size, color, or style in sportswear, dresses, suits, pants, swimwear, or other summer goods. July 4, in other words, not only marks Independence Day but also means, a good many con sumers are convinced, that merchants consider summer over even though it only began little more than two weeks ago.

title: Stamps
description: BEN FRANKLIN, whose portrait appeared on one of the first two United States stamps issued in 1847, will appear on a 7c stamp that will have its first day sale Oct. 20 at Philadelphia. Previously an nounced as part of a new rateprogram for mailing ed ucational material, along with the 14c Fiorello H. La Guardia stamp, issued April 24, the Postal Service has added a 21cent stamp to the series that will be issued in 1973 and bears a portrait of A. P. Giannini, founder of the Bank of America.

title: Team Chooses 2d Site For Jetport in Florida
description: MIAMI, July 8 (AP)A 48 squaremile tract astride the junction of two highways in north Dade County has been picked by a Federalstate county review team as the site for a new billiondollar South Florida regional jet port.

title: A Police Chief in the Spotlightand on the Spot
description: MIAMI BEACHWhat can you say about a man who is Police Chief of Miami Beach? You can say that he displays auto graphed pictures of Lyndon Johnson and Richard Nixon, David BenGurion and Sammy Davis Jr. on the wall be hind his desk. You can say that the first thing he tells new patrolmen is: You see that bum in the Tshirt and sneakers? He could be Howard Hughes. Whoever he is, he's somebody impor tant some place. Remember that.

title: A New Life For an Old Piazza
description: For a number of years there has been a complete ban on auto traffic in Rome's Piazza Navona; the result has been another ren aissance for this famous cigar shaped squarefamed for its Fountain of the Rivers by Ber nini and its origins in Imperial Rome as Domitian's Stadium. Friends stroll and chat, lovers embrace, children frolic and the elderly take their ease. The pi azza now stands out as an oasis, calm and quiet, in an otherwise hectic city.

title: New & Novel
description: By Russell Birdwell. 74 pp. New York: Robert Speller & Sons. $4.95.

title: The World
description: SAIGONToday, Quangtri city has been recaptured, President Nguyen Van Thieu announced triumphantly last Friday. I believe this is the start ing point of the complete and final failure of the Northern Communist invaders.

title: Social Announcements
description: Jerry and Rosemary Correll proudly en nounce the arrival of their daughter Joy Heather on June 28, 1972 at Beth Israel Medical Centre.

title: MOSCOW AGREES TO BUY U.S. GRAIN FOR $750MILLION
description: WASHINGTON, July 8Pres ident Nixon announced today a threeyear agreement to sell the Soviet Union at least $750mil lion of American wheat, corn and other grains. Administra tion officials described the agreement as the biggest grain transaction in history between two nations.

title: Miss Bernstein Plans Wedding
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 8 The engagement of Miss Robin Joan Bernstein to Barry Alan Roth of Harris burg has been announced by Benjamin D. Bernstein, fa ther of the future bride.

title: Lott Leads Georgia Golf
description: ATHENS, Ga., July 8 (AP) Lynn Lott carded a 70 today to take, a threestroke lead over Robert Warr in the Georgia amateur golf tournament. After three rounds, Lott has a four underpar 210 over the Athens Country Club course.

title: About Motor Sports
description: GAINESVILLE, Ga., July 8  Where's Jackie? Jackie Stewart, the world driving champion, will not run in to morrow's Road Atlanta Can Am race here, or any other CanAm this season. Stewart, who left the L & M Lola at the end of last season to join the GulfMcLaren crowd, was to have started driving a McLar en in this sea son's opener June 11 at Mosport in Canada, but he was sidelined by a bleeding duodenal ulcer. Now he has decided to withdraw com pletely from the CanAm and limit his racing to Grand Prix events; most of these are on European courses, within two hours' flying time of his home in Geneva.

title: Women Simulate Traffic Jams in Air
description: POMONA  Mrs. Dorothy Kruger, a 67yearold grand mother, calmly sat behind the controls of her Western Airlines jetliner, and said: San Francisco ground con trol, Western 8060 is ready for takeoff.

title: Puerto Rican Governor Hails Illinois Racial Moves
description: CHICAGO, July 3Gov. Luis A. Ferr of Puerto Rico says he loves Illinois.

title: Mrs. Weiss Has Son
description: A son was born June 21 to Dr. and Mrs. Oscar R. Weiss of New York at Lenox Hill Hospital. Mrs. Weiss is the former Miss Evelyn Michele Aria. Her husband is a pedia trician. The child has been named Daniel Efrem.

title: Religion
description: The Mormons recently announced a major program to help reclaim the alcoholics among their membership. In a way, this was passing strange since one of the ironclad rules for a devout Mormon is abstinence from liquor. Yet it also was typical of the Mormons' pragmatism: They worried less about the puzzle of how a man who doesn't drink can become a drunk than about how to get him off liquor and back into action.

title: SpanishLanguage Books Being Sought for Inmates
description: The Long Island Book for Peace Council, in cooperation with the Puerto Rican Forum has instituted a drive to collect books in Spanish for prisons and correctional insti tutions in New York City and Long Island.

title: Sports of The Times
description: It doesn't take any ability to hustle, fellows, was the first message that Don Zimmer gave his troops when he was named manager of the San Diego Padres a little over two months ago. The entire philosophy of his life was embodied in that statement because this indomitable little battler had proved that a man can compensate for deficiencies elsewhere by giving at least 100 per cent of himself at all times. However, it is probable that he has as untalented a batch of ballplayers as there is in the major leagues. But he has the players trying their hardest even if such ardent effort is not reflected in the standing of the teams.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: BUTTONWILLOW, Calif.This town of 1,600 persons has always lived off the fields. On one side of the main street are a few small stucco stores and service stations. On the other are the railroad yard and the offices of the larger cotton and rice growers, the barons of the district.

title: KINGS' BACKSTROM PREDICTS SWEEP
description: LOS ANGELES, July 8 (UPI) A 14year National Hockey League player who reached the 250goal plateau last season, Ralph Backstrom is willing to go on record with a prediction.

title: Travel Bookshelf: Getting Away From It All
description: I'VE HAD IT, A Practical Guide to Moving Abroad. By Robert Hopkins. 318 pp. Holt, Rinehart and Winston. $7.95.

title: Miss Bertha Betrothed
description: YONKERS, July 8Mrs. Michael Bertha has an nounced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Eleanor Bertha, to James Lee Lisher. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Claude Lisher of Topeka, Kan. The future bride is also the daughter of the late Mr. Bertha. She and her fianc plan to be married here Aug. 26 in Holy Trinity Lutheran Church. Miss Bertha is traf fic director and creative as sistant with Jack Cantwell, Inc., a New York advertising firm of which the prospective bridegroom is a vice presi dent and a director. He also is chairman of Minor Mar kets, Inc., a minority business marketresearch concern.

title: Rogers Will Extend Tour, Visit Rome and the Vatican
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, July 8 (UPI)Secretary of State William P. Rogers said today that he was extending his round theworld tour by two days for talks with the new Italian Gov ernment and with Pope Paul VI.

title: CYCLE RACES SET FOR MONTICELLO
description: Monticello Raceway will be the host for an Olympic bike racing preview on Saturday. Members of the United States team will compete in the Sulli van County Grand Prix, a 25 kilometer (about 15 miles) race. About 75 riders are ex pected for the race, which will begin at 6 P.M.

title: Joanne M. Corso Bride of Alan Wilson
description: Miss Joanne Marie Corso, daughter of State Supreme Court Justice Joseph R. Corso of Little Neck, Queens, was married yesterday afternoon to Alan R. Wilson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ronald G. Wilson of Benton Harbor, Mich.

title: Bergen Mall to Be Enclosed Next Year
description: PARAMUS, N. J., July 6 The Bergen Mall shopping center in Paramus, an inno vator in shopping trends when it was built in 1959, is going to become an enclosed shopping center by Septem ber, 1973.

title: No Price Lid Seen On Beef
description: FRANKFORT, Ill.  Pres ident Nixon's removal of all quota restrictions on meat Imports will probably have little impact on beef prices chiefly because of the recent announcement of suspension of import duties on live cat tle and beef by the Common Market (E.E.C.) countries.

title: LANGUAGE FEUDS WIDEN IN CANADA
description: OTTAWA, July 8A law student went into a Montreal court the other day and col lected an award of $1,400 after showing that, contrary to Quebec law, certain food products were not labeled in French, as well as English.

title: SUBMARINES RESCUE 6 FROM DOWNED B52
description: AGANA, Guam, Sunday, July 9 (AP)Two American sub marines rescued six crewmen from the Pacific yesterday a day after they had ejected from a B52 bomber that crashed into the sea, officials said to day.

title: Music
description: THE School of Fine and Applied Arts at Boston University is large, with some 960 undergradu ates and 180 graduate stu dents. Recently it asked the composer Norman Dello Joio to join the faculty. He accept ed, Not long after that, the school's dean, Edwin E. Stein, resigned to become chairman and president of the Minne apolis Society of Fine Arts, Would Dello Joio take on his duties also? The answer was yes, and he will become act ing aean this fall.

title: World News Briefs
description: BONN, July 8A new arms control law will restrict the sale of firearms in West Ger many to persons whose relia bility and expertness in han dling arms has been verified by authorities.

title: Richard of Gloucester Marries Dane
description: LONDON, July 8Prince Richard of Gloucester, cousin of Queen Elizabeth II and 10th in line of succession to the British crown, and Bir gitte van Deurs, a secretary at the Danish Embassy, were married today in an old country church.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The disastrous floods of recent days have once again highlighted the con tinuing folly of this nation's neglect of environmental considerations in its landuse policy. Untold millions could have been saved and much suffering avoided had flood plains been kept out of development. [Editorial July 7.]

title: U.S. Appeals Court, Citing Hijacking Peril, Backs Airport Searches
description: Efforts to thwart airplane hi jackers gained support in an unusual case decided here last week by the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Cir cuit.

title: CRENSHAW CHOICE IN GOLF AT DALLAS
description: DALLAS, July 8 (UPI)The TransMississippi golf tourna ment, oldest matchplay event still in existence, opens Mon day with Ben Crenshaw favored to knock down the title in his home state.

title: Olympics a Myth to U.S. Player
description: Mike Bantom will wear the red, white and blue basketball uniform at the Munich Olympic Games this summer, but, as far as he's concerned, he won't be playing for the United States team.

title: District Title Tourneys Next For Met Area Women Golfers
description: During the next few weeks women of the Metropolitan golf district will be playing in championships.

title: A Familiar Face
description: Gary Player of South Africa has competed in the last 15 Masters golf tournaments.

title: Letters
description: I do not doubt that Miss Maynard is a charming, intel ligent, sensitive girl, and cer tainly her first article proved her an able writer. But please, surely there must be some thing else in her past of more value and interest to readers, both of her own age and older, that would be more relevant to the present, even to her own (if slightly pro tected) life.

title: U.S. JURY ACQUITS JUSTICE PFINGST
description: A Federal court jury in Brooklyn yesterday acquitted Supreme Court Justice Joseph P. Pfingst of Suffolk COunty of charges that he paid $50,000 to gain the Republican nomi nation in 1968 and of having used a coded Swiss bank ac count to make the transaction.

title: U.S. Water Poloists Divide
description: LANDSHUT, West Germany, July 8, (Reuters)In today's preOlympic international water polo tournament, the United States team beat Australia, 82, then lost to West Germany, 75. The Netherlands beat Spain, 96.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (AP)Investigation of the sudden decompression of a jet airliner high above Wind sor, Ont., June 12 resulted in a demand this week for greater cargo door security on the Douglas DC10 wide body trijet.

title: Latest RaceFix Plot: Crooked Laser Beam
description: BUFFALO, July 8 (AP)  Two Canadians arrested to day in Rochester were ac cused by the Federal Bureau of Investigation of planning to use a highoutput laser beam to fix harness races at tracks in the United States and Canada.

title: Dreaming is considered a disease
description: Here's a fact worth noting: Sci ence fiction has given us the most influential art of the political imag ination produced in this century; fiction seems to accumulate political impact as it becomes fantastic. The landscape is invariably a cityscape, a skyline: We are in the City neither of God nor Man, but the Future. Within the sordid, shining avenues and perspectives of futurity, every thing we believe  a hypothetical we, I admithas been murderous ly, ultimately betrayed. Whatever now threatens decency or fulfillment has been, in that city of the future, universalized into iron law.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: CURB ON FLOODING URGED IN YONKERS
description: YONKERS, July 8Yonkers wants the Federal Govern ment to stop planning and start building a floodcontrol project for the Saw Mill River.

title: Flood Insurance Premiums to Be Cut Tomorrow
description: Flood insurance rates, will be substantially reduced, begin ning tomorrow, in a federally subsidized program to encour age property owners to protect themselves against the kinds of losses produced by Hurricane Agnes, an insurance spokesman announced yesterday.

title: Michael Stein Marries Joan Gordon
description: MAPLEWOOD, N. J., July 8  Miss Joan Lorraine Gordon, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur N. Gordon of East Brunswick, was married here this evening to Michael Ira Stein, son of Mrs. Sylvia Stein of New York. Rabbi Barry Green performed the ceremony at the Alpine.

title: Australian Water Skiing Stars Will Compete in U.S.
description: An Australian water skiing team that includes three world recordholders will compete in the United States, Italy and Great Britain in August and September.

title: Ode to the Brooklyn Bridge
description: Last Sunday, as many Brooklyn residents used the Brooklyn Bridge to escape from the 90degree tempera ture of the holiday weekend, a small group of people stay ed in the borough to salute the span in both poetry and music.

title: Virginia F. Harrison Betrothed
description: SHAKER HEIGHTS, Ohio, July 8The engagement of Miss Virginia Foster Harri son to Kirk L. Knight has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. H. Stuart Harrison, par ents of the bridetobe. Her fiance is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Harry W. Knight of Darien, Conn., and Hobe Sound, Fla.

title: Yardville Applauds Cell Block Theater
description: YARDVILLE  The audi ence is a tough one, perhaps the toughest an actor could encounter.

title: Delegate Reforms Bring New Types To the Convention
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 8 Shawn and Joy Miller are from Pocatello, Idaho. He is black, she is white; he likes Senator George McGovern, she likes Representative Shirley Chis holm. Both are in their 20's; neither has had any real politi cal experience before.

title: NEW GUINEA TO GET CHEAP ELECTRICITY
description: PORT MORESBY, New Guinea, July 8 (AP)Cheap electricity generated by hydro electric power is coming to the highlands of New Guinea, one of the last places where man remains fairly primitive.

title: Marcia Dianne Mulzac Fiancee Of Capt. Barry Meinerth, Army
description: Lieut, Col. John I. Mulzac, U.S.A.F.R., retired, and Mrs. Mulzac, of Brooklyn and Shrub Oak, N.Y., have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Marcia Dianne Mulzac, to Capt. Barry R. Meinerth of the Army, son of Mr. and Mrs. Laurence L. Meinerth of Gloucester, Mass., and Vi toria, Brazil.

title: Assemblyman Named Judge
description: Assemblyman Martin Gins berg, Republican of Nassau County, has been appointed by Governor Rockefeller to be a judge of the Nassau County Family Court for a term end ing next Dec. 31.

title: The Harmless Dragons
description: We call them dragonflies and horse  stingers and snakefeeders and devil's darning needles, and thus do an injustice to some of the most skillful and harmless of all flying insects. The dragonfly neither stings nor consorts with serpents, and it has no mission from the devil to sew up the lips of children who tell lies.

title: Letters
description: I suppose it's lucky that I will not be attending an ex pensive private university in September. You see, my school, The High School of Art, hasn't held a prom or worn caps and gowns at grad uation for a good 10 years, and I would be at a loss for something meaningful enough to write about to finance my education.

title: WINNIFRED WYGAL
description: Winnifred Wygal, retired sec retary for religious resources of the community division of the National Board of the Young Women's Christian Association, died Saturday at her home in St. Luke's Morningside House, 2914 Broadway. She was 88 years old.

title: BILL STERETT JR, WINS ON POTOMAC
description: WASHINGTON, July 9Lit tleknown Bill Sterett Jr. put an end to Bill Muncey's reign in unlimited hydroplanes today when he drove Pride of Pay'N Pak to a recordbreaking 200 yard victory in the President's Cup.

title: Rousing Amen at Church Ends Festival
description: After nine days of wander ing from concert hall to ball room to baseball park to ferryboat to the streets of Harlem and the grounds of the Brooklyn Museum, the Newport Jazz Festival finally wound up its first season in New York yesterday in church.

title: TV: Democrats' Telethon Is Tough Act to Follow
description: The main event doesn't get under way until 7 o'clock tonight, but, at least in pre convention television cover age, the Democratic party is proving it hasn't lost any of its formidable talent to amaze and amuse. In politics, of course, that talent may be questionable. On television, as they say in the trade, it can't hurt.

title: TORONTO DEFEATS CHIEFS IN SOCCER
description: The Toronto Metros of the North American Soccer League beat the Atlanta Chiefs, 20, at Atlanta Stadium last night 3 hours and 31 minutes after the Pittsburgh Pirates had de feated the Braves, 74, in a Na tional League baseball game.

title: South Vietnamese Remain Bogged Down at Quangtri
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, July 10The South Vietnamese force trying to re capture the provincial capital of Quangtri, which was taken by the North Vietnamese two months ago, apparently re mained bogged down on the edge of the town yesterday un der a hail of Communist ar tillery and mortar shells.

title: News Analysis
description: LAVANG, South Vietnam, July 9With the constant ex presstrain sound of shells speeding overhead, with the ground quaking from tens of thousands of bombs and shells, and with the night sky red with the fire of war, the battle for Quangtri has all the looks of a historic showdown between two mighty armies, It is an awesome specta cle, and there is no denying the deadly reality of the shards of steel ripping through the groves of banana trees, the stands of bamboo, and mercifully rarely, through human beings.

title: 3 MIG's Downed, U.S. Says
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 9 (AP)United States Air Force jets shot down three MIG21's trying to intercept them, the United States command an nounced today.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 9Following is the order of roll call, as determined by lot, and the number of delegate votes for each delegation to the Democratic National Convention opening tomorrow.

title: Expensive LineUp of Legal Talent Enters Case of Raid on Democratic Office
description: WASHINGTON, July 9An array of famous and expensive legal talent has entered the case of the June 17 raid on the Democratic National Committee headquarters in the Watergate complex here.

title: Chou Demands Settlement
description: PEKING, July 9 (Reuters) Premier Chou EnLai, in a speech tonight five days before the resumption of the Vietnam peace talks in Paris, said that the majority of world public opinion, including that in the United States, was strongly de manding that the United States Government end the war in Vietnam at an early date through serious negotiations.

title: A Responsible Press
description: Now that the political rhetoric has begun to escalate (or descend, If that's how one sees the campaign year fath ometee), it is quite apparent that 1972 will be a year of special testing. For the politicians? Perhaps, but it may be just another quadrennium for them. The particular test this time is for American journalism.

title: The Democrats: Deja Vu
description: HENLOPEN ACRES, Del., July 9It is more than a thousand miles down, the rim of the Atlantic to the sandspit called Miami Beach. But by print and video the pulses of the Democratic National Con vention as it assembles are registering a familiar situation:

title: JAPAN'S PREMIER REBUFFS LEFTISTS
description: TOKYO, July 9Premier Ka kuei Tanaka was tested today for the first time since he took office Thursday on a develop ment concerning United States bases in Japan. He responded by rebuffing a leftist opposi tion outcry over a landing of 29 United States B52 bombers on Okinawa over the weekend.

title: IRENE PURCELL DIES; AN ACTRESS IN 33'S
description: RACINE, Wis., July 9 Irene Purcell, a Broadway and Hollywood actress until her marriage in 1941 to Herbert Fisk Johnson, now honorary chairman of S.C. Johnson & Son, makers of Johnson's Wax and other products, died today at their home. She was 70 years old.

title: Police Prevent Gang Clash
description: The police in Brooklyn broke up a potential fight involving 100 members of several youth gangs yesterday afternoon in Sunset Park. They arrested 16, all said to be gang members, on charges of unlawful assem bly and possession of danger ous weapons. The police acting on a tip, entered the park at 3 P.M. as the gangsincluding the Brooklyn Brothers, Brook lyn Saints and Brooklyn War riorswere about to clash.

title: Controls on Ocean Waste Approved by California
description: LOS ANGELES, July 9  California adopted a sweeping program last week to clean up its municipal and indus trial waste discharge into the Pacific Ocean.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 9 (AP)Testimony concerning an alleged attempt to sell pro football secrets to the New Orleans Saints is expected to be presented to a Federal grand jury tomorrow, United States Attorney Gerald Gal linghouse said today.

title: Minister Assails Contestants
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, July 9 (AP)A newly ordained Lu theran minister, preaching his first sermon, assailed Fischer and Spassky today.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: ARMONK, N. Y., July 9Ron Rebhuhn of Port Washington, L, I., and Doug Russell of New York won the Westchester dou bles tennis title today with a 26, 62, 62 victory over Bob Levine of Mount Vernon and Dave Brechner of New Rochelle in the final.

title: Accord on Chairmanship Eludes State Delegation
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 9At tempting to avert a public clash over the chairmanship of the New York delegation to the Democratic National Conven tion, New York representatives of Senator George McGovern offered today a rotating chair manship compromise. But the Democratic state chairman, Jo seph F. Crangle, rejected the proposal.

title: Partial Solar Eclipse to Occur Here This Afternoon
description: This afternoon the shadow of the moon will fall on the earth, casting a 113milewide circle of blackness as the sun is eclipsed.

title: Advertising:
description: All three TV networks have sold out their commercial time for the two political conventions. NBC had the easiest job since it has but one sponsor  Gulf oil for the third year in a row.

title: Dona G. Baron Wed on Coast To Jeffrey Morris of C.C.N.Y.
description: LOS ANGELES, July 9 The marriage of Miss Dona Gene Baron to Jeffrey Bran don Morris, an assistant pro fessor in the department of political science at City Col lege in New York, took place here this afternoon. Rabbi Solomon S. Kleinman per formed the ceremony in the garden at the home of Dr. and Mrs. Henry Baron, par ents of the bride.

title: Israel Sees Guerrilla Plot
description: TEL AVIV, July 9An Is raeli police spokesman said today that the police believed that the bomb explosion in Beiru't that killed an Arab guerrilla leader yesterday was connected with a terrorist plot to send parcels containing bombs to Israelis.

title: Jazz Sessions Prove an Attraction for the Purists
description: When the Newport Jazz Festival's programs at Yan kee Stadium, which were held Friday and Saturday even ings, were first announced, George Wein, producer of the festival, admitted that these would not be programs for jazz purists. To try to fill the 30,000 seats avail able at the stadium each night, he was booking cur rently popular attractions that, he felt, would probably not be to the purist's taste.

title: Israelis to Tighten Rein on the Military in Occupied Arab Areas
description: JERUSALEM, July 9Premier Golda Meir and Defense Minis ter Moshe Dayan acknowledged today that they must tighten their control over Israeli mill tary authorities in the occupied Arab territories, where twice in recent months army officers have been accused of provoking the Arab and Bedouin popula tions.

title: Facials for Men  Equal but Separate
description: They used to borrow their wives' or sisters' cleansing creams, beauty grains or fa cial masks. The braver of them quietly sneaked into women's salons after hours for facials that offered more than the barber's hottowel and onceoverlightly.

title: U. S. 5,000 Mark Is Set By Prefontaine in Trials
description: EUGENE, Ore., July 9Pre cocious as ever and defying cynics who arrived with Stop Pre tshirts steve Prefontaine set an American record in the 5,000meter run with the fastest performance in the world this year 13 minutes 22.8 seconds, in the Olympic trials.

title: GIRL DIES WHEN CAR STRIKES HITCHHIKERS
description: BRIGHTWATERS, L.I., July 9 A 15yearold girl was killed and seven people were injured here this morning when a car entering the Robert Moses Causeway approach struck a group of teenagers who were hitchhiking.

title: Convention Program
description: 1:30 P.M.  Invocation by the Most Rev. Coleman J. Car roll, Roman Catholic Arch bishop of Miami.

title: A rafat Says Killing of Guerrilla Heralds New Blows at Israel
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 9 Yasir Arafat, the Palestinian guerrilla leader, said today that the assassination yesterday of a prominent leader of the Marxist commando group known as the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine was the beginning of a new stage in the warfare between the guerrillas and Israel.

title: A Hungarian Combines Fine Food With a Taste for Exotic Volumes
description: CHICAGO  Last spring, a New York publishing  house executive, getting ready for a convention here, telephoned The Bakery, North Chicago's celebrated home cooking bistro, and spoke to Louis Szathmary, the proprietor.

title: Kathy Ahern Wins on 67 for a 213
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 9 (AP) Kathy Ahern, who was 49th with a 78 after the first round Friday, shot a sixunderpar 67 today to win the $32,000 George Washington tournament by one stroke.

title: Osteen Subdues Mets, 2 to 0
description: For seven innings yesterday at Shea Stadium, Torn Seaver pitched fine ball. Unfortunately for the Mets, Claude Osteen did the same over nine, and the Dodgers made off with a 20 victory before 50,084 dis heartened fans.

title: FRENCH LEFTISTS BACK UNITY PLAN
description: PARIS, July 9  The French Communist and Socialist par ties ratified a plan for a new popular front today. It was the first time since the beginning of the cold war that the bulk of the French left had joined to seek power and defeat the forces of big capital, in the words of the Communist leader Georges Marchais.

title: Thuy Stops in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, July 9 (Reuters) Xuan Thuy, the chief North Vietnamese negotiator at the Paris peace talks, arrived here today en route to the talks, which are scheduled to resume on Thursday.

title: TRUCE IN ULSTER ENDED BY I. R. A.; 6 CIVILIANS DEAD
description: LONDON, July 9The mili tant Provisional wing of the Irish Republican Army tonight announced the end of its two weekold ceasefire and the re sumption of offensive action in Northern Ireland.

title: Decatur Duo Handball Victor
description: Marty Decatur and Marty Catzen defeated Neal Bocian and Howie Eisenberg, 2111, 2117, to take the Amateur Ath letic Union onewall national handball championship yester day at the Brighton Beach Baths in Brooklyn.

title: Rogers and Tito, in Long Talk, Put Stress on Economic Relations
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, July 9 Secretary Of State William P. Rogers, nearing the end of a fastpaced World tour, con ferred today with President Tito on measures to further strengthen United StatesYugo slav relations, which have been flourishing since Marshal Tito's visit to Washington last fall and which were described by Mr. Rogers here as never better.

title: Thieu Reverses Decree Widening Draft
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 9  President Nguyen Van Thieu, in a move certain to be popular among his people, has reversed his own decrees that would have made more South Vietnamese men eligible for military service.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editot;

title: A Protestant Militia Takes Hold in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, July 9They hover on street corners in Protestant neigh borhoods, wearing battle fa tigues and masks. They grip wooden clubs.

title: 12 Held in Prostitution Raid
description: Twelve men and women were arrested early yesterday in Ja maica, Queens, after commu nity leaders complained of prostitutes soliciting customers in the area, District Attorney Thomas Mackell reported. The 12 suspects were accused of approaching drivers in the vi cinity of Hillside Avenue and Sutphin Boulevard and were charged either with prostitu tion or promoting prostitution.

title: Turks Bar Archbishop From Funeral
description: Archbishop lakovos, Primate of the Greek Orthodox Church of North and South America, said yesterday that the Turkish Government had barred him from Istanbul, where the funer al of Ecumenical Patriarch thenagoras I Is to take place at noon tomorrow.

title: JoAnne Simon Bride Of Mark L. Vinikoor
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., July 9 Miss JoAnne Simon, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. Lou Simon, was married this afternoon at the home of her parents here to Mark L. Vini koor, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jack Vinikoor of St. Peters burg, Fla, Rabbi Jack Stern Jr. performed the ceremony.

title: Police Seek 3 Who Murdered Chinatown Leader in Robbery
description: The police were talking to possible witnesses and checking fingerprints yesterday in their search for three youths believed to have stabbed to death Hung Moy, a Chinatown businessman and community leader, in a $2,000 robbery early Saturday.

title: Credit Markets
description: The bond market, forced to survive of late on a skimpy diet of largely offsetting external influencessuch as turmoil in foreign exchnge and rumors of Communist pressure on Hanoi to seek peace in Vietnam  will have a chance this week to feast on a heavy meal of new financings. The amount it can handle without reaching satiety will provide important clues to the nearterm course of interest rates.

title: BUSINESS GROWTH HELD SLOW IN JUNE
description: Business continues to im prove, but at a slower pace, according to the June survey of members of the National Association of Purchasing Man agement.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 9  What may well turn out to be the most important single deci sion of the Democratic Nation al Convention, aside from the Presidential nomination, was reached shortly before 10 o'clock this morning at a small, select gathering on the sixth floor of the Fontainebleu Hotel.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: Senator George McGovern held a slight lead over Senator Hubert H. Humphrey in a na tionwide poll of 630 Democrats who were asked by the Gallup Poll in late June to state their preference among 10 Democrat ic Presidential candidates.

title: Ban on Residential Expansion In Coney Island Area Enacted
description: A zoning change barring fur ther residential development in Coney Island and the Rocka way Playland areas has been enacted into law by the Board of Estimate in an attempt to re vive the two beachfronts as prime amusement and recrea tion attractions.

title: Jacklin, Devlin Card 67's In British Open TuneUp
description: MUSSELBURGH, Scotland, July 9 (Reuters)Britain's Tony Jacklin and Bruce Devlin of Australia lifted their confi dence for this week's British Open golf championship by sharing first place in the Roose velt ninenation tournament to day.

title: Woman Trades in Foreign Exchange
description: PARIS  Mrs. X is a foreign exchange dealer for a European bank. She is one of the few women in the hectic job of trading money. She spoke frankly with a reporter recently but insisted on anonymity.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 9The incredibly tangled series of highly technical procedural bat tles that is expected tomorrow evening on the floor of the Democratic National Conven tion may well decide the fate of Senator George McGovern's Presidential candidacy as well as those of his rivals.

title: YANKS TRIUMPH OVER TWINS, 96
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., July 9 The New York Yankees, who have not been winning many popularity contests back home lately, won their second straight series on the road to day by outlasting the Minne sota Twins, 96.

title: Irish Republic Base Hit
description: DUBLIN, July 9 (UPI) Irish Republican demonstrators threw Stones and hurled sticks, clods of turf and fireworks at riot troops at the Irish Army's Curragh headquarters, 25 miles south of Dublin, today. The army said that the demon strators also set fire to a sports pavilion.

title: OffDuty Housing Policeman Is Dead of Gunshot Wounds
description: A 25yearold offduty Hous ing Authority patrolman died yesterday of gunshot wounds inflicted Saturday night in a friend's apartment at 145 Mau jer Street in Brooklyn.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 9 Everybody who counts moves through the north lobby of the Fontainebleau (rhymes with mountain dew) Hotel, the time he spends there in inverse proportion to his im portance. Hubert H. Hum phrey pumped his way to the black caucus so fast that his handshake with a weliwisher almost dragged the stranger off his feet. George McGov ern was just a blur in a stam pede of secret servicemen.

title: British Freighter Sunk By 2 Blasts in Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, July 10The 11, 000ton British freighter Lon don Statesman was sunk early today by two explo sions while at anchor in the harbor of Nhatrang on South Vietnam's central coast.

title: Rudel Leads a Triumphant Poppea at Caramoor Fete
description: KATONAH, N.Y. July 9 In the 330 years since Monte verdi wrote his final and per haps greatest opera, The Coronation of Poppea, a lot has changed, but not the art of politics. The amoral power struggles to be found re ported in your daily paper al most any day differ from those of Nero and his asso ciates chiefly in that in 1972 the factor of Love now seems to figure less prominently than Fortune. That is slight, if any, progress.

title: A SPACE SHUTTLE IN SOVIET HINTED
description: MOSCOW, July 9  Two Soviet space scientists have called the development of an airplanelike, reusable space shuttle a logical continuation of the space exploration effort, suggesting that the Russians, too, might be engaged in such a project.

title: MAHALIA JACKSON: A CATHEDRAL ECHO
description: For two hours yesterday morning, nearly 3,000 people celebrated in song and pray er a special Thanksgiving Epis copal Eucharist at the Cathe dral Church of St. John the Di vine in memory of Mahalia Jackson.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Nixon Campaign Aide Named
description: PORTLAND, Maine, July 9 (AP)State Attorney General James S. Erwin has been named chairman of the Maine Commit tee for the Reelection of the President. Mr. Erwin's appoint ment was announced today by Clark MacGregor, head of the President's national campaign.

title: 28 Women Get Olympic Berths In Track
description: FREDERICK, Md., July 9  Tirentyeight women were se lected for the United States Olympic track and field team today and 21 others had their hopes kept alive by being in vited to the training camp at the University of Illinois Aug. 3 to 17. They will vie for 10 berths still to be filled.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: BRETTON WOODS, N. H., July 9 (UPI)Cliff Richey gained an easy 61, 60 victory over Jeff Borowiak in the final of the $25,000 Bretton Woods tennis tournament for contract pros today.

title: Nkrdmah Is Buried At Home Town in Ghana
description: NKROFUL, Ghana, July 9 (Reuters)Ghana's first President, Kwame Nkrumah, was buried today at his home town of Nkroful, 240 miles southwest of Accra.

title: POPE PAUL PLEADS FOR AN END TO WAR
description: ROME, July 9Pope Paul VI asked the parties in the Viet nam war today to spare the Indochinese populations further suffering and show courage for peace in the negotiations reopening in Paris this week.

title: Zanuck Leaves Warner To Form Own Concern
description: Richard D. Zanuck, the 37 yearold son of Darryl F. Zanuck, who quit as president of Twentieth CenturyFox Film Corporation at the end of 1970 and joined Warner Bros., Inc., two months later as senior executive vice presi dent, is leaving that motion picture company, too, and is setting up an independent production concern.

title: Jane Cirker Is Wed To A.M. Scheinman
description: Miss Jane Cirker, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard Cirker of Great Neck, L. I., was married here yesterday afternoon to Anthony Michael Scheinman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Victor Scheinman of New York and Miami Beach. Rabbi Stephen Pinsky per formed the ceremony at the Park Lane.

title: The Legal Problems
description: Is it legal to prescribe contraception to one who is legally underage?

title: Gospel Concert Is Short but Oh! So Sweet
description: The relatively small num ber of fans who came to the Radio City Music Hall yester day for a 9 A.M. Gospel Con cert had only one complaint that the performers were not on longer, that the con cert was so short.

title: Advertising:
description: John Mack Carter is re linquishing one of his titles to a former associate, A. Ed ward Miller, who today joins Downe Publishing, Inc., as president.

title: LEVITT BIDS STATE SEEK U.S. DRUG AID
description: State Controller Arthur Lev itt yesterday called on the state's Narcotic Addiction Con trol Commission to seek Fed eral reimbursement for at least some of the rehabilitation pro grams for which it committed $93million to other agencies in four years.

title: Bridge: Tacking Toward the Contract Is Sometimes Best Approach
description: Sailing enthusiasts know that it is not always right to set a direct course toward one's goal. An Australian ex pert from Sydney, where they understand about tacking, demonstrated such strategy on the diagramed deal from the World Team Olympiad this year.

title: Blast Kills 8 in India
description: NEW DELHI, July 9 (UPI) Premature detonation of a dy namite charge killed eight men demolishing a centuryold bridge in northern India, ac cording to reports today. The victims were wrecking a 700 foot span across the Gomti River.

title: Black Pond Triumphs
description: BOSTON, July 9 (AP)Black Pond beat Last Dance by a nose today in the $8,000 Decathlon Handicap at Suffolk Downs. Black Pond covered the six furlongs in 1:10 15 and paid $5.60.

title: Dr. Benjamin A. Gilbert Dead; House Physician of Broadway
description: Dr. Benjamin A. Gilbert, Brotidwqy's house physician, died yesterday of cancer at his home, 27 West 72d Street. He was 67 years old.

title: City Water Main Break Snarls Communications
description: Telephone services of a mid town Manhattan police station, three news services, three tele vision network headquarters and thousands of households in the Times Square and Lincoln Center areas were disrupted nearly all day yesterday when a water main break flooded a New York Telephone Company exchange's cable vault.

title: BENJAMIN J. CHESTER, GERIATRIST, 58, DIES
description: Dr. Benjamin J. Chester, as sociate medical director of the Jewish Institute for Geriatric Care, died here Thursday of a heart attack. He was 58 years old and lived at 175 City Boule vard, West New Brighton, S. I.

title: Economic Analysis
description: The process hasn't attracted very much attention, but bit by bit over the last few months, the Federal Reserve Board has been setting forth a new reg ulatory philosophy that promises to have a pro found impact on the nation's future financial structure.

title: Marriage Announcement 1  No Title
description: Weddings

title: ABROAD AT HOME
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 9It looks as though it is going to be a great con vention for lawyers and journalists. The procedural situation is so com plex that you need a guide even to identify the crucial issues. And the complications introduce a fine dra matic uncertainty into a production that once seemed likely to be a yawn.

title: Martin Blaser, Medical Student, Marries Miss Susan J. Walp
description: ALLENTOWN, Pa., July 9 Miss Susan Jane Walp, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. R. Donald Walp, was married here this afternoon to Martin Blaser, son of Mr. and Mrs. Frederick S. Blazer of Kew Gardens Hills, Queens, New York, and Hallandale, Fla.

title: BREWER IS VICTOR IN CANADIAN OPEN
description: FORT ERIE, Ontario, July 9 Gay Brewer withstood exciting challenges from a tour rookie, Samuel Monroe Adams of Boone, N. C., and an experi enced campaigner, Dave Hill, as he won the Canadian open golf championship by one stroke to day.

title: The Democrats Gather
description: As the Democrats begin their national convention in Miami Beach this evening, the prospect is for the kind bonebruising struggle which party leaders had once hoped to avoid.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Pocono Downs is a gambling hell of modest status three miles out of WilkesBarre, Pa., on the way to Scran ton. It isn't big enough or sinful enough to attract scrutiny by the House Select Committee on Crime, although the concessionaire who feeds and waters the horseplayers there, Sportservice, Inc., has enjoyed that distinction. It's just a vestpocket sink of iniquity with seating accommoda tions for 6,500 customers and a horsemen's colony of 850 to 900. In the dark morning hours of Friday, June 23, the guard at the stable gate got word that the Susquehanna was rising danger ously and additional sandbags were needed to hold back the flood. He put a call out over the public address system, and every body in the stable area turned out. A dump truck was loaded with empty feedbags and dispatched. Then trainers, grooms and watchmen flung more bags into pickup trucks and drove into town to help fill the sacks with earth and bank them up against the river.

title: Land UseOr Giveaway?
