description: After nearly two hundred years there appears to be a chance that the United States will begin to plan the uses of its land. All that is required to enable this country to take a giant step toward a rational system of land use is passage of Senate bill 632. Senator Jackson of Wash ington, its, prime sponsor, plausibly describes it as the most important and farreaching environmental bill ever to be considered by the United States Congress.

title: Smith Wins Wimbledon Crown, Defeating Nastase in Five Sets
description: WIMBLEDON, England, July 9In one of the great finals in Wimbledon history, Stan Smith won today from Ilie Nastase, 46, 63, 63, 46, 75, and what it came down to in the end were all the words that mean courage.

title: Fast and Harsh Justice Urged for Air Hijackers
description: LOS ANGELES, July 9  Police Chief Edward M. Davis of Los Angeles said that he was happy to see the new get tough policy of the Fed eral Bureau of Investigation on airplane hijackings. But he declared that he would go a step further.

title: Personalities Ellis vs. Guard
description: The Pittsburgh Pirates' pitcher, Dock Ellis, is sched uled for a court hearing in Cincinnati today as a result of an altercation with a guard at Riverfront Stadium last May 5. Ellis was sprayed with chemical mace by David Hat ter, who later signed a war rant charging the 27yearold hurler with disorderly con duct. The incident occurred after Ellis tried to enter the players' gate at the Cincin nati stadium without identi fying himself to Hatter's sat isfaction. The guard said he had sprayed mace after Ellis cursed him and made threat ening gestures with a clenched fist. Ellis denied he had in tended to punch the guard and also denied the guard's charge that he was carrying a halffilled bottle of wine. The Pirates have an open date today before opening a series at Cincinnati tomorrow night.

title: Dance: Fokine Revived
description: There are some ballets that have a kind of accretion of glamour about them. It lies encrusted on their surface like barnacles on a sleek ocean liner. But unfortunate ly this very glamour leads to a certain level of expec tation; to be more precise, a certain, almost impossible level of expectation.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Resuscitation Effort Falters
description: SALISBURY, Mass., July 9 (AP)Jeff Willis won't be talk ing about his heroics for the next few days. Mr. Willis, 24 years old, of Salem, N. H., was at Salisbury Beach today when Rita Bonazzo, 15, of Lawrence, was rescued from the surf. Mr. Willis jumped lin to administer mouthtomouth resuscitation. He disclocated his jaw. He and Miss Bonazzo were reported to be doing fine after they were taken to a local hospital.

title: Allison, in Chevrolet, Wins Volunteer 500 by 3 Laps
description: BRISTOL. Tenn., July 9 (UPI) Bobby Allison of Hueytown, Ala., starting from the pole position, breezed to his second straight victory today at Bris tol International Speedway. He drove a 1972 Chevrolet to a threelap victory in the 12th Volunteer 500.

title: HARRY L. BUCK
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 9  Harry L. Buck, vice chairman of the I.T.E. Imperial Corpora tion, maker of electrical and fluid power products and past president of the I.T.E. Circuit Breaker Company, died yester day in Bryn Mawr, where he lived. His age was 61.

title: Jazz a la City Delights Mayor; 45 Programs Drew 100,000
description: George Wein, whose life as jazzfestival promoter was full a hazards in New England, has at last fled the disruptions of Rhode Island for the safety aid serenity of New York City.

title: Ryan Fans 8 in Row
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., July 9 (AP)  Nolan Ryan estab lished an American League record tonight when he struck out eight straight Bos ton Red Sox batters.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: AACHEN, Germany, July 9 (UPI)Kathy Kusner, rid ing Nirvana, won a jumping event today at the Aachen international horse show, defeating a fellowAmerican, Neal Shapiro, aboard Somba.

title: Connally's Message During World Tour Has Been That U.S. Aid Can No Longer Be Taken for Granted
description: KABUL, Afghanistan, July 9 while the United States turns inward for its usual election year selfanalysis, John B. Con nally has been quietly telling developing nations that the era of taking American aid and investment for granted is over.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 9The Democratic National Conven tion will open here tomorrow night with the most exhaustive and probably the most ex haustingreview in the party's history of who is entitled to take part and who is not.

title: Shootings of Air Hijackers Raise Key Legal guestion
description: WASHINGTON, July 9The shootings of aircraft hijackers in Saigon and San Francisco last week have focused atten tion on a new aspect of ??, complex and delicate legal question: When is deadly force justified to stop someone Who is committing a crime?

title: As Brazil Goes
description: In welcoming President Emilio G. Medici to Washing ton last. December, President Nixon declared: We know that as Brazil goes, so will go the rest of the Latin American continent. The remark caused deep resent ment in other hemisphere countries, but it probably contained a large measure of truth.

title: Rock Show, Despite Rain, Stays Cool to End
Sports News in Brief
description: NEWPORT, R.I., July 9 (Reuters)The stragglers in the singlehanded transAtlantic yacht race pushed on toward the finish here today while two Frenchmen still basked in congratulations for breaking the record crossing, time.

title: ExKing Talal ls Buried
description: AMMAN, Jordan, July 9, (UPI)Former King Talal, who died Friday in Istanbul, Turkey, was buried here today in the royal burial ground. King Hus sein, who succeeded his father in 1952, wept as the body was lowered into the grave. The coffin, covered with a Jor danian flag, was mounted on a gun carriage and drawn four miles through the streets of Amman.

title: Nixons Visit Relative Recuperating at Home
description: LOS ANGELES, July 9 (AP) President and Mrs. Nixon today visited Mrs. Nixon's brother, who is recuperating at his home here after sur gery.

title: Lindsay Seeks to Tighten Restrictions on Handguns
description: Tighter restrictions on the manufacture and sale of hand guils the city will be sought from the City Council this week by Mayor Lindsay.

title: 11 on City's Art Commission
description: The Art Commission of the City of New York, which approves the de signs for all city buildings and all works of art on city property, meets at City Hall on the second Monday of each month and is com posed of 11 unsalaried members, four of them ex officio and seven appointed by the Mayor.

title: French Minister Meets Sihanouk Aide in Peking
description: PEKING, July 9 (Reuters) Foreign Minister Maurice Schu mann of France, in an unusual diplomatic move, met for a halfhour today with an official of the governmentinexile of Prince Norodom Sihanouk of Cambodia.

title: 200 YOUTHS DISRUPT JERSEY SHORE AREA
description: LONG BRANCH, N. J., Mon day, July 10More than 200 white and Puerto Rican youths engaged in a rockandbottle throwing melee on the board walk here last night and early today. The disorder continued for several hours.

title: ECONOMIC PANEL ASKS OUTPUT SPUR
description: WASHINGTON, July 9A subcommittee of the Joint Economic Committee of Con gress issued a special report today calling for sharply ex panded Government efforts to increase productivity in both the private and public sector.

title: Joan Kirsner Married to Fellow Lawyer
description: YONKERS, July 9Miss Joan Lisbeth Kirsner, daugh ter of Dr. and Mrs. Morris H. Kirsner of Yonkers and Plantation, Fla., was married here this noon to Robert Agran, son of Mr. and Mrs. Louis Agran of Philadelphia. Rabbi Abraham J. Klausner performed the ceremony.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 9Sen ator Fred R. Harris of Okla homa and a group of Southern populists pledged to Senator George McGovern opened a campaign today to write a more radical tax reform plank into the Democratic platform, a move that McGovern aides do not like.

title: VESTA SKEHAN DEAD; PROBATE LAWYER, 63
description: Vesta J. C. Skehan, a lawyer here since 1934, died early yes terday in Bellevue Hospital where she had been taken Fri day after suffering a cerebral hemorrhage at her office, 145 East 49th Street. She was 63 years old and lived at 120 Cen tral Park South.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: Rita Hauser, cochairman of the Committee for the ReElec tion of the President, said yes terday that she felt that Presi dent Nixon Would be closely contested in the November election, no matter who wins the Democratic nomination. Mrs. Hauser was interviewed on WCBSTV's Newsmakers program.

title: III Russian Taken Off Ship
description: NEWPORT, Ore., July 9 (UPI)A Russian woman who had been evacuated from a So viet fishing trawler underwent surgery today after suffering severe anemia resulting from a shipboard abortion. The woman, Lila Hudyakovana, 34 years old, a storekeeper aboard the 277 foot fishfactory ship Pechenga, was reported in stable condi tion at Pacific Communities Hospital.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: PARTY RULINGS ENHANCE MGOVERN'S CANDIDACY; CONVENTION OPENS TODAY
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 9A series of parliamentary rulings by party leaders brought new strength today to Senator George McGovern's bid for the Democratic Presidential nomi nation and evoked bitter reac tions from the now embattled coalition arrayed against him.

title: STEEL SHIPMENTS EXPECTED TO RISE
description: PITTSBURGH, July 9Steel producers were predicting last week that the second half of 1972 would be better than the first. Although mill orders had yet to indicate anything more than a recovery from the July dip, steel analysts were unan imous in saying shipments would rise from 45 million tons in the first half to 48 mil lion tons in the second half.

title: Man in the News
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 9 James Grant O'Hara is not a delegate to the Democratic National Convention. Yet, for days, he has been avidly courted by Presidential candi dates, labor leaders, old friends, new friends and poli ticians of all Democratic per suasions.

title: Rogers Arrives in Rome
description: ROME, July 9Secetary of State Rogers arrived here to night from Yugoslavia for a twoday visit. He is scheduled to have talks tomorrow with President Giovanni Leone, Pre mier Giulio Andreotti and For eign Minister Giuseppe Medici. Mr. Rogers will call on Pope Paul at the Vatican Tuesday morning before returning home.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 9 (UPI)The National Women's Political Caucus said today that it was seeking to get a woman on the Democratic national ticket and more women appointed to Cabinet posts and other topranking Federal jobs.

title: Air Tickets Bought Overseas Cost More
description: GENEVA, July 9Air travel abroad his become generally more expensive for Americans with do not do all their ticket buying before leaving the United States. How much more expensive depends on the ex tent to which the, dollar has depreciated compared with lo cal currencies.

title: Personal Finance
description: Consumers in the New York area may have won an important victory involving those familiar finance charg es tacked on to their month ly bills from retailers.

title: Cooling the Campaign
description: A miniepidemic of good manners seems to be Making out on the inter national scene. Is there any possibility that it will prove contagious and spread to the United States in this Presidential election year?

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: GAP BETWEEN RICH AND POOR NATIONS WIDENS STEADILY
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., July 9The gap between have and havenot nations is steadily widening, according to data made available here today.

title: PAUL. C. MOONEY SR.
description: Paul C. Mooney Sr., a for mer motionpicture executive who retired from National Screen Service 15 years ago, died yesterday in Roosevelt Hospital. He was 94 years old and lived at 3563 80th Street, Jackson Heights, Queens.

title: SHOP TALK
description: The multitude of Christ mas plates, spoons, etc., etc., will be joined this year by a Christmas jewel. Peter Lindeman has designed an 18karat gold pin with a wintery feel  a deer sur rounded by snow flakes stud ded with cut diamonds.

title: Pressures and Fears Unite Stop McGovern Coalition
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 9This afternoon, representatives of the leading Democratic candi dates met with party officials to discuss convention rules. After the meeting broke up, the deputy from Senator George McGovern left quickly.

title: Soviet Speeds Harvest to Make Up for the Winter
description: MOSCOW, July 9The grain harvest was in full swing to day on the hot, flat plains of the Kuban district of southern Russia, one of the principal So viet producers of highvalue winter wheat.

title: Driver Killed in Sprint Race
description: DU QUOIN, Ill., July 9 (UPI)Don Jackson, 38 years old, of Evansville, Ind., was killed today when he was thrown from his car after it hit the fence during a sprint race at the Du Quoin State Fairgrounds onemile dirt oval.

title: ROYDEN ASTLEY, LED PSYCHIATRY GROUP
description: Dr. M. Royden C. Astley, a former president of the Ameri can Psychoanalytic Association and a professor of psychiatry at the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine, died Friday in Beth Israel Hospital, Boston. He was 61 years old.

title: Cranis and Barker Reach Semifinals in 35er Tennis
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., July 9Paul Cranis of New York, seeded first, and Bob Barker of Sands Point, No. 5, each won two matches to reach the semifinals of the New York State tennis championship for men 35 years and over at the Port Washington Tennis Acad emy today.

title: Cholera Strikes in Java
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, July 9 (AP)Thirtyfour persons have died and 95 others are in hos pitals as the result of a wide spread cholera epidemic in west Java, the official Antara press agency reported today.

title: Are such tactics a force for national unity or a force for dividing this nation?
description: Every vote counts in Presidential politics  but some count more than others. In 1972, the votes which may well count most are those of America's 65 million ethnics. Blocvoters but switchable, America's Italians, Irish, Poles, Jews, Blacks, Puerto Ricans and Chicanos hold the balance of power in more than a dozen battle ground states. Indeed, so crucial are the veto of ethnic America that no candidate, Democrat or Republican, can win a majority in the electoral college without an effective ethnic strategy.

title: U.S. GENERAL DIES IN ANLOC SHELLING
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, July 10Brig. Gen. Richard Tallman, the deputy American commander and ad viser for the Saigon Military Region, and three other Ameri cans were killed yesterday by a North Vietnamese artillery shell during an inspection visit to Anloc.

title: Coach Timmons Steers Ryun On Road Back to Olympics
description: EUGENE, Ore., July 9 The smile on Jim Ryun's face was almost as wide as the eight lanes on the track as he crossed the finish line in the 1,500meter run last night, eight yards in front of his closest competitor, his arms raised in the tradition of a champion.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 9 (UPI)The hoopla surround ing her husband at the Demo cratic National Convention did nothing today to lighten the load of Mrs. George Mc Govern as a housewife.

title: O'Neill Center Presents Conference on Theater
description: The eighth annual Na tional Playwrights Confer ence at the Eugene O'Neill Memorial Theater Center got under way yesterday in Wa terford, Conn., and is sched uled to run through Aug. 6.

title: Carrier America Off Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 9 (AP)The aircraft carrier America, normally a part of the ica, normally a part of the United States Atlantic fleet, has replaced the carrier Coral Sea in the Seventh Fleet operating off Vietnam, the Navy an nounced today.

title: S.I. Cricketers Lose
description: The Mount Vernon Cricket Club defeated the Staten Island C.C. by five wickets yesterday in a league match at Walker Park, Staten Island. Mount Vernon scored 99 runs for five wickets and Staten Island had 98 runs.

title: Suburbs Stiffening Beach Curbs
description: To the dismay and anger of a growing number of New Yorkers, more and more sub urbs are restricting nonresi dents from their beaches and parks and beefing up their policing methods to make the restrictions stick.

title: Wetlands of Suffolk
description: The first serious study of Long Island's wetlands in 34 years comes at the right moment. Last November the voters of Suffolk County had a chance to turn over the zoning and developing of all areas within 500 feet of the seashore to the Suffolk County Planning Board. Un fortunately they rejected that opportunity but, thanks to the wisdom of the county legislature, they will have another chance this fall.

title: Philippines Orders FullScale Attacks On Red Guerrillas
description: MANILA, July 9 (Reuters) President Ferdinand E. Marcos today ordered fullscale military action against guerrillas who are battling with soldiers for control of a gunrunning ship in the northern Philippines.

title: Today Many TeenAgers Are Learning About Contraception
description: There was something strangely incongruousto a pair of over30 eyesabout the 13 young girls sitting crosslegged on the floor of the Margaret Sanger Research Bureau. Dressed in blue jeans and T shirts, with not a hint of such adult artifice as lipstick on their faces, they munched Oreo cookies, giggled, whisperedand talked with unexpected maturity about their intrauterine devices, their diaphragms, their pill prescriptions.

title: Another Woodstock? No: Concert 10 Satisfactory
description: What is there to say about an outdoor rock festival in which almost all the acts show up, there is little viol ence and the promoters ex pect to make a profit? That it was, another Woodstock?

title: Smith Wimbledon Victor
description: Stan Smith of Sea Pines, S.C., defeated Die Nastase of Rumania, 46, 63, 63, 46, 75, yesterday in the Wim bledon tennis final. Page 39.

title: 16 Killed in Pakistani Language Disputes
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, July 9 Authorities ordered a 24 hour curfew in four suburban areas after at least 16 people were killed and many injured today in clashes over a lan guage controversy.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 9 One of the few Governors to be named a delegate to the Democratic National Con vention, Preston E. Smith, went back to Texas today after participating in the Democratic Governors Con ference here.

title: STANLEY STEAMER WINS HUNTER TITLE.
description: SOMERS, N. Y., July 9Mrs. Helen Bilby's Stanley Steamer won two of the three classes over fences and finished fourth in the other to score 11 points and capture the green working hunter championship today in the Northern Westchester Pro fessional Horsemen's Associa tion horse show at Primrose Farms.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE LIES OF ART: Max Beerbohm's Parody and Caricature. By John Felstiner. Illustrated. 283 pages. Alfred A. Knopf. $8.95.

title: LLEWELLYN EVANS OF GRUMMAN DIES
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., July 9 Llewellyn J. Evans, president of the Grumman Corporation and board chairman of Grumman Aerospace, a subsidiary, died today at his home on Tappan Town Lane, apparently of a heart attack. He was 51 years old.

title: Follmer Triumphs in Atlanta Can  Am
description: GAINESVILLE, Ga., July 9  Never in the sevenyear history of the CanadianAmerican Chal lenge Cup has a race ended on the fifth lap of an event sched uled for 75 laps, but that is basically what happened today as George Follmer won the Road Atlanta CanAm.

title: DEMOCRATS END TV FUND APPEAL
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 9 (AP) The Democratic party signed off a 19hour moneyraising telethon tonight with a report of a pledged total of $4,461,755. A. spokesman said that the final figure would probably top $5 million.

title: Church in Latin America May Clash With Rightist Governments
description: BUENOS AIRES, July 9 (Reuters)The Roman Catholic Church in Latin America, rais ing its voice to protest mal treatment of political and other prisoners and to demand so cial reforms, is heading for clashes with rightist Govern ments in at least five nations.

title: T. G. Cassady, Air Ace, Dies; Allied Agent in World War II
description: LAKE FOREST, III., July 9 Thomas G. Cassady, who com bined careers as a leading un dercover agent in World War II and heroic clog fights as an air ace in World War I with prominence in private business, died today of cancer at his residence here. He was 76 years old.

title: Poor and Youth Struggle With Cost Beyond Means
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 9for a sizable segment of the dele gations to the Democratic Na tional Convention  the poor and the youngthe prospects for surviving the high costs of this resort city were as con fused today as the Presidential race.

title: GEORGE VAN COTT, ASSEMBLYMAN, 66
description: George Van Cott, a Repub lican Assemblyman represent ing Mount Vernon since 1960, died yesterday in Memorial Hospital for Cancer and Allied Diseases. He was 66 years old and lived at 4 Laurel Avenue in Mount Vernon.

title: German Shepherd Judged Best Among 1,537 Dogs at Walden
description: WALDEN, N. Y., July 9The second topwinning dog of 1971, Ch. Lakeside's Gilligan's Island, a German shepherd owned by Mrs. Helen Klotzman of Baltimore, showed he had lost none of his old prowess to day. He was named best in show by Mrs. Jeannette Cross at the Wallkill Kennel Club fixture held on Bradley Field, with an entry of 1,537 dogs.

title: Arta Abroad
description: PARISThe recent Cannes Festival underscored what everybody has known for some time: The French cin ema is going through an eclipse. Or, to put it, less brutally: as far as films are concerned, there is France and there is the rest of the world. The biggest hit of the winter was a laborious farce called Les Bi dasses en Folie (a title meaning something like The Zany Recruits), whose screening outside the fron tiers of Francophilla is diffi cult to conceive. The same holds true for the current recordbreaker: Tout le Monde, Il Est Beau, Tout le Monde, II Est Gentil, which might be translated as: Everybody, He's Beautiful, Everybody, He's Nice. Writ ten, played and directed by Jean Yanne, a former disk jockey who achieved celeb rity by winning the best actor award at Cannes, it has been seen by nearly a million Frenchmen to date.

title: Fischer's Favorite Chair Flown To Reykjavik for Chess Contest
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, July 9 (UPI)Bobby Fischer's favorite chair arrived by air freight from New York today to help assure his comfort in his match against Boris Spassky for the world chess championship.

title: Museum Chief to Give instructions on Eclipse
description: Franklyn M. Branley, chairman of the American MuseumHayden Planetari um, will be present at 3 P.M. today on the Mail in Central Park to give instructions on how to view the eclipse.

title: Truman's Condition Steady
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., July 9 (AP)The Research Medical Center here continued to list the condition of former Presi dent Harry S. Truman as satis factory today. Mr. Truman, 88 years old, entered the hospital a week ago for tests involving an Intestinal ailment. He was reported to have spent a rest ful night after walking in hos pital corridors yesterday, after noon and evening.

title: LatinAmerican Economies Take Mixed Course
description: SAO PAULO, BrazilIs South America's 1972 economic bag halffull or halfempty now that the year is half over?

title: ROBERT BLATTNER
description: STAMFORD, Conn., July 9 Robert Blattner, retired co editor of European operations of CPC International, died yes terday in Stamford Hospital. He was 79 years old and lived at 116 Long Ridge Road.

title: Roundup: Pirates Shell McLain in 3
description: The Pittsburgh Pirates are as delighted as anyone that Denny McLain talked his way back from the minor leagues. Before he could be rescued in Atlanta yesterday, the Pirates touched McLain for three home runs and went on to beat the Braves, 74, increasing their lead over the Mets to four games in the Eastern Division.

title: Watch Your Language
description: Youth members of the generation that places so much importance on communicationseems to be in danger of abandoning language. Many young people now are writing a kind of code that signals, in an instant, just now high and hip the speaker is or wants to be. Tills new language, sometimes colorful and expressive, is more often only flat and repetitive, filled with, the same toneless superlatives, the same fuzzy adjectives. The words are few, not enough to fill a dictionary page, but enough to build a vocabulary around: trip, hassle, far out, dig, head, man, together, where I'm at, chick, dude, like (halfbuilt bridge to a nevercompleted simile) and, of course, you know. You know speaks most eloquently for the growing nonverbal ineloquence. What it really means is you know what I mean, so why should I bother to say it?

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: S.I. Girl, 5, Still Missing

title: Office Agency Picks Hong Kong
description: LONDONHong Kong, Brit tain's exotic crown colony 90 miles southeast of Canton, has been chosen as the site for a new branch of an Eng lish enterprise that is ex pected to attract skilled office personnel from around the world.

title: Bhutto Appeals for Calm
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, July 9President Bhutto appealed last night in a radio address for an end to the violence over a language controversy in Sind Province, where he is scheduled to meet tomorrow with national and regional leaders to deal with the first major domestic disorder since he assumed the presidency last December.

title: HARM TO EXPORTS SEEN IN I.R.S. MOVE
description: Efforts by the United States Treasury to enforce a little known section of the Internal Revenue Code are harmful to American exports, and may con tribute to a worsening of the nation's balance of payments, a new study by the Conference Board asserts.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: A July 3 news story says that numer ous Wall Street philanthropists, includ ing one or two past supporters of Presi dent Nixon, will not contribute of their wealth this year to Senator McGovern. They fear the adverse effects of his economics.

title: Port Notes
description: Shipping goods in contain ers across oceans and load ing or unloading them in the port of New York is a fast efficient and econom ical way of water transport.

title: Moth Smell Studied as Clue to Life
description: SEEWIESEN, West Germany Because the extraordinary sense of smell in gypsy moths and other such pests is essen tial to their reproduction, an intensive effort is being carried out here to learn how it works.

title: Cough Brings Up Bullet
description: ATLANTA, July 10 (AP)A 58  year  old Atlanta man has coughed up a bullet after being shot. 38 years ago. Dr. Dan Cantwell said the bullet had worked its way init., Clifford L. Wood's breathing passages and subsequently had been coughed up.

title: Japanese, on Trial, Admits Role in Israeli Killings
description: RISHON LE ZION, Israel, July 10Kozo Okamoto, a 24yearold dropout from Kyoto University, today readi ly admitted his role as a killer in the Tel Aviv airport massacre on May 30, stress ing his ideological affinities with the extremist Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine. The trial of the lone survivor of the airport attack by three gunmen, who killed 26 air travelers and visitors and injured 72 more, opened before a military tri bunal at a heavily guarded army camp on the outskirts of this pioneering Zionist farm town seven miles southwest of Tel Aviv. The issue to be decided was not primarily Mr. Okamoto's in volvement in the massacre he was captured at the air port in the midst of the shooting and grenadethrowing. Rather it was whether he would be sentenced to death, a pun ishment meted out once in modern Israelto the Nazi war criminal Adolf Eichmannor a prison sentence, perhaps for life. Tight Security Measures

title: Coast Bank Terms Losses Of UCB Basel Deductible
description: LOS ANGELES, July 10 (Reuters)The United Califor nia Bank said today the In ternal Revenue Service has ruled that payments to cover losses of its Swiss subsidiary, UCB Basel, are taxdeductible.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: ST. LOUIS, July 10 (AP)  A Federal grand jury indicted two Detroitarea men today on two counts each of air piracy in the hijacking of two Ameri can Airlines jets here June 23 and 24.

title: Japan Truck Plunge Kills 5
description: FUKUOKA, Japan, July 10 (Reuters)  Five people were killed here today when a truck plunged into a canal swollen by rain, the police said.

title: Pakistani Assembly Backs Peace Agreement With India
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, July 10 (Reuters)The Pakistan Na tional Assembly gave over whelming approval today to the peace agreement signed last week by India and Pakistan.

title: Patrick Heron's Art on View in London
description: LONDON  The London scene is remarkably barren of exhibitions of contempo rary British art this summer, but there is one show at the momentPatrick Heron's, at the Whitechapel Gallery that is causing a certain flurry in the papers and can claim a certain transAtlantic interest.

title: MAO AND SCHUMANN CONFER FOR AN HOUR
description: PEKING, July 10 (Agence FrancePresse)Chairman Mao Tsetung met for about an hour today with the French Foreign Minister, Maurice Schumann.

title: Market Place:
description: Investors will remember how the Leasco Corporation got in the news at the height of the conglomerate flap as nervous executives at Chem ical Bank let the word get out that they expected a take over bid from the computer leasing concern.

title: FORD IN PACT TO BUY ENGELHARD DEVICES
description: The Engelhard Minerals and Chemicals Corporation an nounced yesterday an agree ment to supply the Ford Motor Company with catalytic devices to curb hydrocarbon and car bon monoxide emissions from automobiles.

title: 2 Sentenced for Kickbacks In Jersey School Contracts
description: NEWARK, July 10 (UPI)  A Federal court judge in Newark sentenced a former Union City School Board president and an architect today to twoanda halfyear prison terms and $20,000 in fines after they were found guilty of taking kick backs for board contracts.

title: Thomas B. Morgan Dies at 87 Author Led U.P. Rome Bureau
description: GLEN HEAD, L. I., July 10 Thomas B. Morgan, author and former head of The United Press bureau in Rome, died Saturday at his home here. He was 87 years old.

title: Uneasy Rider
description: STORRS, Conn.Driving down from Connecticut early one morning, along Route 84 west of Waterbury, I saw a large shape ahead In the roadway, in the second lane of four from the left. In the far left lane myself, I slowed to pass a large collie lying badly hurt but still alive, its head up and bloody mouth panting. Standing next to the collie was a small white poodle, motionless, on guard and loyal to its wounded companion.

title: ExProstitute Testifies Phillips Demanded a Payoff in Brothel
description: A selfdescribed former pros titute testified yesterday that a few weeks before the 1968 Christmas Eve killings of James Smith and Sharon Stango, Pa trolman William R. Phillips vis ited Smith's East Side brothel and demanded a payoff.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH. July 10 Gertrude Parker is 66 years old and a widow who raises cattle on a small farm in Mo desto, Calif. She sold three heifers for $560 to raise the money to get to Miami to be able to cast a vote on the Democratic convention floor for the nomination of George McGovern for President.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: It must be very convenient to be able to point in the direction of the New York City Police Department whenever a timely scapegoat is needed to accentuate a viewpoint while editorializing.

title: Hanoi Derides Drive
description: HONG KONG, July 10 (Reu ters)North Vietnam heaped scorn today on South Vietnam ese attempts to move into Quangtri City and derided what it called Saigon's imaginary successes in its current push northward.

title: Three Quit Greek Cabinet To Ease a Reorganization
description: ATHENS, July 10 (AP)  Three Greek Government min isters, including the head of the nation's police, resigned today, apparently in a move to facili tate an impending Cabinet re organization by Premier George Papadopoulos.

title: Advertising:
description: Just about the most heavily promoted things on tele vision networks these days are the networks themselves, or at least their planned coverage of the political conventions.

title: African Crafts  A Royal Sendoff
description: King Zwelithini Goodwill Kacyprian Bhekuzulu, Para mount Chief of the Zulus, sometimes called The Lion, Noble Elephant, Thou Who Art Forever, The Peacemaker, or The Bird Who Eats Other Birds, will miss his 24th birthday celebration on Fri day. Back home in Nongoma, in the heart of Zululand in South Africa, the king's birthday is celebrated with receptions at the 16room, white brick, airconditioned palace, and with music and dancing by his subjects.

title: Hanoi Negotiator Arrives In Paris to Resume Talks
description: PARIS. July 10 (Rcuters) North Vietnam's chief negotia tor, Xuan Thuy, arrived here today for the resumption on Thursday of the Vietnam peace talks amid American hopes of an early breakthrough that could lead to an end of the war.

title: Lockheed Names Haack To Board Effective Aug.1
description: The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation announced yes terday that Robert, W. Haack, president of the New York Stock Exchange, had been elected to the Lockheed board of directors, effective Aug. 1.

title: PRICES IRREGULAR IN GRAIN TRADING
description: The news of this country's new grain deal with the Soviet Union sent prices of grain com modity futures up sharply in ac tive trading early in the session an the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday. However, after some reflection, traders evidently had second thoughts and prices at the close were irregular.

title: Stirling Homex Will Ask Reorganization
description: In the latest in a series of financial reverses, the Stirling Homex Corporation  once a darling of Wall Streetdis closed yesterday that it would file a petition under Chapter XI of the Federal Bankruptcy Act.

title: Grain for Moscow
description: Except for the LendLease arrangements of World War II, the $750million grain deal with the Soviet Union is the largest SovietAmerican commercial arrangement ever concluded. It involves a commitment by the Nixon Administration to extend Moscow normal credit facilities up to a limit of a halfbillion dollarsa commitment that would have been unthinkable a few years ago. Moscow, too, has made concessions, not least as regards the rate of interest it is willing to pay on the credits it needs.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 10 Senator Edmund S. Muskie, after four weeks of steering a cautious middle course between endorsing Senator George Mc Govern or opposing him, an nounced tonight an antiMc Govern position on a critical credentials question as the Democratic convention opened.

title: EMRYS JONES
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, July 10 (AP)Emrys Jones, a British stage and film actor, was found dead, appar ently of a heart attack, in his apartment here today. He was 56 years old.

title: Piaster Rate Unified
description: SAIGON, July 10 (Reuters) The South Vietnamese National Bank announced today a uni fied rate for the piaster at 425 to the United States dollar fol lowing a Presidential order abolishing the system of paral lel exchange rates.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., July 10 In the battle over the Demo cratic National Convention's rules tonight, it was the par ty's old hands who were sent onto the floor to mobilize the supporters of Senator George McGovern.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: Cincinnati's second baseman, Joe Morgan, and Chi cago's shortstop, Don Kessinger, took the lead in their respective positions yesterday as fan balloting continued for the National League team for the AllStar game Aug. 25.

title: Play May Be Televised
description: Bobby FischerBoris Spassky match will be covered today on television by W.N.E.T. Channel 13 and by the Teleprompter Corporation on Cable Channel 10, barring legal troubles.

title: Suit to Nullify State Laws Is Dismissed
description: A State Supreme Court jus tice yesterday dismissed a suit by the New York Civil Liber ties Union, teachers' union rep resentatives and others that sought to nullify most of the major bills passed by the Leg islature during its 1971 session.

title: City to Speed Up Medicaid Payment
description: A new system to speed the city's Medicaid payments to hospitalsnow costing $550 million a year for 500,000 in patient admissions, about a fourth of the hospitals' reve nuesis to start this fall.

title: ATLANTIC AIRLINES BEGIN FARES PARLEY
description: GENEVA, July 10  North Atlantic airlines began today the always difficult and pro tracted search for agreement on a new package of fares.

title: Chou Is Reported to Have Softened Stance on Relations With Japan
description: TOKYO, July 10A new Chinese indication of readiness for diplomatic relations with Japan was reported here to day amid speculation that Peking may have dropped a previous condition for the be ginning of talks.

title: Rosalie L. Colie of Brown Led Literature Department
description: OLD LYME, Conn., July 10 (AP)Dr. Rosalie L. Colie, chairman of the comparative literature department at Brown University, drowned Friday afternoon when her canoe over turned in the Connecticut River near her home here. She was 48 years old.

title: All Systems Go For Athlete With Sense of Humor That's Hard to Stop
description: EUGENE, Ore., July 10Still wearing the uniform in which he had gained another berth on the United States Olympic team, Vince Matthews stood in line at the Eugene airport last night waiting to confirm plane reservations back to New York.

title: ANGELS TRIUMPH OVER YANKEES, 43
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., July 10 The California Angels staged a radical revision of the ancient baseball institution of batting practice tonightonly bunts allowed. But then they went out and without bunting a sin gle ball, defeated the New York Yankees, 43.

title: Federal Judge Orders Michigan to Buy School Buses for Integration in Detroit
description: DETROIT, July 10 A Fed eral judge ordered the State of Michigan today to pay for 295 school buses to begin a city suburban integration busing plan this fall.

title: 5 Bandits Seize $50,000 At Chase London Branch
description: LONDON, July 10 (UPI) Two women and three men seized $50,000 being delivered to the Mayfair branch of the Chase Manhattan Bank today and escaped in a blaze of gun fire that wounded two guards.

title: PRICES DECLINE FOR AMEX STOCKS
description: Blame it on the Democratic convention, said a stock mar ket observer yesterday, talking about the 0.10 drop in the American Stock Exchange av erage to 27.28 and low volume of a little more than 3.3 million shares. Investors apparently were a little worried about the McGovern candidacy, but there were some specific reasons be hind many of the sharp drops in price.

title: Convention Notes: Inside and Outside
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 10 The hall was filled, the band was ready, the opening ora tions were under way.

title: STATE WILL CHECK ON L.I. REALTY MAN
description: HAMPTON BAYS, L. L, July 10Secretary of State John P. Lomenzo said today that he would investigate the trust worthiness of a prominent East End real estate broker after Suffolk District Attorney George J. Aspland completed his inquiries into the complex dealings concerning 11,000 feet of oceanfront real estate here bought by the county.

title: SECURITY CHECKS SLOW AIR TRAVEL
description: From Boston to San Fran cisco, travelers on shorthaul, shuttletype flights found them selves in long queues yesterday as Government and airline agents opened their briefcases, checked identification cards and, in a few cases, frisked passengers.

title: Telethon for Storm Aid
description: BALTIMORE, July 10 (UPI) Bob Hope, the comedian, has recruited a number of Holly wood personalities to appear with him July 22 in a sixstate telethon to raise money for vic tims of Tropical Storm Agnes. The stars include Zsa Zsa Ga bor, David Jansen, Fess Parker and Mike Douglas.

title: Connor Takes Third Race In Olympic Star Class Tests
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 10 (AP)  Dennis Connor of San Diego won the third race in United States Olympic yachting trials for the Star Class today as all 26 boats finished the 11 mile sail with only 10 minutes separating the winner and the lastplace boat.

title: Hawaii Docks Shut Down As Workers Press Talks
description: HONOLULU, July 10The In ternational Longshoremen's and Warehousemen's Union, angered by a year's delay in obtaining a new contract, shut down to day all ports in Hawaii.

title: RUBY SHOOTS 66 TO LEAD IKE GOLF
description: BLOOMFIELD, N. J. July 10 John Ruby and Dick Spain, young metropolitan area golfers who attend college in Florida, were the only players to break par today as a strong wind hampered most of the field of 152 in the opening round of the 20th annual Ike tourna ment at the Forest Hill Field Club.

title: Printing Equipment Designed to Reduce Labor Costs Is Shown
description: The National Printing Equip ment Show filled almost two floors of the New York Coli seum yesterday with machines and devices designed to cut down labor costs.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., July 10 (AP)Of the hundreds of writ ers present for the Democratic National Convention, only one has officially listed his occupa tion as novelist. He is Richard Koster, chairman of the nine member Panama Canal Zone delegation. His recent book, The Prince, is about politics in an unnamed Latin country.

title: STATE DELEGATES ELECT 4 CHAIRMEN
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 10 New York delegates to the Democratic National Conven tion reached a compromise in their fierce leadership struggle today by electing four cochair men to head the state dele gation.

title: SHOP TALK
description: There they weretwo 10 foot sailboats. One stood with its sail flapping in the wind. The other was all neatly stowed in a pair of 4foot long duffel bags. Ten minutes later the 95pound craft was assembled and, minus mast and sail, ready for use.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 10The refusal of Mayor Richard J. Daley's ousted regulars and the young reformers seated by the Democratic Credentials Com mittee to talk compromise today paved the way for a bit ter floor fight over the Illinois credentials challenge.

title: U.S. Fines Mexican Captain
description: BROWNSVILLE, Tex., July 10 (AP)A Mexican shrimp boat captain pleaded guilty to day in Federal court to fishing in territorial waters of the United States and was allowed to return to Mexico after pay ing a fine. Epimenio Pastelin Sosa, 45 years old, of Veracruz, was fined $1,000 by United States District Court Judge Reynaldo Garza.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 10A group of about 300 white youths produced a brief flur ry outside Convention Hall tonight when they pulled down a 90foot stretch of anchor fence.

title: Israeli Sex Boutique Curbed
description: TEL AVIV, July 10A Jeru salem magistrate ruled today that the city's only sex boutique shall remain shut. It had been ordered closed by Mayor Teddy Kollek last month after reli gious extremists had bombed a sex boutique in Tel Aviv. The Mayor said that the propri etors had not obtained a busi ness license.

title: Rogers Meets Italian Leaders Suez Reopening Is Major Topic
description: ROME, July 10Secretary of State William P. Rogers con ferred with Italian leaders to day. The Middle East was a major topic.

title: Chess Champions Poised for Match
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, July 10 Bobby Fischer and Boris Spassky, like two highstrung athleteswhich in a way they aretapered off their training today and are ready to face each other tomorrow for the chess championship of the world.

title: COLORADO STOCK UP ON BID BY COASTAL
description: The Colorado Interstate Cor poration hit a new high in yes terday's trading on the New York Stock Exchange on the strength of an offer from the Coastal States Crude Gathering Company to buy 1.8 million shares at $40 a share.

title: Whitelaw Tells of Meeting I.R.A. Aides
description: LONDON, July 10William Whitelaw, Britain's adminis trator for Northern Ireland, told a solemn House of Commons today that he had met secretly last Friday with leaders of the militant Provisional wing of the Irish Republican Army in an unsuccessful bid to save the fragile truce in the province.

title: Jazz Format Adopted
description: A broadcast schedule com posed of 60 per cent jazz has been adopted by radio station WRVRFM. The station began the schedule to coincide with the Newport Jazz Festival here and says it has found strong audience response. Jazz music is broadcast from midnight to 7 A.M., from 2 to 6 P.M. and from 10 P.M. to midnight. There is also an alljazz run from 10 P.M. Friday night to 9 A.M. Sunday morning.

title: Sports of The Times
description: It had all the sinister overtones of a cloakanddagger conspiracy, even to the apprehending of culprits in a predawn raid by agents of the Federal Bureau of Investiga tion. An incriminating document supposedly was seized and enough circumstantial evidence was amassed to con found everyone except Perry Mason. Was this about to be an expos as shattering as the Pentagon Papers? Nape. The document was the playbook of the Los Angeles Rams.

title: Robert Blattner, Official Of Corn Refining in Europe
description: STAMFORD, Conn., July 10 Robert Blattner, former co director of European operations for Corn Products Refining Company, died Saturday at Stamford Hospital. He was 79 years old and lived at 1616 Long Ridge Road. Mr. Blattner was a graduate of the law school of Montpellier, France, class of 1913. From 1919 to 1940 he was manager of the Corn Products Refining Com pany subsidiary in Egypt, India, Czechoslovakia and Yugoslavia.

title: Four Cereal Makers Deny F.T.C. Charges of Deception
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 (AP) Four manufacturers of break fast cereals have filed denials of Federal Trade Commission charges that they engaged in unfair or deceptive methods of competition and business.

title: End to HijackingsForeseen
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 (AP) The Federal aviation admin istrator, John H. Shaffer, said today that airline extortion at tempts might eventually be come as much a rarity as hijackings to Cuba, through sheer frustration of the would be air pirate.

title: EXTEXAS OFFICIAL INDICTED FOR FRAUD
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 (AP) A Federal grand jury in Fort Worth indicted today Waggoner Carr, Attorney General of Texas from 1962 to 1966, on charges stemming from an alleged at tempt to defraud an insurance company.

title: STERLING SEEKS BAN ON TV RIVAL
description: One of the city's two cable television companies yesterday filed a complaint with the Fed eral Communications Commis sion, seeking to enjoin the New York Telephone Company from providing what it called a pay cable transmission service to Columbia Pictures Industries, Inc. and five hotels here.

title: Humphrey Blacks to Vote For Mrs. Chisholm First
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 10Senator Hubert H. Humphrey or Minnesota released all of his black delegates today to allow them to cast symbolic firstballot votes at the Democratic National Convention here for Representative Shir ley Chisholm of Brooklyn.

title: MONETARY GESTURE BY U.S. IS ADVOCATED
description: A leading international banker called on the Nixon Adminis tration yesterday to take the initiative to improve the at mosphere in the international money markets.

title: VINCENTE. ELWELL
description: Vincent E. Elwell, vice presi dent of A. G. Becker & Co., Inc., stockbrokers, who was a mem ber and specialist on the Ameri can Stock Exchange 46 years, died here Saturday. He was 66 years old and lived at 19 Park Court, Silver Lake, S. I.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 10 (UPI) John W. McCormack, 82 yearold retired House Speaker, was the only one of three honorary chairmen present to day for the opening of the Democratic National Conven tion. The two others are former Presidents Lyndon B. Johnson and Harry S. Truman. Neither will attend.

title: OBSERVER
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 10Here is a letter somebody left in an unsealed envelope which was dropped in the lobby of the Attila the Hun Hotel & Solarium Club Beach Palace:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The reported results of an econo metric analysis of the proposals on taxation and spending put forth by Senator McGovern, as indicated in your article Economist Sees Recession if McGovern Plan Prevails (July 5), can be exceedingly misleading to the average layman, who does not know that the theoretical foundations of all largescale mathematical models of the economy provide little justifica tion for such a prediction.

title: Personalities: Back in Groove
description: Tommy Davis, the twotime National League batting champion who has played with seven different teams in a 13year career, is back on the majorleague payroll. Davis, who was released in March by the Oakland Ath letics, was signed by the Chi cago Cubs last Friday. The 33yearold Davis, who led the National League in 1962 and 1963 with the Dodgers, played in two games on Sun day and picked up three hits. Yesterday he was basking.

title: CHILE IS FACING DAVIS CUP REVOLT
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, July 10 (AP)Chile's three top tennis players threatened today to pull out of next week's Amer ican Zone Davis Cup final against the United States un less they get more money.

title: 14 Waive Jury Trial in Panther Deaths
description: CHICAGO, July 10  The longdelayed trial of State's Attorney Edward V. Hanrahan and 13 others finally opened today and all 14 waived their right to a jury trial and asked the judge to decide the case.

title: He's 7 to Beat, Scots Agree on Nicklaus
description: MUIRFIELD, Scotland, July 10Beyond the heavy green course, the wind had put a froth on the Firth of Forth. On the moors of Muirfield, a yellow flag on each green flapped noisily in occasional squalls under puffy, gray clouds.

title: Bridge:MinimumPlay Requirements Attracting More Attention
description: An issue that has long been settled in North America is now attracting some atten tion in the governing circles of the World Bridge Federa tion. It concerns the possi bility of some playersper haps with more wealth than skillbeing dragged to vic tory on the coattails of others.

title: PARK H. MARTIN
description: PITTSBURGH, July 10Park H. Martin, a leader in Pitts burgh's postwar urban renewal program and a former secretary of the Pennsylvania Department of Highways, died today at his home in Camp Hill. He was 84 years old.

title: Nixon Signs TankerControl Bill Aimed at Prevention of Oil Spills
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., July 10  President Nixon signed today legislation that was aimed largely at preventing fu ture oil spills by giving the Government greater authority to regulate the construction and operation of tankers.

title: Health Department Cites Food Outlets For Violating Code
description: Nineteen restaurants were cited by the Health Department yesterday for violations of the Health Code.

title: Two Held in Lottery Fraud
description: Two Bronx sisters were ar rested yesterday on charges of allegedly forging a winning $50,000 state lottery ticket and attempting to cash it. Julia Sussman, 58 years old, of 2548 Bronxwood Avenue, in the Wil liamsbridge section, and her sister, Hermine Torre, 63, of 1651 Montgomery Avenue, in the Morris Heights area, are the first suspects arrested on such charges, according to Dis trict Attorney Burton B. Rob erts of the Bronx.

title: OREGONIANS FIGHT TO SAVE FOUNTAIN
description: PORTLAND, Ore., July 10 Members of Portland's Com mittee to Save the Fountain are battling to keep the city's Audi torium forecourt fountain out of the shadows of highrise con struction.

title: MendesFrance Sees Pullout
description: GRENOBLE, France, July 10 (Reuters)  Pierre Mendes France, the French Premier who negotiated an Indochina peace settlement in 1954, said today that he believed the scene had been set for an American pull out in Vietnam while saving American face.

title: PAKISTANI TOLL 47 IN LANGUAGE RIOTS
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, July 101 (AP)At least 19 more persons in Karachi and in three other towns in Sind Province were reported killed today in the third day of clashes brought about by the choice of Sindhi as the province's official lan guage. Authorities imposed an other 24 hour curfew and turned enforcement over to the army.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 10  The early cries for reform that have gone a long way toward transforming this Democratic National Convention into an antiestablishment gathering have been drowned out largely by the noisy fight over the Presidential nomination.

title: Art Commission Now Approves A Cube for Washington Heights
description: The city's Art Commission figuratively took a second look yesterday at two works of art it had rejected earlier for dis play in Washington Heights. And it changed its mind about onea 60foot open steel cube by Richard Hammer, proposed for a sidewalk hill at Pinehurst Avenue and 181st Street and approved it.

title: Saudi Arabia Warns Companies From U.S. on Oil Participation
description: BEIRUT, July 10The King dom of Saudi Arabia has warned United States oil com panies that the Government is determined to take all neces sary measures to secure parti cipation in their concession.

title: JARRING TO RESUME PEACE EFFORTS SOON
description: UNITED NATIONS, July 10 (Reuters)Dr. Gunnar V. Jar ring will reactivate his United Nations Middle Eastern peace mission early next month with a twoweek visit to New York for talks with Secretary Gen eral Waldheim and the parties in the ArabIsrael dispute, the United Nations announced to day.

title: U.S. Is Noncommittal
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 (AP)  When reporters questioned Charles W. Bray 3d, a State De partment spokesman, about Mr. Thuy's statement, he replied: You will have to wait until Thursday.

title: U.S. Force in Vietnam Cut by 500 Last Week
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 10 (AP)  United States troop strength in Vietnam was reduced by 500 men last week, the United States com mand reported today.

title: IRON WORKERS JOIN THE BUILDING STRIKE
description: About 2,500 ornamental iron workers yesterday joined the strike by building trade work ers that has cut construction on an estimated $2billion worth of projects in the city.

title: LOSSES ARE HEAVY FOR SOME STOCKS
description: The stock market, continuing its recent choppy pattern, was jolted yesterday by large losses in individual issues. To Wall Street watchers, this was a sure sign of general investor wariness amid the uncertain ties of economics, politics and Vietnam.

title: Newsweek, With Elliott Editor Again, Enters Period of Drastic Reappraisal
description: Newsweek magazine has moved into a period of drastic reappraisal in an effort to re gain the momentum that only a few years ago won it the reputation in the magazine and advertising world of a hot book.

title: Profit of Safeway Stores Rises 13.7% on 16.7% Sales Increase
TRIAL OF BREMER PUT OFF TO JULY 31
description: UPPER MARLBORO, Md., July 10The trial of Arthur Herman Bremer, accused of at tempting to assassinate Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama, was put off today until July 31 after his counsel argued that a fair and impartial proceeding would be impossible during the Democratic National Conven tion.

title: Premiers Open Comecon Meeting With Hope of More Coordination
description: MOSCOW, July 10The Pre miers of the Sovietbloc nations opened their annual session here today to assess progress in their ambitious economic in tegration program proclaimed last year.

title: JUNE RESULTS VARY FOR SEVERAL CHAINS
description: Varied sales results for June were reported yesterday by a number of retail chains.

title: OSWALD BACKUS 3D SLAVIC AREA EXPERT
description: BATH, N. Y., July 10Dr. Oswald P. Backus 3d, a his torian in the field of Slavic studies, died yesterday of heart failure while visiting here on his return from Poland where he was renewing educational exchanges between the Univer sity of Poznan and the. Uni versity of Kansas. He was 51 years old and lived in Law rence, Kan.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 10 Fla., (AP)Some 150 seasoned po litical observers from 64 for eign countries are present at the Democratic National Con vention.

title: Firebomb Thrown at Home Of Capetown Churchman
description: CAPETOWN, July 10A gaso line bomb was thrown at the home of a Capetown church man early today only hours after he had urged local stu dents to continue their protests against injustices and Indigni ties in South Africa.

title: Japan Asks U.S. Not to Use Okinawa as Bombing Base
description: TOKYO, July 10 (Reuters) Japan asked the United States today not to use Okinawa as a base for American bombing raids on North Vietnam, the Foreign Ministry said.

title: Algerian Seized in Munich In an Attempted Hijacking
description: MUNICH, West Germany, July 10 (AP)  West German police said they have foiled an Algerian hijacker's attempt to extort $400.00 from Lufthansa airlines tonight.

title: Shubert No Longer a Family Affair
description: For the first time since its founding 72 years ago, the Shubert organization, largest theatrical empire in the world, will be operated by men not in the Shubert family.

title: The Quarter, an Enchantress Who Always Keeps Secrets
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 10 The old city never fully reveals itself.

title: New Commuter Cars Due en Hudson in Fall
description: New highperformance Met ropolitan commuter cars will go into service on the Hud son Division of the Penn Cen tral next fall, the Metropoli tan Transportation Authority said yesterday.

title: Ellsberg Lawyers Can't Question Jurors
description: LOS ANGELES, July 10 The selection of the jury in the trial of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg and Anthony J. Russo Jr. began today with defense lawyers re luctantly sitting mute as the trial judge questioned prospec tive jurors.

title: MRS. E. W. BORKLAND JR.
description: Mrs. Caroline Powell Borkland, wife of Ernest W. Borkland Jr., a partner in the brokerage firm of Tucker, Anthony & R. L. Day, died Sunday of cancer at their summer home in Sherman, Conn. She was 62 years old and lived at 345 East 57th Street.

title: Books of The Times
description: PARIS WAS YESTERDAY: 1925I939. By Janet Flanner. Edited by Irving Drutrnan. 232 pages. Viking. $8.50.

title: U.S. Maoist Youth Finds Soviet a Doctrinaire Place
description: MOSCOW, July 10I did not know I was as American as I am, the black youth said. In the United States, I am considered left of left. Here, I felt as if I were to the right of Governor Wallace.

title: Police Say Major Crimes Are Off 21.1% From '71
description: The number of major crimes reported here in the first five months of 1972 was 21.1 per cent smaller than in the same period of 1971, the police announced yesterday.

title: ExOfficial a Reporter Accused Is Linked to 2d Newark Threat
description: NEWARK, July 10  John Cervase, a Newark lawyer, tes tified today that a former school board member accused of threatening the life of a New York Times reporter had threat ened him the same way during a turbulent meeting of the Newark Board of Education 15 months ago.

title: Trust Suit Against I.B.M. By Greyhound Dismissed
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., July 10 (AP)  A District Court Judge today dismissed a civil suit against the International Business Ma chines Corporation that alleged the company had violated anti trust laws by setting low prices to destroy competition.

title: Afghans Begin Inquiry on Distribution of Food for Famine Relief
description: KABUL, Afghanistan, July 9 The Afghan Government has opened an investigation into relief food distribution prac tices in eight provinces hardest hit by famine following reports of corruption and inefficiency among local officials.

title: ZIONIST AIDE WARNS ON JEWISH EDUCATION
description: GENEVA, July 10  World Jewish leaders were urged to day to insure that Jewish youths are acquainted with Jewish history and heritage so that they may affirm their Jewish identity.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., July 10President Nixon doesn't plan to lose any sleep this week over the Democrats.

title: Eclipse of Sun Seen Over Most of Continent
description: An eclipse of the sun occurred over most of North America yesterday, a rare phenomenon that gave scientists a chance to observe the solar atmosphere and others a diverting summer time happening.

title: Fight Is Intensified For Quangtri City, But Enemy Holds
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, July 11South Viet namese paratroops and marines fought at least five clashes with the North Vietnamese Army yesterday within a few miles of Communist  occupied Quangtri city, but with no apparent change in the overall situation.

title: Man in the News
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., July 10The worst thing any body can call Mike Rappe port is an amateur politician.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 10 (UPI)Ken Hays Jr., the youngest delegate to the Democratic National Conven tion, has not slept since he arrived Saturday and thinks the confusion is wonderful.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: STANTON, Del., July 10 (AP)A 1001 shot beat the 65 favorite in the seventh race for maiden 2yearolds at Delaware Park today when Mrs. Howard Y. Haffner's first time starter, Short Snort, scored by a neck over Piano Solo in a 5furlong test.

title: Islanders Sign Top Rookie To Record $300,000 Pact
description: After six weeks of negotia tions, Canada's top hockey pros pect announced yesterday he had signed with the New York Islanders for what was authori tatively reported to be the high est sum of money ever paid a rookie in the sport.

title: Truman Back on Normal Diet
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., July 10 (AP)Former President Harry S Truman is back on a normal diet at the Research Medical Center here, where he has been since July 2 for treatment of a lower digestive tract disorder. A hospital spokesman said that Mr. Truman's condition was satisfactory but no arrange ments were made for his dismissal.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 10The Democratic National Conven tion refused tonight to require South Carolina to add women to its delegation to give them a voice proportional to their share of the state's population.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: DO YOU KNOW ANY IMPORTANT MAN IN BUSINESS EHO DOES NOT READ FORBES MAGAZINE?AVDT.

title: LAZARD AND MEYER ARE SUED BY GILBERT
description: The investment banking firm of Lazard Freres & Co. and one of the firm's partners were sued yesterday in Manhattan Su preme Court for $25million in damages.

title: Miss Black TeenAge Chosen
description: RICHMOND, July 10 (UPI) Gail Denise Monroe, 17 years old, of Springfield, Mass., is the new Miss Black Teen  Age America. She won the title Sat urday night in a national pageant sponsored by Ronald Charity of Danville, Va.

title: HIJACKER OF PLANE GETS 45YEAR TERM
description: SALT LAKE CITY, July 10 (UPI)  A former Green Beret, Richard P. McCoy Jr. 29 years old, was sentenced today to 45 years in Federal prison for hi jacking a ChicagotoSan Fran cisco jetliner April 7 and para chuting with $500,000 in ran som.

title: Business Briefs
description: The Defense Department announced yesterday that the Navy was awarding contracts and contract modifications totaling $782.4million to the McDonnell Douglas Corporation.

title: 400 Residents of Bergen County Oppose Planned RoadWidening
description: HACKENSACK, N.J., Tues day, July 11More than 400 hissing, booing Bergen County residents objected last night to a proposed amendment to the county master plan stipulating that county roads fronting new commercial developments or housing subdivisions be widened to 70 feet.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 10 (AP) Sixty volunteer lawyers and law students are at the Demo cratic National Convention to provide legal advice to anyone needing it. They are part of Miami Outreach program spon sored by the national Young Men's Christian Association.

title: 29 Jazzmen in Rousing Jam Session on Mall
description: For 31 minutes last night the Central Park Mall was the scene of one of the most energetic and musically chal lenging jazz performances heard here recently.

title: BOYLE IS ASSAILED IN MINE JOURNAL
description: WASHINGTON, July 10  The latest issue of the United Mine Workers Journal has a political editorial that accuses W. A. Boyle of lawlessness and betrayal of the miners.

title: AllLimon
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., July 9Fog 25 years the Ameri can Dance Festival has been presenting moderndance in the bosky setting of Connec ticut College, and no single name has been associated longer with the festival than that of Jose Limn. This weekend he offered a retro spective collection of works from his repertory that fo cused attention on the spe cial and varied performing skills of his finely schooled dancers.

title: Lower East Side Blaze Kills Boy, 2, and Injures 16
description: A 2yearold boy was fatal ly burned and a second child was seriously injured yester day in a fire in a Lower East Side tenement.

title: Mets Suffer 54 Defeat As Giants Get 2 in 8th
description: There were three home runs hit at Shea Stadium last night and a gamewinning, tworun single by Chris Speier, but the 54 victory the San Francisco Giants scored over the New York Mets really hinged on two bunt plays.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Drop at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 Yields on United States Treas ury bills fell in the Govern ment's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: DISMISSED IN 1950'S, 32 EXTEACHERS SUE
description: Thirtytwo men and women who were dismissed from their city teaching jobs in the nine teenfifties have sued the Board of Education for reinstatement, back pay, pension and other rights.

title: 24 Die in Indian Villages As Elephants Run Wild
description: NEW DELHI, July 10 (AP) Elephants have killed at least 24 persons in five villages around Chandka Forest, 780 miles southeast of New Delhi, The United News of India re ported today.

title: U.S. Government Scientists Attended Parley in Cuba
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 The Administration confirmed today that a fourman Govern ment delegation attended an oceanographic conference in Havana late last month. It was the first time this country was officially represented at an in ternational meeting in Cuba in nearly 12 years.

title: Going for Broke
description: The nomination of Senator George McGovern remains as it has since the California primary a month ago just short of a mathematical certainty. What ought to matter now is that the outcome be achieved in the way that does the least possible damage to party harmony and makes a reasonably united campaign most probable.

title: Unified Fight on Drugs
description: The great promise in Mayor Lindsay's move to con solidate New York City's antiaddiction programs under the Health Services Administration, is thatafter inex cusably long delayall these programs will finally begin receiving both the direction and the intensive audit and evaluation they have desperately needed from the start. At present, the H.S.A. is responsible for the city's methadone  maintenance programs, which have been competently run. The Addiction Services Agency, in contrast, is responsible for a variety of drug  free rehabilitative programs; its record is one of dismal dis appointment.

title: MRS. MEYNER BIDS FOR A HOUSE SEAT
description: PHILLIPSBURG, N. J., July 10The wife of former Gov. Robert B. Meyner, Mrs. Helen Stevenson Meyner, announced today that she would be the Democratic candidate for the House of Representatives in the 13th District.

title: IN THE NATION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 10Last fall he was briefly a Presidential candidate himself, running on a new populist platform that smote the corporations and promised power to the poor. Here at Miami Beach, Senator Fred Harris of Oklahoma is sporting an uncandi datelike mustache and is only one of fourteen floor managers for George McGovern, but he's still pushing the new populism. The buttons he's pass ing out (Take the Rich Off Welfare) are among the most popular in town.

title: MAJORITY IS 1,618
description: MIAMI BEACH, Tuesday July 11Senator George Mc Govern triumphed by an im pressive margin early today to regain 151 California votes and take a long and probably de cisive stride toward the Demo cratic party's Presidential nom ination.

title: ROBERT SHAW, 65, U.S. JUDGE, DEAD
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., July 10 United States District Judge Robert Shaw, who over the years sent many corrupt po litical leaders as well as Mafia figures to prison, died last night at Mountainside Hospital here. He was 65 years old and lived here.

title: Merger News
description: A tentative understanding has been reached for a merger of the United Financial Corpo ration of California with the Citizens Savings and Loan As sociation in an exchange of stock valued at $44.4million, it was announced yesterday.

title: Rail Charge on Recycling Is Voided by U.S. Court
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 (UPI)  A panel of three Federal judges ordered the Interstate Commerce Commission today to stop allowing American rail roads to collect a 2.5 per cent surcharge on materials trans ported solely for ecological re cycling.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 10 As Senator George McGovern learned the hard way this morning, this is the year of what might be called group identity at the Democratic National Convention.

title: G.O.P. ASKS STAY IN SUIT ON RAID
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 (AP) The Committee for the Reelection of the President asked the United States District Court here today tO postpone unttil after the Nov. 7 election hearings in a $1million civil lawsuit in the breakin and at teempted bugging of the Demo cratic national headquarters.

title: Thailand Said to Get Jets
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, July 10 (AP)  The United States is equipping the Thai Air Force with 17 A37B Skyraider jet aircraft for use against Commu nist insurgents, the air force announced today. It will be the first time the Thai armed forces have been equipped un der the United States military aid program with antiinsur gency aircraft. The first ship ment arrived July 4 and an other is due Friday, the air force said.

title: Dance: Visual Vignettes
description: Antony Tudor's Romeo and Juliet is a poem rather than a drama. It takes the essence of these starcrossed lovers end offers an extraor dinary series of visual vi gnettes.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 10 (UPI)  Norman E. Jones, a black delegate from Florida, is trying to persuade other blacks to support Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama for President.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Fast Study
description: LAKE PLACID, N. Y., July 8  Elevenyearold Wade Minear spent much of the afternoon in front of his grandfather's tackle shop on Saranac Lake perfecting his accuracy with a fly rod. He seemed able to hit the bulls eye at 50 feet with most of his casts.

title: INSPECTORS CITED ON FUND SOLICITING
description: An association of 200 city electrical inspectors has been openly soliciting money from 2,200 companies whose work is subject to the inspectors' ap proval, according to Robert K. Ruskin, City Commissioner of Investigation.

title: Youths Scattered By Police Tear Gas In a Jersey Town
description: LONG BRANCH, N.J., Tuesday July 11  The police for the second consecutive night yes terday used tear gas to dis perse bands of Puerto Rican and white youths who gathered on the boardwalk and down town streets.

title: New Truce Is Suggested
description: DUBLIN, July 10The head of the political leadership of the Provisional Wing of the Irish Republican Army said here today that he wanted to see a renegotiation of the truce in Ulster.

title: Survey Shows That Most New Yorkers Cannot Afford Unsubsidized Housing
description: More than 200,000 new housing units have been com pleted or put under construc tion here since the beginning of 1966enough homes to accommodate everybody in a city the size of Pittsburgh.

title: Communists Ruled Off Ballot
description: AUGUSTA, Me., July 10 (AP)  Gus Hall, the Communist party Presidential candidate, and Garvis Tyner, its Vice Presidential candidate, won't be on the Maine ballot in No vember because of an insuffi cient number of valid signa tures on nomination papers. The state Election Division said today it had certified only 1,283 names on the petitions. The party needed 3,253 to qual ify.

title: For 2 Minutes, There Wasn't Any Sun For 1,500 Visitors at Nova Scotian Cove
description: MALIGNANT COVE, Nova Scotia, July 10More than 1,500 people came to this re mote, rockridden beach today to witness a total eclipse of the sun.

title: Korean Red Cross Delegates Pledge to Speed Talks
description: PANMUNJOM, Korea, July 10  Red Cross delegates from North Korea and South Korea, meeting today for the first time since Seoul and Pyongyang an nounced an agreement last week to work toward peaceful reunification, pledged efforts to expedite their work.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI, July 10Gov. George C. Wallace, still weak and wan but noticeably more forceful, held his first news conference in more than two months here today on the eve of what many observers believe will be his most important day in the 1972 Democratic convention.

title: Poland and Rumania Send Workers to West Germany
description: TRAVEMUNDE, West Ger many, July 8After years of Communist criticism of West ern Europe for using millions of laborers from less prosper ous countries, Poles and Ru manians have joined the Ital ians, Yugoslays, Turks and Tu nisians who are an accustomed part of the West German work scene.

title: Omelet Party, CompanyStyle
description: According to Mrs. W. Hunter Platt, her kitchen is so small that she doesn't let her young children out of their chairs at lunch.

title: Qaddafi Reported Yielding Premiership to His Deputy
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 10 (AP)Col. Muammar elQad dafi, the Libyan leader, has asked Maj. Abdul Salam Jallud to form a new Cabinet, the Egyptian Merle East News Agency reported today from Tripoli.

title: New Trials for Chicago 7 Go to Judge Outside Region
description: CHICAGO, July 10 (UPI) A United States district judge granted today a Government request that a judge outside the northern district of Illinois be named to hear retrials of defendants and their lawyers who were sentenced for con tempt in the Chicago Seven conspiracy trial.

title: Phone Service in Midtown Restored for Most Clients
description: The New York Telephone Company said yesterday that service had been restored to all but a few of the thousands of midtown customers whose phone service was disrupted Sunday as a result of a water main break.

title: 1,200 More British Troops To Bolster Force in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, July 10More British troops were ordered to Northern Ire land today as explosions, gun battles and sniper attacks struck the tense province.

title: SERPICO CHARGES DENIED BY CAPTAIN
description: Capt. Philip J. Foran repeat edly denied yesterday at his Police Department trial that he had tried to discourage an un dercover polliceman from con tinuing his fight against cor ruption.

title: Steady Beau, Trotting Sire, Syndicated for $4.2Million
description: HAMBURG, N.Y., July 10 (AP)  Steady Beau, sire of the world recordholder Steady Star, was syndicated tonight for $4.2million, the highest price commanded by a harness horse.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: LONDON, July 10 (Reuters)Stan Smith of Sea Pines, S. C., moved up in the men's Grand Prix tennis placings and Mrs. Billie Jean King of Long Beach, Calif., lengthened her lead in the women's standing through their victories in the Wimbledon singles championships, according to figures issued today.

title: News Analysis
description: PEKING  Support of North Vietnam is a ordinal principle of Chinese policy and will con tinue as long as the war goes on, and the United States should have no illusions on this score.

title: U.S. STEEL RAISES STAINLESS PRICE
description: The United States Steel Cor poration is raising the price of stainless steel plate by an aver age of 5 per cent, effective July 31. The increase, which caught the industry by sur prise, was announced over the weekend.

title: Connecticut Weighs $1Million Lottery, Starting Next Fall
description: WETHERSFIELD, Conn., July 10 (AP)  Organizers of the Connecticut state lottery hope to scrap their complex prize system at the end of Septem ber and begin a $1million super lottery, the executive secretary of the state Gaming Commission, Joseph B. Burns, said today.

title: ELLIS CARDS A 65 FOR 4SHOT LEAD
description: BRIARCLIFF MANOR, N. Y., July 10Wes Ellis of the West chester Country Club scored a sixunderpar 35, 3065 at the Briar Hall Golf and Country Club today and gained a four stroke lead after the first round of the 50th annual Westchester open championship.

title: Redemptive Flame
description: Willi Daume, president of the Olympic Organizing Committee, says Bobby Lee Hunter will not be welcome as a member of the United States boxing team at Munich next month because an Olympic athlete should be an example to youth. The 21yearold Hunter, who has been called the best fighter in his division (flyweight), is serving the fifth year of an eighteenyear manslaughter term for stabbing a man to death during a fight.

title: Sun Life President Named
description: Kaufman & Broad, Inc., yes terday named Gerhardt M. Hoff, the 42yearold president of the ITT Hamilton Life Insurance Company, as the new president of Sun Life Insurance Company of America, a Kaufman & Broad subsidiary. He succeeds S. Z. Rothschild Jr., named chairman of the executive committee.

title: Cahill Signs Wage Bill
description: TRENTON, July 10 (AP) Gov. William T. Cahill signed into law today a bill increasing the state's minimum wage from $1.50 to $1.75 an hour, effec tive next Sept. 8. The new minimum affects 102,000 workers in nursing homes and hospitals; on farms; in the amusement industry; in retail establishments, hotels, motels and restaurants; the finance, insurance and real estate in dustries; the laundry, cleaning and dying industry, and beauty culture and other businesses.

title: Phils Dismiss Lucchesi
