description: PHILADELPHIA, July 10 (AP)  Bob Carpenter, owner of the Philadelphia Phillies, saying that he couldn't dis charge the players, dismissed the field manager, Frank Luc chesi, and named General Man ager Paul Owens to replace him today.

title: FERNANDE SCORES UPSET AT BIG A
description: Mike Venezia continues to be overlooked by the local fans and he continues to come through with the longpriced winners. He does not only confine his riding successes to the early claiming races, but he also makes his presence felt in main events.

title: Lawrence Jones of Vermont Was State Attorney General
description: RUTLAND, Vt., July 10 (AP) Lawrence C. Jones, who was state Attorney General for five terms and was president of the United States Attorneys Gen eral Association in 1938, died yesterday. He was 78 years old.

title: Seoul Sets Vietnam Pullout
description: SEOUL, South Korea, July 10 (AP)South Korea will with draw its 37,000 troops still in Vietnam as soon as possible after Aug. 31, the Defense Min ister, Dr. Yu Jae Hung, told the National Assembly today.

title: DR. VIRGIL G. DAMON, GYNECOLOGIST, DEAD
description: Dr. Virgil G. Damon, who re tired in 1966 as clinical profes sor of obstetrics and gynecol ogy at the College of Physicians and Surgeons of Columbia Uni versity, died Sunday in Colum biaPresbyterian Medical Cen ter. He was 77 years old and lived at 12 East 86th Street and in Darien, Conn.

title: 2 Pilots Die in Thai Crash
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, July 10 (UP!) Two American pilots were killed Friday when their F4 Phantom jet crashed at the Ubonratchthani air base about 200 miles northeast of Bang kok, a United States Embassy spokesman reported today. The pilots were identified as Maj. Harland M. Davis Jr., 37 years old, of Bridgeton, N.J., and First Lieut. Frederick Koss, 26, of Bridgeport, Ohio. They were trying to land during a rain storm on returning from a combat mission over Vietnam, the spokesman said.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 10 (UPI) A cub reporter named Jess Unruh stood outside a closed California caucus last night and complained about the barring of newsmen.

title: Blast on British Freighter Believed Linked to Vietcong
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 10 (Reuters)Military sources reported that longshoremen un loading rice from a British freighter early this morning at the South Vietnamese port of Nhatrang had planted time fused explosives that ripped two holes in the ship's hull.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Mayor Lindsay an nounced yesterday that New York City signed a record $920million in con struction contracts on new projects other than hous ing in the fiscal year that ended June 30. The amount doubled in dollar value the contracts awarded in the 197071 fiscal year.

title: Timber Ban Extended
description: WASHINGTON. July 10 (AP) A Federal restraining order banning timber harvests from undeveloped national forests has been extended until July 20 to give parties in an environ mental dispute more time to present their views.

title: NIXON TRADE PLAN FOR SOVIET SEEKS DEBT REPAYMENT
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 The Nixon Administration has worked out a tentative formu la to persuade the Soviet Union to pay World War II lend lease debts in return for cred its from the United States Gov ernment and for equal tariff treatment in this country, a White House official said today.

title: PEACE PROSPECTS COULD AID DOLLAR
description: LONDON, July 10A nego tiated settlement of the Vietnam war could help the weakened dollar recover in Europe's moneytrading centers, foreign exchange dealers said as the dollar strengthened a little today, just three days before renewed peace talks begin in Paris.

title: Nixon Presence Felt, Not Seen, at San Clemente
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., July 7The bronze Richard Nixon that sits on the sec ond floor of the city hall is far more visible presence to the people here than is the real man who was sitting today in his beautiful estate on the bluff above the sea.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: Walter Kennedy, National Basketball Association com missioner, has called a special meeting of the Board of Governors here today to discuss transfer of ownership of the Boston Celtics and Chicago Bulls.

title: GLENBY TROTTER IN INTERNATIONAL
description: Keystone Hilliard of the United States accepted yester day an invitation to complete the starstudded eighthorse field for Saturday's 1mile, $125,000 Roosevelt Interna tional world championship trot at Roosevelt Raceway, West bury, L.I.

title: C.A.B. Investigating Report Of Overcharges by Airlines
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 (UPI) The Civil Aeronautics Board is looking into a report that many United States airlines are overcharging their passengers on connecting flights, Repre sentative Seymour Halpern, Re publican of Queens, said today.

title: Robert Weede, ExMet Baritone Who Starred on Broadway, Dies
description: Robert Weede, who went on to a career in Broadway musi cals, such as The Most Happy Fella and Milk and Honey, after having sung leading bari tone roles at the Metropolitan Opera in the nineteenthirties and forties, died Sunday night in Walnut Creek, Calif. He was 69 years old.

title: June Retail Sales Trailed May Level But Topped '71
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 Retail sales, on the basis of preliminary figures, declined in June from the booming May level but were still about 7.5 per cent above June a year ago, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: MRS. WALTER VAN RIPER
description: Mrs. Verna Williams Van Riper, wife of Walter D. Van Riper, the lawyer and former New Jersey Attorney General and Superior Court judge, died Sunday at their home, 22 Har vard Terrace, West Orange, N.J. She was 77 years old.

title: 6 Sentenced in Plot to Hide Nevada Hotel Ownership
description: LOS ANGELES, July 10 (UPI) Federal District Judge David W. Williams sentenced three reputed crime figures to terms of four years each and fines ranging from $10,000 to $30,000 for plotting to conceal the own ership of the Frontier Hotel and casino on the Las Vegas Strip before its sale to Howard Hughes.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: BERLIN, July 10 (UPI)Roland Matthes, East Ger many's double gold medalist at the 1968 Olympics in Mexico broke his 200meter world backstroke record to day with a clocking of 2 minutes 2.8 seconds at the East German swimming championships in Leipzig, the official news service A.D.N. said. Matthes clipped 2.8 seconds from his previous mark.

title: Roundup: Protests Fail to Deter Perry
description: Gaylord Perry spent 10 seasons with the San Fran cisco Giants, won 134 games in the National League and seldom did a game pass that he wasn't accused of throw ing an illegal pitch.

title: Rochester Robbers Gouge Out The Eyes of 2 of Their Victims
description: ROCHESTER, July 10  Thieves gouged out the eyes of a grocer and a gasolinestation attendant in two robberies yes terday and early today. The victims were also beaten and choked into unconsciousness.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: As a longtime resident and former coop board officer of New York State sponsored Mitchell  Lama housing, I note with dismay Mayor Lindsay's an nouncement of a review of the pro cedure for verifying incomes of resi dents and that the verification proc ess is an invasion of privacy. The law under which these housing develop ments are built specifically provides that if one wishes to buy into the cooperative that there are income limi tations. It further provides that should the cooperator's income subsequently go beyond the statutory limit that a surcharge must be paid.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Although Jack Luria was correct in pointing out that Riverdale has re sisted attempts to build lowincome housingwhich I agree is a serious moral errorhe painted a onesided picture of our neighborhood. [A Pox on You, Riverdale, OpEd June 21.]

title: Chemetron Director Resigns
description: The Chemetron Corporation announced yesterday that Charles F. Chaplin had resigned as a director of the company, effective immediately. Cheme tron also said that a suit filed in Federal District Court in New York against Mr. Chaplin, the Sun Chemical Corporation and Elgin National Industries, Inc., and the chief executive of ficers of the two companies had been dismissed.

title: JOHN M'GOHEY, 78, FORMER U.S. JUDGE
description: A Mass of the Resurrection for John F. X. McGohey, re tired Federal judge of the Southern District, was offered yesterday in the Roman Catho lic, Church of the Epiphany, Second Avenue and 22d Street.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The seedcorn of our nation is our youth  all our youth. Their future and that of our nation are bound up in a sound, comprehensive, articulated system of educational systems.

title: Madrid Legislator Winning Her Fight to Bring Spanish Women Into the Adult World, Like Men, at 21
description: MADRID, July 10A major legal barrier to the equality of women in Spanish society is about to fall with changes in the civil code making them, like men, adults at the age of 21.

title: AIR ATTACKS BEGUN ON PHILIPPINE REDS
description: MANILA, July 10 (AP)Air and naval units of the Philip pine armed forces started bombing suspected Com munist guerrilla positions today. The bombing began in bad weather on positions in Isabela Province, on the main Philip pine island of Luzon.

title: Advertising:
description: The fiveyearold Televi sion Testing Company, now a joint venture of Audits and Surveys and the Tele prompter Corporation, has moved into the area of pre testing TV commercials. It thinks its system is the best, just as the other companies in the field think theirs are.

title: Emily Gordon Wed To Dr. George Sher
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., July 10Miss Emily Fox Gor don, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Kermit Gordon of Wash ington and Williamstown, was married here in the gar den at her parents home yesterday afternoon to Dr. George Allen Sher of New York. He is the sort of Mr. and Mrs. Daniel Sher of Clif ton, N. J.

title: Whatever Happened to China?
description: ITHACA, N.Y.  George McGovern announced his candidacy for the Presi dency by calling for a total reappraisal of U.S. policy toward Asia, especially the People's Republic of China. That was a very courageous position for a Democratic politician  let alone a then longshot Presidential candidate to take. But McGovern took it, al though he was subsequently pre empted on the China issue by Richard Nixon.

title: Pregnant Teachers Upheld
description: CHICAGO, July 10 (AP)A policy of the Chicago Board of Education requiring pregnant teachers to leave their jobs after the fifth month of preg nancy for six months without pay is unconstitutional, a Fed eral judge ruled today Judge Richard W. McLaren of United States District Court also or dered that the board should allow pregnant teachers to con tinue working as long as their physicians approved.

title: Credit Markets
description: The bond market trod cautiously yesterday as it began to confront a large slate of new corporate and taxexempt fi nancing. Most prices retreated in light to moderate trading activity.

title: and Timing Reform
description: Whatever the results of the nominating process at their national gathering in Miami Beach, the least sen sible thing the Democrats can do is to fix the course of further party reform in the turmoil of the convention. There is a chance that in order to revive party unity, Senator McGovern may join those who favor deferring all discussion of a new charter, which would drastically alter the control and operations of the party. Even the current year's experience would seem to dictate that he should. If farreaching reforms are also to be viable and just, they require reasonable deliberation by a fair representation of the party.

title: Jersey Wins Right To Withhold Name Of Informer in Case
description: TRENTON, July 11 (AP)  An appeals court ruled today that the state did not have to disclose the name of an in former in a bookmaking case in Gloucester County.

title: Market Place: Gains Forecast For Gold Stocks
description: There's always talk in ar cane circles about gold and its role in the modern world. Few Americans know much about it since they have not been permitted to own gold outright since the dark days of the Depressionback in 1932.

title: Israeli General Promised A Suicide Gun to Terrorist
description: JERUSALEM, July 11  A leading Israeli general admitted today that he had fraudulently promised a suicide opportunity to the lone surviving Japanese terrorist who took part in the Tel Aviv airport massacre. He said he had given the promise in return for information from the prisoner during the first hours after the raid.

title: Life in Ghana Quickly Back to Normal After Weekend Ceremony to Bury Nkrumah in His Home Town
description: ACCRA, Ghana, July 11  The red and black cloths that are symbols of mourning here still cling to a few of bustling Accra's army of scurrying taxis. But most of Ghana has quickly returned to routine following a weekend of ceremony devoted to the burial of Kwame Nkru mah, the charismatic and con troversal first President of Ghana.

title: DEMOCTRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11 At the end this morning, hundreds of delegates sur rendered to their emotions. Anti  McGovern delegates watched months of work go down the drain with the rollcall on seating the pro McGovern California delega tion and could contain them selves no longer.

title: AMBIGUOUS VIEW MARS NEW DANCE
description: Kathryn Posin, a choreogra pher associated with Dance Theater Workshop, presented a new piece, Summer of '72, under the workshop's auspices Monday night at Circle in the Square.

title: EL PASO GAS ASKS F. P. C. REVERSAL
description: WASHINGTON, July 11  The El Paso Natural Gas Com pany requested the Federal Power Commission today to re consider the terms of its de cision last month authorizing in principle the importing of Algerian natural gas to the United States under a 25year contract.

title: Gran Kan Takes Chase; Horse Dies at Monmouth
Letters to the Editor
description: The Association for a Better New York believes that the Public Service Commission's recent policy decision on institutional advertising is not truly in the public's interest.

title: GRAIN FUTURES SHOW SHARP RISE
description: Grain futures prices rose sharply in active trading yes terday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: YANKEES' 6RUN 3D BEATS ANGELS, 73
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., July 11 The Yankees erupted with six runs in the third inning tonight to square their series against the California Angels, 73, and insure their first winning trip of the season.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11 Frank W. King was back on the convention floor tonight, hoping his Ohio delegation would not have to pass so often. But for him and the other delegates, the hot pas sions had abated overnight.

title: Bernstein Planning To Take a Year Off For Writing Music
description: Leonard Bernstein will take nearly a year off from public performing to give his undi vided attention to writing music.

title: Ehrichs Card 73 and Win Mixed Invitation Tourney
description: DEAL, N.J., July 11Mr. and Mrs. John Ehrich of Rock Spring won lowgross honors in the Garden State Women's Golf Association's mixed invita tion tournament today at the Hollywood Golf Club.

title: U.S. TO MAKE PLEA FOR FOREIGN MEAT
description: WASHINGTON, July 11As part of the Administration's ef fort to hold down meat prices, the State Department today in vited the Ambassadors of 12 meat exporting countries to a meeting tomorrow to drum up additional exports of beef and veal to the United States.

title: Newspaper Official Named
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., July 11 (UPI)Robert W. Murphy was appointed today as general manager of the West Virginia Newspaper Publishing Com pany, publisher of Morgan town's daily newspapers, the afternoon Post, the morning DominionNews and the Sunday DominionPost. Mr. Murphy, who is 42 years old, succeeds William A. Townes, who re cently retired.

title: 39 TENNIS COURTS TO GET BUBBLES
description: In a major boon for the city's growing number of tennis loversof whom he is one Mayor Lindsay announced yes terday a $3million program of resurfacing, winterizing or lighting for nearly a third of the city's 515 intensively used municipal tennis courts.

title: 7 PRISONERS HERE ACCUSE 6 JUSTICES
description: A Federal Judge agreed yes terday to hear preliminary ar guments in a suit brought by seven inmates of the Brooklyn House of Detention who say that six State Supreme Court justices in Kings County sys tematically violated their con stitutional rights.

title: Merger News
description: The British Petroleum Com pany, Ltd., and the Standard Oil Company (Ohio) said yes terday they were discussing the renegotiation of the terms of the August, 1969, agreement between them.

title: Aloof Amish Impersonated at Pennsylvania Dutch Folk Festival
description: KUTZTOWN, Pa., July 8 More than 130,000 persons from across the country and abroad crowded this little Pennsylvania Dutch town of 4,400 this week, staying at motels and private homes for 20 miles around.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Joe Frazier was in the oakpaneled living room of the big house on Brewton Plantation when the blow fell. A mockingbird was singing from a tupelo gum outside the open window, and the faintest of breezes stirred the Spanish moss festooning the live oaks. Summertime, and the living was easy when the radio brought word that the heavy weight champion of all creation was champion no longer in Oklahoma. Oklahoma? Joe Frazier said. Where's that at? I don't recall no fights there. As a matter of fact, there hasn't been a good scrap in Indian Territory since the Treaty of Medicine Lodge, but the Oklahoma Boxing Commis sion, in a tizzy over a proposed match between Oscar Bonavena and George Fore man in Oklahoma City in the fall, has announced that it would borrow Frazier's title for the benefit of the promotion and recognize the winner as champion.

title: Soviet Asks Moves for Pact To Ban Chemical Warfare
description: GENEVA, July 11The So viet Union urged the disarma ment conference here today to begin concrete negotiations on the terms of a pact to out law chemical weapons in order to break the present unfortu nate deadlock.

title: APPEAL ON CON ED POSSIBLE UPSTATE
description: GOSHEN, N. Y., July 11 (AP) The Orange County attorney says the County Legislature may decide Friday whether an appeal to the state's highest court will be taken to stop the construction of an overhead power line opposed by some local environmental groups.

title: New Antisubversive Law Takes Effect in Uruguay
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 11 (UPI)The Government to day lifted the state of internal war during which security forces have severely cracked down on Tupamaro guerrillas in the last three months.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The HewlettPackard Com pany yesterday announced that a registration will be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission covering a secon dary offering of about 300,000 shares of its common stock. The offering, which the com pany said would probably be made in August, will consist of stock to be sold by certain ben eficiaries of gifts made by Mr. and Mrs. David Packard when he left his position as United States Deputy Secretary of De fense. Mr. Packard is now chairman of the board of the company. The company's stock, traded on the New York Stock Exchange, closed yesterday at 66, down 3.

title: Trucks Sabotaged in Lisbon
description: LISBON, July 11 (Reuters) Thirteen heavy trucks destined for the Portuguese Army were badly damaged in a sabotage bomb attack here early today.

title: Off Off Broadway Aims to Be Right On
description: Off Off Broadway, a di verse collection of noncom mercial playhouses, is today the most productive theater in New York. It stages some 500 shows a year, compared with 100 for Broadway and Off Broadway combined. Un like its commercial cousins. Off Off never stops. Plays open every week all year long. It is the process, not the product, that is impor tant.

title: ELLSBERG PANEL IS SPLIT ON WAR
description: LOS ANGELES, July 11The judge's questioning today of prospective jurors in the trial of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg and An thony J. Russo Jr. indicated deep division of opinion about the Vietnam war.

title: Lettuce Boycott Urged
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (UPI) The United States Catholic Conference said today that its committee on social develop ment had recommended a boy cott of all iceberg lettuce ex cept that marked with the black Aztec eagle of the United Farm Workers Union.

title: Search Mounts on Staten Island For Girl Missing Since Friday
description: The search for a 5yearold Staten Island girl missing since Friday was intensified yester day when neighbors in the New Dorp section collected funds to offer a reward for information.

title: $70Million Real Estate Empire Ruled Bankrupt by U.S. Referee
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 11 (AP)  Federal Bankruptcy Referee Thomas Curtin has ruled that the $70million realestate em pire of Martin M. Decker is bankrupt and cannot be reor ganized.

title: SOVIET LAUNCHES ITS 500TH COSMOS
description: MOSCOW, July 11The So viet Union announced today the launching of the 500th un manned satellite of its Cosmos series, the cover name for a wideranging space exploration program that was started in 1962.

title: Hanoi Claims 6 U. S. Planes
description: HONG KONG, Wednesday, July 12 (Reuters)North Viet nam said today that six United States aircraft had been shot down in North Vietnam and many U.S. pilots captured.

title: Patrolman Is Stabbed While on Way to Work
description: An offduty patrolman on his way to the 25th Precinct sta tion house in East Harlem was stabbed last night when he was accosted by two wouldbe mug gers at 115th Street and Third Avenue, the police reported.

title: DOMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11 The morning was heavy with heat and humidity, and a summer haze grayed the horizon and silenced the palm trees on the ocean's edge. The first session of the Democratic National Conven tion had ended an hour be fore dawn, and most of the delegates still slept deeply in hotel rooms along Collins Avenue as the city came to life and the first traffic jams of the day materialized along he oceanfront roadway that connects the hotels with the convention center.

title: Regional Variance in Cancer Incidence Under Study by World Health Agency
description: LYONS, France, July 4The chances that a woman living in the eastern Gonbad district of Iran will contract cancer of the esophagus  the passage from throat to stomachdur ing the year are extraordinarily large, according to a recent survey. The annual incidence, the survey showed, is 174 per 100,000.

title: Donaldson Deal Approved
description: Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette Inc., the investment house, an nounced yesterday that the board of governors of the New York Stock Exchange had ap proved in principle the pur chase by the American Express Company of a 25 per cent equity interest in D.L.J. The majority of the interest will be sold to American Express by existing stockholders and D.L.J. itself will sell a small portion.

title: Business Briefs
description: COLOMBO, SriLanka, July 11The SriLanka rupee, linked to the United States dollar since last November, has been linked once again with sterling. This decision may avoid direct devaluation, but commercial circles in SriLanka described the relinking as an oblique devaluation.

title: McGovern Said to Narrow Choice for Running Mate
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11 Senator George McGovern, the Democratic Presidential nomi nation within his grasp, was reported by his associates today to have narrowed his choices for a running mate to three or four persons. But there was no agreement among his advisers on which three or four.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A 26 per cent reduction in taxicab robberies and a sharp drop in driver homicides were reported yesterday by Michael J. Lazar, chairman of the city's Taxi and Limousine Commission, which began functioning a year ago, Mr. Lazar said robberies dropped from 3,153 in 1970 to 2,311 in 1971.

title: Mr. O'Brien, Your Party Is Something Else
description: Somebody noticed that you looked a mite harassed on TV and thought a friend ought to write a letter to cheer you up.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, July 11Discussions on trade matters between the United States and Japan will take place in the last week of July, but they will not be negotiations, United States Government officials said today.

title: Celtic Sale Upheld, but Not Bulls'
description: The site of next January's National Basketball Association AllStar Game and of all Chi cago Bulls homes games is still uncertain, it developed yester day as the N.B.A.'s board of governors approved the sale of the Boston Celtics, but rejected a proposed sale of the Bulls.

title: Fund Group Shifts to NoLoad Format
description: Financial Programs, Inc., a Denverbased mutual  fund group with assets of more than $500million, disclosed yesterday that it was no longer charging sales com missions on mutual funds; in stead it is converting immedi ately to a noload fund.

title: 2 ExProstitutes Say Phillips Frequented Brothel in 1968
description: Two more former prostitutes took the witness stand here yesterday to testify that Pa trolman William R. Phillips had frequented the various apartments where James Smith ran his brothel in 1967 and 1968.

title: Woman in the News
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11 During the 1970 campaign in Connecticut, in which she managed the successful in surgent campaign of the Rev. Joseph D. Duffey for the Democratic Senatorial nom ination, Anne Wexler made it a point to have lunch once a week at Frank's, the hangout of the Hart ford politicians, with John Bailey, the leader of the Connecticut regu lars. The two of them were separated by chasms of age, ideology and partisanship. Mr. Bailey was trying his best to stop Mr. Duffey cold, but they had two things in common, one trivial and one essential.

title: Michigan Plans to Appeal Court Decisions on Busing
description: DETROIT, July 11 (UPI) Michigan will file emergency appeals of two Federal court rulings that set in motion de velopment of the largest cross district school busing program in the nation, the state's two highest elected officers said today.

title: Fox Forms Recording Unit
description: The Twentieth CenturyFox Corporation announced yester day the formation of a new re cording subsidiary, 20th Cen tury Records.

title: Credit Markets
description: The bond market waded through a substantial volume of new financing yesterday and managed to attract inves tors without significantly rais ing the level of interest rates.

title: JEAN MADEIRA, 53, A MET CONTRALTO
description: Jean Madeira, a contralto who sang leading roles with the Metropolitan Opera from 1956 to 1971, died of cancer Monday night at the Jane Brown Hospital in Providence, R. I. She was 53 years old.

title: End of a Trail
description: Hubert Humphrey reached the end of the Presidential trail in Miami Beach yesterday and, like so many men before him in American history, he found there only a broken dream.

title: Tickets to Go on Sale For the Richest Lottery
description: ALBANY, July 11 (UPI) Tickets for the richest lottery ever held in the United States will go on sale tomorrow.

title: Cuba Becomes Full Member of Soviet Economic Bloc
description: MOSCOW, July 11The So viet bloc's economic alliance formally admitted Cuba today as its ninth member nation, ex tending the prospects of ulti mate economic integration of the Communist countries to the Western Hemisphere.

title: AMEX DECLINES IN SLOW TRADING
description: Prices continued to decline on the American Stock Ex change yesterday, dropping the index to 27.17, off 0.11, in slug gish trading of 3.2 million shares. The pessimistic trend was also carried into the over thecounter market, where the NASDAQ index closed at 138.23, off 0.61.

title: Buchan First in Star Race, Trails Holt by 4 Points
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 11 (AP)Bill Buchan of Mercer Island, Wash., won today's fourth race in the United States Olympic Star Class yachting trials. The victory was his second in the series, giving him 10 negative points over all.

title: Fanny May Auction Yields Stable at Biweekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (UPI) Yields on Governmentbacked mortgages were largely un changed in the Federal National Mortgage Association biweekly auction today of fourmonth mortgage commitments.

title: 7,000 PENALIZED IN STATE STRIKE
description: It will be blue paydays the next two weeks for about 7,000 state employes who staged an Easterweekend strike in April at mental hos pitals, juvenile training schools, prisons and other institutions.

title: East Germans Now Speed Traffic to West
description: BERLIN. July 11The East German guard saluted smartly and motioned the driver to inch forward to the red and white barrier at the checkpoint out side West Berlin. Stay in the car, he called, no need to get out.

title: Other U.S. Officers Killed At Anloc Are Identified
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 11 (AP)  The names of three American officers who were killed Sunday at Anloc with Brig. Gen. Richard J. Tall man were released today.

title: Apollo 15 Crew Is Reprimanded
description: WASHINGTON, July 11The Apollo 15 astronauts were rep rimanded today by the space agency for smuggling 400 spe cially stamped and canceled en velopes to the moon and back last July. Later 100 of these were sold by a German stamp dealer for a sum reported to be more than $150,000.

title: MIAMI BEACH
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11American politics is a savage business. The win ners here at Miami Beach, like George McGovern, have more to do than they can remember, and the losers, like Hubert Humphrey, have more to forget than they can bear.

title: Mrs. Larkin's Duo Leads By 3 in BetterBall Golf
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I., July 11Mrs. Walter Cooperstein of Glen Oaks and Mrs. Vincent Larkin of the Nassau Country Club carded 74 for a three stroke lead in the first round of the Women's Long Island Golf Association 36hole better ball championship on the 5,643 yard, par72 Maidstone Club course. The final round tomor row is at Shinnecock Hills.

title: LONG BRANCH SETS TEENAGE CURFEW
description: LONG BRANCH, N. J., July 11A 10hour curfew was clamped on the younger teen agers of this resort city as a result of two consecutive nights of clashes involving 250 youths and virtually all members of the Police Department here.

title: Guard Is a Free Agent
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N. J., July 11Doug Van Horn, apparently enjoying his status as a free agent but openly willing to continue his football career as a New York Giant, was among 80 players who checked in at the new training base at Monmouth College today.

title: DOMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11 (UPI)Ted Pillows, a demon strator outside the Democratic National Convention in 1968 in Chicago, is a 20yearold delegate inside the hall this year who would like to be the nation's first black Presi dent.

title: PRICES OF STOCKS CONTINUE TO SINK
description: Stock prices sank again yes terday, this time reflecting ap parent investor unease over Senator George McGovern's im pressive margin in regaining California delegates at the Democratic National Conven tion.

title: Films From Moon Cast Doubt On the Role of Photosynthesis
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (AP)  A camera stationed on the moon by the Apollo 16 mission last April, and trained on the earth, has lent support to the idea that photosynthesis by green plants is less important as an oxygen source than has commonly been believed.

title: Tennis Bubble Sites
description: Following are the tennis courts that will be re surfaced and prepared for winter play under a conces sionaire's bubble, accord ing to a program announced yesterday by Mayor Lindsay:

title: Monday Night Fights
description: Los Angeles  Armando Muniz, 148 pounds, Los Angeles, knocked out Jimmy Ham, 144, Jacksonville, Fla., 2 rounds.

title: Notes on People
description: I haven't resigned, said Otto F. Otepka, I've retired. Thus the controversial con servative confirmed his de parture, effective June 30, from a $36,000ayear post on the almost moribund Sub versive Activities Control Board, a position he had held for nearly two years without Senate confirmation.

title: 3 Girls Killed by Lightning
description: HOUSTON, July 11 (Reuters) Three young girls were struck and killed by lightning today during an afternoon thunder shower here. The girls were Cynthia Hitchcock, 14 years old; her sister. Robin, 10, and Lynn Wyatt, 14, all of Houston.

title: WORLD JEWISH BODY TO SPUR SCHOOLING
description: GENEVA, July 11  The World Conference of Jewish Or ganizations decided today to establish a permanent commis sion of educators to assist the development of local Jewish school programs.

title: Ralph Nicholson, ExPublisher Of Charlotte Observer, Is Dead
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., July 11 (AP)Ralph Nicholson, former publisher of The Charlotte Ob server and of several other newspapers, died in a Talla hassee, Fla., hospital yesterday. He was 73 years old and had lived since 1966 at Rose Hill Plantation near Tallahassee.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: If Howard Samuels hopes to get his Offtrack Betting Corporation working at its fullest capacity, he will have to get his betting shops better stocked with employes.

title: Bates Named Bucks' Trainer
description: MILWAUKEE, July 11 (AP) Bill Bates, 39 years old, for mer head trainer of the New England Patriots of the Na tional Football League, was named head trainer of the Mil waukee Bucks of the National Basketball Association today.

title: CONTRACT AWARD
description: The Navy awarded $52.3 million in contracts to the Lockheed Corporation, it was announced yesterday. One award, for $45.1million, is for engineering services in the fleet ballistic missile program. A $7.2million contract is for con tinued procurement of anti submarine aircraft.

title: AlphaOmega Gives 15 Dance Episodes, Intelligently Shaped
description: In an unusually selfeffacing gesture, Ron Pratt, chore ographer of the AlphaOmega 17 Dance Compaiy, omitted his name from the program credits. It was a mistake be cause the 15 dance episodes showed an intelligent shaping and, in several cases, sharp ap preciation of the storytelling possibilities of movement. The program was presented Mon day evening at the Cubicuio.

title: World Reform Rabbis Elect New President
description: The election of Rabbi Mau rice N. Eisendrath, promi nently known in American Reform Judaism, as president of the World Union for Pro gressive Judaism was an nounced yesterday.

title: Realty Man Named Head Of Brooklyn Republicans
description: George L. Clark Jr., 31year old Brooklyn real estate man and a moderate conservative Republican, yesterday was elected chairman of the Kings County Republican Committee, succeeding John R. Crews.

title: The Ryan Fastball Hums, And All the Angels Sing
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., July 11 When I asked for Gary Gen try last winter, the Mets said no, Harry Dalton related, remembering the big trade. So I asked for Nolan Ryan, and they said yes.

title: DOMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., July 11 (AP)At about 4:15 A.M. today, during the Democratic National Convention's rollcall vote on seating a disputed Illinois delegation, the Ken tucky delegation's vote came as follows: The Kentucky vote is 36 yes, 10 no, one asleep and not voting.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: LISBURN, Northern Ireland  The British military seem to have con cluded ruefully, after their disagree able threeyear experience of spas modic conflict in Northern Ireland, that it is impossible to win an irregular or guerrilla conflict while at the same time following all the rules of traditional common law.

title: Nicklaus Bids for 3d British Open Title
description: MUIRFIELD, Scotland, July 11Nicklaus will be trying to win his third British Open championship is the way Jack would like it to read. Be hind lie the Masters and the United States Open and aheadif he wins hereis the Professional Golfers' As sociation championship, last leg of the grand slam.

title: Rival Ends 3d Drive
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11 Senator Edmund S. Muskie end ed his campaign for the presi dency today for the third and last time, quietly abandoning not only his candidacy but also any possible role he might have chosen either as king maker or king stopper.

title: CLOSE RACE SEEN IN INTERNATIONAL
description: WESTBURY, L. I., July 11 Based on this morning's post position draw, which obviously gave no chance to only two of the eight horses, New Zea landbred Beau Winter and Azelino B of France, Saturday night's $125,000 International Trot at Roosevelt Raceway shapes up as a close 1mile race.

title: Former President of Saks Joining Bergdorf Goodman
description: Gordon P. Franklin, who re signed as president of Saks Fifth Avenue last month, has been named vice president and general merchandise manager of Bergdorf Goodman.

title: RUBY'S RECORD 206 TAKES IKE GOLF
description: BLOOMFIELD, N.J., July 11 John Ruby shot an eagle 2 on the first hole today and never eased up for the remaining 35 as he easily won the 20th an nual Ike golf tournament with a record score of 206 for the 54hole competition.

title: Carl McCardle, ExSpokesman For State Department, Is Dead
description: McLEAN, Va., July 11 (AP) Carl W. McCardle, a veteran newspaperman who became an Assistant Secretary of State, was found dead yesterday in a neighbor's swimming pool. He was 68 years old.

title: Earnings of Bankers Trust Corp. Gain
Koch Hears Angry Grievances At Meeting on Street Crime
description: A 90minute session intended as a sort of town meeting on street crime developed last night into what was often an acrimonious exchange between Representative Edward I. Koch and 75 of his constituents.

title: Minnesotan to Campaign
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11  Emotional in a final staff meet ing and stoical in a public withdrawal of his candidacy, Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota wanted more than anything today to erase two unhappy impressions of his third dnd probably final Presi dential race.

title: Hearing in Maine Dispute On Heat Discharge Ends
description: AUGUSTA, Me., July II (AP) Hearings on the Maine Yan kee Atomic Power Company's application to use Montsweag Bay as a mixing zone for its thermal discharges ended to day. Attorneys were given sev en days to submit written sum mary briefs.

title: SEAWANHAKA WOMEN NEAR SAILING TITLE
description: RYE, N. Y., July 11The Seawanhaka Corinthian Yacht Club crew of Oyster Bay, L. I., captained by Mrs. W. Perry Neff, sailed to within 1 point of the women's Long Island Sound championship today after the first five races in the 39th an nual Syce Cup regatta, held in Lightning Class sloops off American Yacht Club.

title: Roundup: Jackson Is Pattin's Villain
description: Reggie Jackson, the hard hitting Oakland A's outfielder, who has known baseball glory in his six major league seasons, spoiled a similar chance last night for Marty Pattin, the Boston Red Sox's journeyman righthander.

title: Hawaii Dock Parleys Go On
description: HONOLULU, July 11 (UPI) Hawaii's 900 dock workers attended stopwork meetings today held by the Internation al Longshoreman's and Ware housemen's Union. Only mili tary and interisland cargo was moved, and there was no indi cation when the dock gangs would resume work.

title: Rogers Says Pope Sought P.O.W. Trade
description: ROME, July 11Secretary of State William P. Rodgers dis closed today that Pope Paul VI had unsuccessfully tried to ar range for an exchange of pris oners of war in Vietnam.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To brand one's own state a treaty violator, as The Times has consistently done in editorials on the Byrd chrome amendment, is a most serious charge that should be based on a firm legal foundation. No such foundation has been put before the readers of this newspaper in seven editorials; nor does the recent letter of Ambassador Finger trace any such foundation.

title: Massengale Captures Tourney
description: BRIARCLIFF MANOR, N. Y., July 11Don Massengale, a former tour player turned club professional at Elmwood, won the 50th annual Westchester open championship by one stroke at Briar Hall Golf and Country Club today with a score of 207.

title: Mrs. Jessie C. Treichler, 66, Writer and ExAntioch Aide
description: YELLOW SPRINGS, Ohio, July 11  Mrs. Jessie Cambron Treichler, retired associate di rector of development at An tioch College and the wife of Paul F. Treichler, long head of its drama department, died to day at their home here. She was 66 years old.

title: Westinghouse's Officers Face 60Year Age Limit
description: PITTSBURGH, July 11The Westinghouse Electric Corpora tion has decided not to leave top management to executives over 60 years old in the future.

title: U.S. Seeks to Bar Merger Of 2 South Carolina Banks
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (UPI) The Justice Department filed suit today to block the merger of two South Carolina banks Peoples National Bank, Green ville, and Bankers Trust, Co lumbia.

title: White House Rejects Plea For a Kent State Inquiry
description: KENT, Ohio, July 11 (AP) The White House rejected to day a plea for a Federal grand jury investigation into the deaths of four Kent State Uni versity students during an anti war confrontation with Ohio National Guardsmen in May, 1970.

title: Designer Does What He LikesAnd It's Liked
description: Kenzo Takada saw his fashions displayed in Macy's windows this week and re flected that he's come a long way from Tokyo. The 28 yearold designer has man aged to make a few waves, leaving a considerable mark on clothes and ruffling a few feathers, particularly those of JapaneseAmericans. Though he's identified as Kenzo in the windows, he's known in the fashion world as Jap a name he chose himself.

title: ROBERT B. SOUMAR
description: Robert Bohuslav Soumar, managing editor since 1953 of the bulletin of the International Peasant Union, 29 West 57th Street, died Saturday in Rab, Yugoslavia, where he had been recuperating from an illness. He was 70 years old and lived at 331 East 71st Street.

title: COMBUSTION SYSTEM FOR ENGINES SHOWN
description: A California research com pany announced yesterday that it had developed a new com bustion system using water in jections to reduce polluting emissions from gas turbine en gines for electric power plants or automobiles.

title: Books of The Times
description: ABOUT TELEVISION. By Martin Mayer. 433 pages. Harper & Row. $10.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11 A top New Jersey Democrat predicted today that the state's delegation to the Democratic National Convention would unify behind Senator George McGovern following the col lapse of the candidacies of Senators Hubert H. Humphrey and Edmund S. Muskie.

title: DEBATE RUNS LONG
description: MIAMI BEACH, Wednesday, July 12The Democratic Na tional Convention rejected by an overwhelming majority early today a move by supporters of Gov. George C. Wallace to rewrite the party's platform along conservative, antibusing, promilitary lines.

title: DOMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., July 11 (AP) A group of antiwar vet erans sitting out the Democratic National Convention at a grand jury session here ran around a United States Post Office today singing Army running songs and waving plastic machine guns.

title: RECORDS TOPPLE ON BIG A GRASS
description: The inner turf course was firm yesterday at Aqueduct and the winners of two races over its grass  John M. Schiff's Kling Kling and Buckland Farm's Roba Bellaset course records.

title: Truck Crash Kills 15 in Peru
description: LIMA, Peru, July 11 (Reuters) At least 15 people died and an unknown number were in jured when a truck filled with passengers plunged into a ra vine near the southcentral city of Ayacucho last night, accord ing to police reports reaching here.

title: General Electric Will Develop Study of Waste in Connecticut
description: HARTFORD, July 11The General Electric Company has been selected to make a year long study of the problem of what to do with the 10,000 tons of trash that accumulates each day in Connecticut.

title: Business Briefs
description: The nation's leading automobile maker has conceded that its Wankel engine cannot now meet the 1975 stand ards for emissions.

title: Two Senators Discover Hall's Security Is Tight
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., July 11 (AP)Two United States Senators learned tonight how tight security is at the Dem ocratic National Convention.

title: NEW HOUSEWARES DISPLAYED AT SHOW
description: CHICAGO, July 11Thou sands of new housewares prod ucts and improvements of old ones, which will be bidding for attention of Christmas shoppers, are on display here this week at the semiannual National Housewares Exposi tion.

title: Lauren D. Lyman Is Dead; Leading Aviation Writer
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., July 11 Lauren D. Lyman, a retired vice president of the United Aircraft Corporation and one of the country's first top avia tion journalists, died today at Bridgeport Hospital. He was 81 years old.

title: Victims May Get Tax Aid
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., July 11 (AP)  The State Revenue Secretary, Robert Kane, said to day that legislation would be introduced in the General As sembly to refund sales taxes paid out by flood victims who make purchases to fix their damaged homes.

title: What Should We Know?
description: The right to know and the right to publish what is known are held to be inalienable in a democracy. Most of us who deal intimately with the flow of events arch our backs at the sugges tion that there may be times when circumstances warrant silence to be the better part of journalistic valor. Yet a case can be made for those extraordinary instances in which fac tual information should be withheld.

title: JAMES DONN SR., 85, RACETRACK OWNER
description: MIAMI, July 11 (UPI)James Donn Sr., owner and chairman of the board of the Gulfstream Park Racetrack, died tonight in the North Shore General Hos pital from complications follow ing a stroke. He was 85 years old.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11The big night for youthful demon strators at the Democratic Na tional Convention was marked by a conscious effort at peace.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: A recent issue carried a troublesome letter by Ira Glasser, the New York Civil Liberties Union executive direc tor. His view is that the Vietnam war is illegal, immoral and criminal and that protests against the war are not being listened to. He states that less temperate people must be frustrated and, if those in power do not listen, people will stop talking and this will be dangerous to the basic structure of liberty.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Advertising:
description: From north, south, east and west the news is the kind you like the best things are looking up.

title: Genesco Sees Lower Earnings; Stock Off 5 in Active Trading
description: Genesco, Inc., Nashville, the nation's largest apparel pro ducer and retailer, announced yesterday that it believes earn ings for the fiscal year ending July 31 will fall below those of the previous year. In fiscal 1971, the concern had net sales of $1,306,844,000 and net earnings of $1.02 a share.

title: RiotTorn Pakistani Region Reports No Major Incidents
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, July 11 The situation in Sind Prov ince, where about 50 people have died in five days of riots brought about by the choice of Sindhi as the province's offi cial language, was today offi cially reported to be normal.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (AP)Manufacturers expect to increase their inventories sharply in the JulytoSep tember quarter, a Commerce Department survey showed today.

title: Personalities: Jackson Signs
description: Phil Jackson, a parttimer until last season's playoffs, was rewarded by the Knicks with a $35,000 contract for the coming National Basket ball Association campaign. With an average salary of about $70,000 a man, the New Yorkers are one of the sport's most generous teams, topped perhaps by only the Los Angeles Lakers. The 6foot13inch Jackson split playoff duty at forward and center.

title: Hanoi Tells of Vietcong Panel for Quangtri Rule
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 11 (UPI)The Hanoi radio said tonight that Vietcong lead ers had elected a provincial People's Revolutionary Com mittee for Quangtri last month.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I would like to express my approval of the decision of the governing coun cil of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences to veto the award of the EmersonThoreau Medal to Ezra Pound.

title: Mr. McGovern's Task
description: With their formal withdrawal from the Democratic Presidential race, Senators Muskie and Humphrey yester day definitively confirmed the nomination of Senator George S. McGovern of South Dakota after one of the most extraordinary primary campaigns in American political history.

title: Dale Drake, Engine Maker Represented at Indianapolis
description: SANTA ANA, Calif. July 11 (AP)Dale Drake, whose auto motive company built the rac ing engine that powered the winning car at the Indianapolis 500 this year, died Monday of a heart attack here. He was 70 years old.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 11 (UPI)  The United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit rejected Presidential and Congressional mandates opposing busing of schoolchil dren today and ordered Bes semer, Ala., public schools de segregated by busing.

title: Pompidramatics
description: President Pompidou's replacement of the Premier of France and his threat to cancel the Common Market's October summit, which he initiated, have less to do with policy disagreements than with electoral politics.

title: Guns on the Run
description: Mayor Lindsay's proposal to ban the manufacture, assembly and wholesale distribution of cheap handguns in New York City deserves prompt approval by the City Council. It would extend a similar ban already imposed by Suffolk County where the bulk of these deadly weapons were produced and then marketed across the state. Mr. Lindsay is rightly concerned that the city not become the transplanted home of this anti social industry.

title: A FischerSpassky Chair?
description: A mate to Bobby Fischer's chess chair was flown to Iceland last night so that Boris Spassky could, if he wanted, have the same swivelbased, leathercovered Charles Eames design that the American chess chal lenger played in during yes terday's opening game for the world championship.

title: DOBRYNIN, ON COAST, TO VISIT PRESIDENT
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., July 11Soviet Ambassador Analo ly F. Dobrynin is in California and will visit President Nixon at the Western White House tomorrow.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11  Spokesmen for organized labor today greeted with bitterness, obscenities and a threat to withhold campaign funds the virtually certain Presidential nomination of Senator George McGovern by the Democratic National Convention.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: LONDON, July 11 (AP)Bob Miller, a 49yearold British bandleader, was rescued in midAtlantic by the Norwegian bulk carrier, Heogh Minerva, early today after his sloop, Mersea Pearl, had been dismasted in a trans Atlantic singlehanded yacht race. Miller radioed for help last night when the mast on his 43foot sloop snapped 500 miles southeast of St. John's Newfoundland. He spent the night drifting helplessly.

title: L.I. Legislator, Broker's Brother, Knew of Park Plans
description: HAMPTON BAYS, L. I., July 11A Suffolk County legisla tor whose brother reportedly earned large fees by helping to increase the price of some oceanfront property here had inside information that the county intended to purchase the land nearly one year be fore the condemnation was publicly announced.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., July 11 (AP)The Committee for the Reelection of the President has a hospitality room in the Fontainebleu Hotel for news men covering the Democratic National Convention.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11Following is a summary of the major actions taken by the Democratic National Convention:

title: Court Lets Scott Panel Obtain Hospital Agency Data
description: State Supreme Court Justice Hilda G. Schwartz yesterday authorized the state commission investigating the city govern ment to subpoena personnel records of a high official of the city's Health and Hospitals Cor poration.

title: 30 Japanese Are Killed In 3 Days of Heavy Rains
description: TOKYO, July 11 (AP)Thirty persons have been killed and 11 others were missing in floods and landslides set off by three days of torrential rains in west ern and southwestern Japan, the national police reported to day.

title: About Pro Football
description: Johnny Robinson, whose carer dates to the founding of the American Football League in 1960, announced his retirement yesterday. The Kansas City Chiefs' defensive back, 33 years old, decided to quit because he had not re covered from a groin injury received in the playoff game against Miami last Christmas. Robin son, a Louisiana State alumnus, broke into pro football with the Dallas Texans, the franchise that moved to Kansas City in 1963. He was named to league or conference allstar teams seven times and wound up with 57 interceptions, the most in the American Confer ence records.

title: Advertising:
description: Rise Instant Lather is re turning to SSC&B, the agency that introduced it almost 20 years ago. The CarterWal lace product, which has been at Carl Ally, Inc., for four years, billed $2.2million last year and its firstquarter bil lings this year were up 17 per cent from the first quar ter of 1971.

title: TV Here Brings New Dimension To Chess Contest and Kibitzing
description: The switchboard at educa tional television station WNET, Channel 13, was jammed yes terday by chess enthusiasts in tent on kibitzing the studio recreated play of the Boris SpasskyBobby Fischer game.

title: Delegates' New Look: A Sparkling Fashion Show All Their Own
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11 The young woman stood up at the back of the McGov ern Women's Rights Caucus and put a frosty question to the chair. I was informed, she said ominously, that the governors' wives are put ting on a fashion show dur ing this convention. Is that correct?

title: Wallace Tells Convention He Wants to Help Party
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11 Gov. George C. Wallace made a wheelchair appearance before the Democratic National Con vention here tonight amid growing signs that he has aban doned the possibility of an in dependent candidacy and is seriously considering at least a tacit endorsement of the party's Presidential nominee.

title: East Side Survey Puts Illegal Parking at 30%
description: A group of Manhattan busi nessmen pressing for stricter enforcement of traffic and park ing regulations surveyed 24 East Side blocks yesterday and found that 30 per cent of the 1,026 automobiles parked in the area were parked illegally.

title: Soviet, to Spur U.S. Trade, Will Exhibit at Seattle Fair
description: MOSCOW, July 11The So viet Union, facing an increasing imbalance of trade with the United States, is pressing a sales campaign to broaden the American market for its goods.

title: Egyptian Aide to Visit Soviet
description: CAIRO, July 11 (UPI)The Egyptian Premier, Dr. Aziz Sidky, will fly to Moscow on Thursday for talks with Krem lin leaders, the Middle East News Agency said today.

title: Israeli Draft Resister Gets 8 Months in a Hotly Disputed Case
description: TEL AVIV, July 11A mili tary tribunal sentenced an Is raeli New Leftist and reluctant army recruit today to eight months' imprisonment for balk ing at signing a pledge of loy alty to the Israeli armed forces. The case of the slightly built young man in blackrimmed glasses has aroused passions in a society where draftdodg ing has been uncommon.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., July 11President Nixon is awaiting further develop ments before he or his staff say anything publicly about the probable Democratic Presidential nominee, Senator George McGovern.

title: State's Attorney on Trial in Chicago Panther Case
description: CHICAGO, July 11 (UPI) A prosecutor said today that he would prove that police accounts of a controversial raid on a Black Panther apartment on Chicago's West Side were false.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The eastern shore of the Hudson River from New York City north to Albany, except for an occasional point can never be restored to the people of this state so long as the railroad tracks remain.

title: 90Day Japanese Strike Ends
description: TOKYO, Wednesday, July 12 (20)Japan's oceangoing sea men ended a 90day strike early today as labor and man agement accepted a Govern ment mediation plan for end ing the walkout, the longest by a Japanese union. The plan calls for an average monthly pay raise of $37.50 plus in creased fringe benefits. Basic pay now ranges between $197 and $230 a month.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11  Leaders of Senator George McGovern's New York cam paign today offered another olive branch to state Demo cratic leaders by proposing the appointment of former Mayor Robert F. Wagner and Patrick J. Cunningham, the Bronx Dem ocratic chairman, as alternate delegates at large.

title: Executive Changes
description: Raymond F. Good has been appointed president of the U.S.A: division of the H. J. Heinz Company, effective July 31. He succeeds J. Richard Grieb, who has resigned to join the Heublein Company.

title: 52 DayCare Centers in City Are Found to Be Substandard
description: Many of the 52 daycare cen ters in New York City that have had, in effect, probation ary public financing have been found substandard in a still unreleased state Department of Social Services study.

title: Pact Ratified at The News
description: Salvatore Tomaselli, presi dent of Local 820 of the inde pendent International Brother hood of Teamsters, announced yesterday that building secur ity men had ratified a twoyear contract with The Daily News. The vote was 40 to 7 for a contract that provides for a $10 increase in weekly pay that had ranged to $175. The local struck The News for five days last month.

title: Jazzmobile Chugs On
description: Several hundred men, women and children filled A. Philip Randolph Square at St. Nicholas Avenue and 117th Street on Monday night for the city Jazzmobile's first free street concert of its eighth season. They clapped hands and danced to Les Mc Cann's electric pianoa mix ture of styles combining black church music and con temporary jazz with strong rhythmic foundations laid by Jimmy Rouser's bass and the percussion work of Donald Dean on drums and Buck Clark, conga player.

title: Bridge: Taking Trick With a Four Proves a Pleasant Surprise
description: One of the most unusual tricks in the recent World Team Olympiad in Miami Beach, or indeed in any other tournament, was won by West on the diagramed deal from a match between Swit zerland and Peru.

title: Dance: Vienna's Ballet
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 11 The Temple University Mu sic Festival is strange in that it is probably the only North American music fes tival based on European lines. Its large campus theater is a little like the theater at Saratoga, and it is situated 16 miles out of downtown Philadelphia. For six weeks this festival pre sents a remarkable mixture of cultural offerings. Ballet, folkdance, opera, popsing ers, orchestral concerts, and the whole package adds up to something very exciting in its total.

title: Russians Ask Variances For Riverdale Housing
description: Soviet officials here disclosed yesterday the details of a hous ing complex for 240 families they said they planned to build at Faraday Woods, a sixand ahalf acre tract of trees and rocks in the northern part of the Riverdale section of the Bronx.

title: Itel Reports June 30 Sale Of 69,000 Shares of Xerox
description: The Itel Corporation said yes terday that it had sold 69,000 common on shares of the Xerox Corporation for which it re ceived more than $10million. The shares were sold June 30 at $150.75 a share, the closing price on the New York Stock Exchange that day.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: LINCOLN, Neb., July 11 (AP)Cynthia Potter of Houston won the women's onemeter springboard cham pionship today as the national Amateur Athletic Union outdoors diving meet opened. The 22yearold Miss Potter, from Indiana University, became the first woman last summer to win the one and threemeter springboard diving and the 10meter platform diving.

title: Patrolman Identifies Defendant In Newark ReporterAbuse Case
description: NEWARK, July 11Patrol man James Collins testified to day that he saw one of the three defendants on trial for interfering with the coverage of a stormy Board of Educa tion meeting 15 months ago by Fox Butterfield, a New York Times reporter, snatch a piece of paper from Mr. Butterfield's hand and reach around from his right rear pocket with what looked like a wallet.

title: Hanoi Negotiator Arrives In Peking on Way to Paris
description: HONG KONG, Wednesday, July 12 (Reuters)North Viet nam's senior Politburo mem ber, Le Duc Tho, has arrived in Peking from Hanoi on his way to Paris for resumption of the Vietnam's peace talks tomorrow, Hsinhua, the offi cial Chinese press agency, said today.

title: Philippine Aircraft Strike At Guerrilla Strongholds
description: MANILA, July 11 (UPI) Fighter planes and helicopters of the Philippine Air Force strafed strongholds of Com munist guerrillas yesterday in Isabela province in the north ern Philippines.

title: Tense Ulster Braces for Parades by 100,000 Protestants Today
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, July 11On the eve of huge parades celebrating Protestant dominance in Northern Ireland, William Whitelaw, Ulster's ad ministrator, returned to Belfast tonight and conferred with se curity officials.

title: Saigon Forces Are Now Reported Planning to Isolate Enemy in Quangtri City
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, July 12Reliable military sources here and on the northern front reported to day that the South Vietnamese were not going to try to recap ture the welldefended provin cial capital of Quangtri at this time. Rather, they said, Sai gon's forces are going to try to isolate the city and hope it falls by attrition.

title: 9 Injured in Explosion at Tel Aviv Bus Terminal
description: TEL AVIV, July 11 (AP) A grenade exploded in the central bus terminal here to day, injuring nine persons, none seriously. Soldiers strug gled to prevent angry by standers from attacking Arabs in the area.

title: Hijacker's 45Year Jail Term Is Latest in a Series of Stiff Sentences for Air Piracy in U.S.
description: I realize the pressure that was on you, Judge, for the type of crime I was charged with, said the 29yearold convicted hijacker, Richard P. McCoy Jr. I hope you'll take into con sideration my past record.

title: Grim Ulster Prospect
description: In the judgment of moderates as well as militants in both Protestant and Catholic communities, Northern Ireland is now closer to outright sectarian war than at any time since the eruption of violence three years ago. The heaviest responsibility for dashing the peace hopes of a fortnight ago rests on the Irish Republican Army's Provisional wing, though the Protestant Ulster Defense Association (U.D.A.) cannot escape a share of the blame.

title: Havana Scientists Listed
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (UPI) The State Department listed yesterday the American scien tists who spent the week of June 19 to 24 in Havana at a meeting of the Intergovern mental Oceanographic Commis sion. They were Dr. Harris B. Stewart Jr., Dr. Robert L. Moli nari, Dr. John Atoine, John Brucks, Bernard Zetler, Theo dore F. Dorostapoff and Rene Cuzon du Rest.

title: COPACO BAR SOUGHT BY COLORADO CORP.
description: The Colorado Interstate Cor poration said yesterday that it had asked a Federal court for an injunction against Copaco, Inc and its affiliates to prevent them from seeking control of Colorado Interstate.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (UPI)A threejudge Federal panel has ruled that railroads cannot charge a 2.5 per cent surcharge on materials transported solely for ecological recycling. The panel in a ruling yesterday directed the Interstate Commerce Commission to order the railroads to stop the practice.

title: Levitt Urges Panel to Study Relief Ineligibles
description: State Controller Arthur Levitt asked Governor Rockefeller yesterday to appoint a team of state, city and independent members to resolve disputes over the number of ineligibles on the city's welfare rolls and to make relevant recommen dations.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11  Not long after a zealous se curity agent tossed a shouting representative of the Gay Cau cus out of the lobby of the Doral Hotel here this afternoon, about two dozen blacks lobby ing on behalf of the poor began chanting soul power.

title: Economic Analysis
description: Two basic factors underlie Wall Street's apprehension that the American economy may be headed for a new bout of in flation and climbing interest rateswhich would cause weaker bond and stock markets. The first factor is the poor timing of Federal fiscal policy, with bigger and perverse bud get deficits devel oping at a time when the economy is picking up speed and starting to narrow the unem ployment gap. The second fac tor is the fresh outbreak of in ternational monetary instability and uncertainty, touched off by the floating of the British pound.

title: Group Takes Responsibility
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 11 (Reuters)  The Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine said here tonight that it was responsible for the explosion.

title: ALABAMIAN WOOED
description: MIAMI BEACH, Wednesday, July 12  Senators Hubert H. Humphrey and Edmund S. Mus kie surrendered the Democratic Presidential nomination yester day to their colleague, George McGovern, and with different degrees of enthusiasm sum moned him to reunite the party.

title: GATT GROUP LISTS TEXTILE DATA NEED
description: GENEVA, July 11Lowcost textileexporting countries and Western industrialized nations completed today preliminary arrangements for digging out the facts underlying the often acrimonious issues dividing them.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: AUGUSTA, Me., July 11 (AP) The Communist party will go to court in its attempt to get a presidential ticket on Maine ballots. Larry Moskowitz of Freeport said today a court could be asked to rule unconsti ?? a state law requiring that signatures to nominating petitions of thirdparty or in dependent candidates be vali dated by local registrars. The state say the party did not have enough signatures to get on the ballot.

title: Copy of '76 Mars Vehicle TestLaunched By Balloon
description: ROSWELL, N.M., July 11 (UPI)A spacecraft similar to the one the United States hopes to use for a soft landing on Mars in 1976 was successfully launched today from the indus trial air center.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11 Following are a statement by Senator Hubert H. Humphrey on his withdrawal today from the race for the Democratic Presidential nomination, a comment on this by Senator George McGovern, a state ment by Senator Edmund S. Muskie announcing his with drawal from the race and a statement by Senator Henry M. Jackson on his determina tion to continue in the race:

title: Vietcong Charge U.S. Used Toxic Chemicals
description: HONG KONG, Wednesday, July 12 (AP)The Vietcong accused the United States to day of using lethal toxic chemical bombs and artil lery shells that killed hundreds and sickened thou sands in Communist occupied areas of Quangtri and Thuathien provinces in northern South Vietnam.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11 New York Democratic dele gates voted unanimously to day to give their 88 national convention guest passes to the Poor People's Campaign.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11The votes had just been cast that cost Eugene L. Wyman his seat in the California delegation to the Democratic National Con vention.

title: Figure in Key Case Before High Court Is Killed by Police
description: Philadelphia, July 11 (AP) Andrew Mallory, whose 1954 rape conviction was overturned by the United States Supreme Court in a landmark ruling that guaranteed speedy arraignment for all criminal suspects, was shot and killed the the police last Sunday after a robbery and rape.

title: Blaze of Glory for Fireman Author Fails to Change Life
description: WASHINGTONVILLE, N.Y. July 11  Dennis Smith and his wife, Patricia, beamed as they carried the rocking chair to the porch. It cost $18 at auction and showed how lit tle Mr. Smith's literary suc cess has affected his style of life.

title: Caterpillar Profit Soars 45% on 11.7% Sales Rise
MACHINE FILLS IN FOR JERSEY CLERK
description: ROOSEVELT, N. J., July 11 (AP)It Is hard to argue with city hall here, for the public servant at the other end of the telephone is often a machine.

title: Bathers Welcome the Acquisition of Tiana Beach
description: HAMPTON BAYS, L. I., July 11I guess it's a bargain at any price.

title: METS LOSE MILNER AS GIANTS WIN, 61
description: Chris Speier hit two fly balls last night at Shea Stadium that sent John Milner to the hos pital, Duffy Dyer to right field and the Mets to the sixth loss in their last seven games.

title: Oxford Dictionary To Get an Updating, Its First in 39 Years
description: OXFORD, England, July 11The harmless drudges who have spent 15 years preparing a supplement to the Oxford English Diction arythat monument to the arbitrary splendor of the English tongueare finally ready to declare a 1,356 page dividend.

title: TV: Convention Is Best If Something Is Going On
description: The first session of the Democratic party's conven tion provided the viewer with some excellent television, but it didn't do much to advance the overall status of broad cast journalism.

title: Land Developer Formed By McDonnell Douglas
description: The formation of the Douglas Development Company as a wholly owned subsidiary of McDonnell Douglas Corporation was announced yesterday by James S. McDonnell, chairman of McDonnell Douglas.

title: Dollar Near Floor In Quiet Trading Throughout Europe
description: LONDON, July 11 (UPI)  Foreign exchange operators displayed little of their fire power in quiet trading in Eu rope today, and the absence of buyers kept the dollar close to its floor in key centers.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11At 4:49 A.M. today, the Demo cratic National Convention brought to a weary conclusion one of the most ambitious and closely pursued political reform projects in party history.

title: $165,000 Exchange Seat
description: The New York Stock Ex change said yesterday that a seat on the Exchange was sold for $165,000, off $40,000 from the previous sale on June 29. Seats are currently being bid at $145,000 and offered at $200,000.

title: Norwegian Plane Strikes Mountain, Killing 18 Aboard
description: OSLO, Norway, July 11 (Agence FrancePresse)Eigh teen persons were killed tonight when a Royal Norwegian Air Force plane struck a mountain at Grytoya, in northern Norway, a military spokesman an nounced.

title: Businessman Named Dean at Columbia
description: A 56yearold business execu tive who dropped out of a graduate program in political science at Columbia University in 1966 has been appointed dean of the university's School of International Affairs.

title: About Motor Sports
description: It is no reflection on George Follmer that he won Sunday's Road Atlanta Can Am against no opposition, the two factory McLarens having fallen out within the first five laps. With his turbo charged Porsche 91710 in such superb tune, Follmer could very well have beaten the McLarens fair andsquare, Start ing from No. 2 spot, he out dragged them to the first turn and as long as the McLarens were there to race, Follmer was in front of them.

title: A FAIRJOBS ROLE BARRED BY F.P.C.
description: WASHINGTON, July 11The Federal Power Commission, act ing with unusual speed and without dissent, ruled today that Congress had not em powered it to prohibit unfair employment practices by utili ties.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: HELSINKI, July 11 (AP)A truce in tennis, which would again bring about open competition, was expected to be formally sealed here tomorrow. The International Lawn Tennis Federation, opening its general meeting, said a letter from Lamar Hunt, head of the World Championship Tennis organization of contract professionals in Dallas, out lining conditions of a joint agreement, was expected to be accepted without difficulty.

title: News Analysis
description: LONDON, July 11 Two years ago this week, still in the euphoria of the upset June vic tory that had brought him to power, Prime Minister Heath talked with confidence about solving some of the great prob lems of the dayinflation, un employment, Rhodesia, indus trial relations and Northern Ireland. We shall ask to be judged by our success in handling the prob lems which we put before the country and which we are now facing, he said in one of his first speeches as Prime Minister.

title: Robber Strikes Near Police
description: ATLANTIC CITY, July 11 (AP)A bank across the street form the police station here was robbed of $2,000 today and a suspect was arrested mo ments later in a nearby movie theater. The police identified him as Kenneth Lark, 20 years old, of Atlantic City.

title: Charisma Reported Ahead in BermudaSpain Sailing
description: Four Class B yachts have passed the island of Flores the only marker in the Ber mudatoSpain raceaccording to radio reports received at noon yesterday.

title: Edge Is Given to Spassky In Adjourned First Game
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, July 11 The first game of the Bobby FischerBoris Spassky match for the world chess champion ship was adjourned tonight after 40 moves.

title: News Analysis
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11 George McGovern's real battle is now beginning. He has mas tered the intricate techniques of the state primary elections, and the power struggles of the nominating convention here in Miami Beach, but now he has to console his defeated Demo cratic colleagues and win the allegiance of the majority of the voters in the na tion. This is a very different and diffi cult problem, for his successes in the primaries and in Miami Beach may very well have complicated his major objective of defeating President Nixon in the general election in November.

title: JOHN J. McMAHON OF HUDSON DISPATCH
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J., July 11 (AP)  James J. McMahon, chairman of the board of The Hudson Dispatch, died today at Mountainside Hospital here. He was 75 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I find the American Academy of Arts and Sciences' refusal of the EmersonThoreau Medal to our greatest twentieth century poet, Ezra Pound, incomprehensible.

title: NEW DRIVE REPORTED ON WELFARE FRAUDS
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (UPI) The Department of Health, Education and Welfare has urged the states to use local credit bureaus to find welfare cheaters and track down de serting fathers.

title: DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11  No, no, cried John P. Touhy, a Cook County Commissioner.

title: 27 Report at Hofstra
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., July 11 Among the 27 rookies and free agents who reported to the New York Jets on the first day of training camp at Hofstra University today, Mike Dempsey, a 6foot1 inch, 250pound guardtackle probably felt the most at home.

title: Executive Changes
description: Mrs. Martha R. Wallace, vice president and executive director of the Henry Luce Foundation, Inc., has been elected a trustee of the Bowery Sav ings Bank. She is the first woman to hold this post in the bank's 138year history.

title: AMERICANA TUNES REFLECT PRESENT
description: It was Hear America First time at the Greenwich Mews Theater Tuesday night, and Billie Lynn Daniel was about to sing a song of Richard Hund ley's called Three Richards. The composer, who was at the piano, looked up and said, I just finished this on Saturday.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: IF YOU'RE NOT DRINKING WILLIAM LAWSON'S SCOTCH. DRINK DEWAR'S William Lawson's 86.8 Proof Blended Scotch Whiskies. Imported by Palmer & Lord Ltd., ?? N Advt.

title: Graebner Gains in Wales; Miss Wade Also Advances
description: NEWPORT, Wales, July 12 (AP)  Clark Graebner of New York, the topseeded play er, beat Syd Ball of Australia, 46, 63, 64 today in the third round of the Welsh open lawn tennis championships.

title: P. & G. Promotes Officer
description: Procter & Gamble has named R. S. Runnels to the new post of vice presidentadministrative services. He also becomes sec retary of the company, succeed ing R. W. Barrett, who will continue as vice presidentgen eral counsel. W. O. Coleman succeeds Mr. Runnels as man ager of the food products division.

title: Schmid Makes No Moves, But Rules Chess Match
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, July 12 Last Thursday, as soon as Boris Spassky and Bobby Fischer shook hands, Dr. Max Euwe, president of the Inter national Chess Federation, turned to Lothar Schmid. Now, he said, it is all yours.

title: YVES TINAYRE, 80, A MUSICOLOGIST
description: Yves Tinayre, a musicologist, singer and voice teacher who specialized in ancient sacred music, died yesterday at his home at 234 Riverside Drive after a long illness. He was 80 years old.

title: Amusement and Then Sadness Reign at Marshall Chess Club
description: The blunder he made in the first game doomed Bobby Fischer so magnificently that the members and visiting kib itzers at the Marshall Chess Club actually laughed when he made it Tuesday.

title: Cahill Looks Over Jersey's Future Giants
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N.J July 12The Governor of New Jersey was present, but Bob Grim, Roland Lakes and Ben nie. McRae were not as the Giants began their 1972 train ing season at Monmouth Col lege here today.

title: Many Here Hold Doctorates of Unaccredited College
description: A number of people in the fields of education and mental health in the New York City area  some in responsible academic positions, many others treating emotional prob lems or teaching others how to  are equipped with doc torates from an unaccredited Bible college in Canada.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE WATER IS WIDE. By Pat Conroy. With photographs by William and Paul Keyser ling. 306 pages. Houghton Mifflin. $6.95.

title: 5 Die in Fireworks Blast
description: ROSWELL, N.
