description: ROME, July 22Irene Galitzine captured it best with her drawstring waistline coats and bloused battlejacket suits for day, her billowing jersey dresses for evening. It was the closest thing to the contemporary spirit in the couture collections for fall shown here this week.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: Bobby Fischer owes us an apology, tooand so does Icelandic Airlines. The airline bumped our son to make room for Mr. Fischer when he flew to Reykjavik. Consider the feelings of an 18yearold who discovered at the last moment that he was being bumped from his longawaited graduation trip to Europe. His luggage was placed on the plane and his group had gone on board to fly to Luxembourg to start the tour. Icelandic didn't care; Mr. Fischer had his seat and that was all that mattered. However, an understanding tour leader volunteered her seat to our son and agreed to take a later flight. Meanwhile, the 7:30 P.M. flight on which the group was traveling was delayed until 9 P.M. to accommodate Mr. Fischer. It was an imposition to compel more than 200 passengers and their friends to wait for Mr. Fischer in New York and to make the passengers wait again in Reykjavik when he refused to disembark without an appropriate escort.

title: Child to Mrs. Cuddihy
description: A daughter was born July 5 at St. Vincent's Hospital to Mr. and Mrs. John Murray Cuddihy of New York. Mrs. Cuddihy is the former Miss Harriet DeHaven of Minneapolis. Her husband teaches sociology at Vassar College The child has been named Julia Murray. She is the granddaughter of the late H. Lester Cuddihy, former board chairman of Funk & Wagnalls, publishers. The baby is descended from the late Thomas E. Murray, the inventor.

title: Rutgers Is. Staging a VegetableFlower Open House on Saturday
description: NEW BRUNSWICKGardeners from all over New Jersey will gather at Rutgers University Saturday for a VegetableFlower Open House. Sponsored by the College of Agriculture and Environmental Science, the annual event will take place at the college's experimental farms off Route 1 south of New Brunswick, at the Ryders Lane intersection.

title: BRIGADIERGERARD WINS 16TH IN ROW
description: ASCOT, England, July 22 (UPI)  Unbeaten Brigadier Gerard stretched his victory string to 15 today and strengthened his claim as Europe's horse of the decade by winning the $225,000 King George VI and Queen Elizabeth Stakes. The 1mile event is the richest in British racing.

title: AGNEW IS CHOSEN BY NIXON TO RUN WITH HIM IN FALL
description: WASHINGTON, July 22 President Nixon has selected Vice President Agnew to run with him again in November, the White House announced today.

title: Ferrari Captures 6Hour Endurance
description: WATKINS GLEN, N. Y., July 22 A pair of Ferrari 312P sports cars from the Italian factory led an easy, uncontested romp here today to win the Watkins Glen Six Hours of Endurance, the 11th and final event in the world manufacturers championship.

title: The World
description: There was an atmosphere of expectation about the Vietnam peace talks last week. Henry Kissinger, President Nixon's national security adviser, and Le Duc Tho, a member of North Vietnam's Politboro, had resumed their intermittent dialogue in Paris.

title: 'I have made the environment suit my work
description: The sculpture of Henry Moore has been linked time and again to his love of nature. The largerthanlife reclining figures that grace city plazas and public buildings around the world are identified with Mother Earth. A visit to his home in the hamlet of Much Haddam in pastoral Hertfordshire, England, only confirms that the artist's roots are in the living landscape. Moore says: I must work in the country. My sculpture needs open airsky, clouds, trees and changes of weather. I have made the environment suit my work. And the setting? It's perfect, he says. The cottage, a rambling 16thcentury farmhouse, within easy bicycling distance of the village where Moore and his Russianborn wife, Irina, have lived for 32 years, suits their simple lifestyle. The grounds hold four studios ranging from a converted stable to a transparent plastic hangar.

title: Eisenhower Corps Agrees to Oppose Gettysburg Tower
description: GETTYSBURG, Pa., July 22 Surviving members of the United States Tank Corps unanimously adopted today a resolution opposing the construction of a commercial observation tower overlooking Pickett's Charge and the site of Camp Colt. The site is where Dwight D. Eisenhower, as a young Army captain, commanded 10,000 World War I tank corpsmen in 1918.

title: Redemption of Fund Shares: What It Means
description: For all of the mutualfund industry's $60billion in assets, and Its 8.5 million individual shareholders, it is only a rookie in the big league of the capital markets.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: LOS ANGELES, July 22California jetports are preparing to defend themselves against new losses over jet noise expected to run into billions of dollars. At the same time, they are groping for ways to comply with a new state law ordering them to reduce the din of jet traffic starting Dec. 1.

title: David Duncan Protests
description: To ma EDITOR: Gene Thornton in his review of war photography has missed the lessons of both the Vietnam war and David Douglas Duncan's pictures.

title: JANET AULISI SET FOR GOLF DEFENSE
description: The Women's Metropolitan Golf Association's 54hole medal play New Jersey Shore championship, will be held on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday over three different courses.

title: LATIN ECONOMIES SHOW ADVANCES
description: WASHINGTON, July 22 Economic growth continued to be rapid in Latin America last year for the fourth consecutive year, the InterAmerican Development Bank reported this week.

title: Miss Tenney Victor
description: MEMPHIS, Tenn., July 22 (AP)Robin Tenney, a 14yearold front. Los Angeles, won the national claycourt tennis title for girls 18 years and under today. She defeated Joanne Russell, 17, of Naples, Fla., 62, 7.5, in the final.

title: The Nation
description: They watched Thomas Eboli's flowerbedecked coffin borne to his Jersey grave last weekthe weeping widow, the blackclad womenfolk, the hardeyed silent men.

title: The Princely Emporium On Piccadilly
description: L ONDONThe year 1707 was a vintage one for retailing. That is when Oxford's Mr. William Fortnum and London's Mr. Hugh Mason shook hands and dutifully began serving the shopping needs of mankind. Twohundredandsixtyfive years later, their aristocratic standards of salesmanship are still being maintained at Fortnum & Mason, Piccadilly's princely emporium, and quite probably the most regal shop in the world.

title: Science/ Medicine
description: Much as so many other tools of modern science, the Xray machine has banes to match its boons. Physicians have long known that exposure to too high a level of radiation can wreak havoc with patients, and with those who operate the equipment. Thus the medical profession has established Xray standards setting forth the radiation levels considered to be safe.

title: Brud Holland Honored By Football Foundation
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J.,1 July 22Dr. Jerome (Brad), Holland, United States Ambassador to Sweden and a Cornell University member of the Football Hall of Fame here, was today named the recipient of the National Football FoundaH tion's Distinguished American Award for 1972.

title: SelfAccredited Indiana School Plans Joint Program With Center Being Investigated Here
description: GAS CITY, Ind., July 17 Indiana Northern University, a selfaccredited university whose campuses include a nearby motel where classes are held once a month is granting a full range of degrees  from B.A.'s to Ph.D.'s.

title: Halt in SummerLunch Program For Slum Children Threatened
description: Federal, state and local officials put in a day of hurried consultations and court appearances yesterday in a lastminute effort to end a dispute imperiling a freelunch program for 500,000 city children this summer.

title: PAUL TOAST, LED JERSEY TURNPIKE
description: CLIFTON, N.J., July 22Paul L. Troast, the first chairman of the New Jersey Turnpike Authority and Republican candidate for Governor in 1953, died yesterday in his home 324 Dwasline Road, after an illness of three months. He was 77 years old.

title: North Sea Beats Bee Bee Bee By 7 Lengths at Liberty Belt
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 22 Alfred Gwynne Vanderbilt's North Sea led all the way to score an upset over William S. Parish 3d's Bee Bee Bee in the $57,400 Minuteman Handicap at Liberty Bell race track today. The winner returned $9.60, $4 and $3.60 across the board. There was a crowd of 11,908. The time for the mileandasixteenth event was 1:43.

title: Riessen Registers Upset of Newcombe At Washington Net
description: WASHINGTON, July 22 (AP)Marty Riessen of Evanston, Ill., upset topseeded John Newcombe of Australia, 64, (i0, today in the semifinals of the $50,000 Washington Star tennis tournament.

title: Flying Angel Finishes 15th In TransAtlantic Solo Race
description: NEWPORT, R.I., July 22 (UPI) Three more boats competing in the TransAtlantic singlehanded yacht race have crossed the finish line here, race officials said today.

title: PoliticsBy Definition
description: Captive Candidate  one who is under the domination of others; an attack phrase.

title: Mrs. Rankin, Miss Whitworth Tied for Raleigh Golf Lead
description: RALEIGH, N. C., July 22 (UPI)Kathy Whitworth carded 269 and Mrs. Judy Rankin a 72 to tie for the secondround lead in sweltering heat at the $20,000 Raleigh golf classic today.

title: Midpoint
description: By the last week in July we are on the verge of Dog Days and passing the midpoint of, summer. Algae thicken on stagnant water at the pond and the bog is rank with the steamy smell of rotting vegetation. Unless there is enough wind to keep mosquitoes down you can't even walk along the bog's margin. In late afternoon and evening the swallows gather over the water and feed on those flying hordes. In only a few more weeks the swallows will be gone.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In The Times of July 16, Martin Kilson raised some questions regarding the action of the Council of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences in denying Ezra Pound the EmersonThoreau award. Contrary to Mr. Kilson's statement, the officials of the academy did not intervene to reverse the decision of the committee. Harvey Brooks, as president, did not express an opinion; neither did John Voss, the executive director. The only academy officer who spoke out against Pound was myself (I am one of four vice presidents), and I spoke as an individual.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: With the United States balance of payments steadily deteriorating, reaching critical levels, an income improvement of $300 or $400million to our economy should be welcomed. Indeed, such an input could be achieved through a concerted effort by our steel industry to secure a small share of a gradually improving worldwide demand for steel.

title: Threat to Pro Sports
description: Having hollered wolf so often in recent years, the owners of majorleague teams in all sports, are now in danger of not being fully believed when they are about to be eaten alive.

title: Mary Pat Gaynor Marries
description: ST. FRANCIS, Wis., July 22 Miss Mary Pat Gaynor and Warren Stanley Metzger were married here at noon today. The bride's cousin, the Rev. Timothy Gaynor, performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass in the Sacred Heart of Jesus Roman Catholic Church.

title: Artificial Insemination Plan Aids Birds
description: Efforts to stein the drop in population of wild birds of prey include a laboratory breakthrough technique using artificial insemination.

title: McGovern's World
description: WASHINGTON, July 22Senator George McGovern offers the nation a distinctive approach to foreign affairs which derives from the idealism of the social gospel once dominant in American Protestantism. It provides a sharply defined alternative to President Nixon's approach to foreign policy.

title: Hempstead Is Seeking Support Against Possible Beach Ban Suit
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.1., July 22Officials of the Town of Hempstead and of Nassau County said this week that they were seeking to marshal public support against a possible suit by the American Civil Liberties Union aimed at ending the restriction of town beaches and parks to residents.

title: News of Dogs
description: The big dogs continue to push the terriers and toys into the background. Most fanciers agree the cause is the rise in the crime rate and the demand for large animals to protect the household.

title: LETTERS
description: Two letters under the headline McGovernomics (July 16) reveal in one case a conclusion reached by observing raw figures on taxes paid by income groups and in a second a conclusion that is not in accord with Senator George McGovern's proposal.

title: Recordings
description: AST week's announcement that the shuttered Fillmore East would reopen soon under new management (and, presumably, with a new name) produced an odd sense of deid vu, coming as it did at a time when nostalgia for the old Fillmore has been flooding the media.

title: New York
description: From now on, this is going to be a way of life. The speaker: John Carver, former Commissioner of the Federal Power Commission, talking from an airconditioned committee office on Capitol Hill. His subject:. New York City in the age of the power crisis.

title: Lizzie And Caroline
description: Lizzie (Macomber) is a twomasted wooden schooner. Caroline (Fling) is a singleminded girl of 12, and the two meet when the ship runs aground on a Maine island where Caroline has been hiding out. What Caroline is singleminded about is not being farmed out to her mean Grandma, when mother goes to live abroad with her new G.I. husband. To this end, she stashes away a cache of food in a summer cottage, as well as a little brother and a pet ocelot.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 22Passenger and airline resistance and a court order have forced Philadelphia to modify its new airport head taxes.

title: Tuna Teams Warm Up for World Series of Fishing
description: HALIFAX, Nova ScotiaTen teams have accepted invitations to compete in this year's International Tuna Cup Match, which will be held from Sept. 4 through 9 at Wedgeport and Cape St. Mary in this maritime province. Headquarters for the teams will be the Grand Hotel in Yarmouth.

title: Hospitals Agency Starts 3d Year With Old Illness, Lack of Money
description: The New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation began its third year of operation this month with the city's health community unable to agree on a prognosis for this semiautonomous agency that runs the 18 municipal hospitals.

title: Year of the sweater
description: The sweater is one of the year's strongest fashions and the selection seems endless. American women have always been avid sweater collectors and with good reason. Sweaters are comfortable, packable, versatile, seasonless and a lasting investment. This year everybody from the couture designers to the classic sweaterknitters is making them. There are twin sets, dolmansleeved sweaters for day and evening, sweaters that double as jackets and smocks. Perhaps the most provocative sweater is the easy body chemise with full, lantern sleevessnugly cuffed. Mohair, cashmere and fuzzy angora make women look cuddly and soft.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: ASTRANGE and distinct malaise continues to envelop Wall Street as many investors, Institutional as well as public, remain in a highly cautionary mood, ignoring the wealth of constructive developments in both the domestic economy and the international area, fastening their attention instead on the potential problems of 1973.

title: Jed Harris Remembers His Uncle Vanya
description: FOR those suffering from a compulsion to read all the news fit to print; the tidings on the front page of The New York Times on the morning of April 16, 1930, were no more drab than usual. A group of Manhattan tenants had denounced their landlords as bandits and robbers. White persons were being attacked in broad daylight on the streets of Asianot in Peking but in Calcutta. Comparatively refreshing was a statement issued by Mr. Hoover. The President announced that America was in urgent need of intelligent leaders, a view shared by most of the readership. Unfortunately they were for two long years powerless to act upon it.

title: Brooklyn Survives Without Historian
description: Brooklyn has been without the services of a Borough Historian since last July, when James A. (Jamie) Kelly died at the age of 86. It is the duty of the Borough Historian to guard the records of the county and to assist persons doing research on the history of Brooklyn.

title: HighRise Condominiums Sprouting Along Shore
description: WILDWOOD  The Florida extension? That's what some developers are calling tne stretch of New Jersey Shore from Asbury Park to Cape May Point, which they maintain will fairly sprout highrise beachfront condominium apartments in this decade.

title: Paula Johnsen Bride of Peter Pilch Jr.
description: NORTH PLAINFIELD, N. J., July 22Miss Paula Edwina Johnsen and Peter Michael Piech Jr., who were graduated last month from Hartwick College in Oneonta, N. Y., were married here this afternoon, Msgr. Charles E. McGee performed the ceremony at St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church. He was assisted by the Rev, Malcolm E. Mooers, a Congregational minister.

title: Allen Wins His 5th Title In State Golf by 7 Shots
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y., July 22 (UPI)Don Allen of Rochester won his fifth New York State amateur golf championship today, shooting a oneoverpar 71 for a fourround total of 282 at the 6,400yard, par 35, 35 Dutchess Golf and Country Club.

title: Ann S. Fricke Bride of Cletis M. Miller
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., July 22 Miss Ann Stewart Fricke, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alfred K. Fricke, was married here this afternoon to Cletis M. Miller of Jersey City, son of John Miller of Wisconisco, Pa., and the late Mrs. Miller. The Rev. M. Michael Morse performed the ceremony in the First Congregational Church.

title: Corning Glass Center, Damaged By Flood, Will Reopen on Aug. 1
description: The Corning Glass Center, which has been closed since June 23 when the Chemung River inundated the upstate city of Corning during the country's worst flood, will reopen Aug. 1. Rehabilitation and refurbishing began June 25 as flood waters began to recede.

title: Future Flood Victims
description: Legislation is now being rushed through Congress to give adequate financial aid to the thousands of people whose homes and businesses were destroyed by tropical storm. Agnes. With that objective there can be no quarrel. But to stop there is to miss, inexcusably, the opportunity to take more fundamental action: that is, to encourage people to rebuild wherever possible on safer land rather than invite tragedy to pay them a return visit.

title: Art
description: ONE of her girlhood friends remembers that at summer camp Aline Saarinen (who was then Aline Bernstein) always won all the prizes for being best at everythinga prophecy that she fulfilled in the vigor with which she pursued and won her eminent position as an art critic, historian and commentator. She could have been equally as conspicuous without working so hard, since she was a beautiful woman gifted with the social aplomb that comes with absolute selfassurance. But to have done less than the best she could do was not in her nature. She devoted her phenomenal energy to surpassing all competition.

title: Red Sox Conquer A's, 30, on Sieber's FiveHitter After a 53 Setback
description: BOSTON, July 22 (AP) Sonny Siebert pitched a fivehitter and Doug Griffin drove in one run and scored another as the Boston Red Sox beat the Oakland A's, 30, tonight in the second game of a daynight program.

title: ABomb Capacity of Israel And India Cited by U.N. Unit
description: UNITED NATIONS, July 22, (Reuters)  India may have enough plutonium not subject to safeguards against weapons production to make as many as 19 atomic bombs, while Israel may have sufficient to produce up to eight bombs, according to a report published here.

title: Dance
description: AMERICAN BALLET THEATER is at this moment disproving a longheld tradition in American dance. It has always been said that the summer is a dead period. And yet night after night Ballet Theater seems to be playing to virtually capacity business at the New York State Theater in Lincoln Center. The advance sales are often not largethis seems to be a feature of summer theaterbut the onthenight boxoffice lines are enormous. The audience, even in the giddy height of summer when boxoffice receipts are normally as down as a toothless dentist, seems to be responding to Ballet Theater's varied programs and cultofpersonality dancers.

title: Aunt Dorothy's House Rule: Give, and You Shall Receive
description: VIENNAWhen a Viennese runs short of ready cash, he goes to Aunt Dorothy: not a rich relative but a Viennese institution with an earthy charm all its ownTante Dorothy, is the name generations of Viennese have given to the Dorotheum, which is probably the oldest, possibly the largest, but certainly the most unusual pawnshopcumauction house anywhere in the world.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Bridal for Beverly Jean Beal And Henry Joseph Anderson
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., July 22Miss Beverly Jean Beal and Henry Joseph Anderson were married here this afternoon. The Rev. Dr. Ralph E. Davis performed the ceremony in the Community Congregational Church. The Rev. Albert Wickens assisted.

title: U.S. Lifts Davis Cup Edge To 20 as Solomon Scores
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, July 22Harold Solomon outlasted Patricio Cornejo, 9.7, 46, 61, 36, 6.2, today to give the United States a 20 lead in the American Zone final of the Davis Cup tennis tournament.

title: Nancy Quinn Betrothed to Paul Willensky
description: MANHASSET, L.I., July 22 The engagement of Miss Nancy Marie Quinn to Paul Ira Willensky, son of Mr. and Mrs. Hyman Willensky of Roslyn, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Robert Joseph Quinn of Manhasset and Westhampton.

title: NEWSMEN DISAVOW GUILD ENDORSEMENT
description: WASHINGTON, Sunday, July 23 (AP)Nearly 300 Washingtonbased reporters and editors said in an advertisement today that they disavowed and disassociated themselves from the endorsement by the Newspaper Guild of any candidate for any office at any time or place.

title: Nelson Seeks to Bar Action Against Environment in War
description: WASHINGTON, July 22 (UPI) Senator Gaylord Nelson said today that he would try to emend the military authorization bill to prohibit funding for weather modification and incendiary activities as United States war techniques.

title: Pacemakers Going Nuclear
description: Doctors at the Veterans Administration Hospital in Buffalo performed two operations last week that opened in the United States an avenue of research in humans that had previously been carried out only in Europe.

title: Dodgers Edge Phils, 43
description: LOS ANGELES, July 22 (AP) Frank Robinson hit a tworun homerun and Bill Singer won his first game since May 16 as the Los Angeles Dodgers edged the Philadelphia Phillies, 43, tonight.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: THE DOLLAR strengthened in European money centers after the U.S., in a major policy change, intervened in the foreignexchange markets to support it by selling West German marks. The six E.E.C. members and four prospective members agreed on basic objectives for reformed world monetary system, thereby calming European financial markets. President Tanaka of Japan said another yen revaluation must be avoided at all costs.

title: PLANETARIUM PUT IN FRESH AIR CAMP
description: FISHKILL, N.Y., July 20In the woodlands here where thousands of poor children from New York City live part of their summers in close touch with nature, a new kind of door to the universe was opened this week in the form of a planetarium.

title: MOSCOW REPORTS A RISE IN OUTPUT
description: MOSCOW, July 22The Soviet Union, in its midyear economic assessment, reported today a strong recovery after production setbacks last winter, but said that some key commodities fell short of the planned rate of growth for this year.

title: If You Go
description: to Vienna on the last stop of a European trip and find yourself without the necessary gifts to placate the hardtoplease relatives who are to pick you up at the airport on your arrival home, the Dorotheum is the place to go. At the main Dorotheum on Dorotheergasse, future auction lots are on view from 10 A.M. to 6 P.M. on weekdays and from 10 A.M. to noon on Saturdays. The auction sales start at 2 P.M. on weekdays and there will often be five or six sales proceeding simultaneously. For those who are unable to speak German or are dubious about their ability to operate in a foreign auction, there are about half a dozen agents who will act on their behalf. The normal fee for an agent is 2 per cent of the successful bid. Usually there is only one sale on Saturdays. Jewelry is auctioned on Wednesdays and furniture and carpets on Thursdays. Fine art sales and auctions of postage stamps are held less frequently and attract spirited bidding.

title: G.O.P. Endorses 7 For First District Of Supreme Court
description: Justice Thomas C. Chimera, Bronx District Attorney Burton B. Roberts and five other candidates were nominated last night at the Republican Judicial Convention as candidates in the November election for the State Supreme Court.

title: Asthma Deaths Laid To Overdose of Drug
description: An epidemic that took the lives of several thousand asthmatics throughout the world has been linked by a Johns Hopkins researcher to the inhalation of high doses of an asthma medication.

title: Cultures to Blend in Festival
description: Every summer, Brooklyn is the scene of a myriad of cultural and artistic events, but the plans for this year's program are perhaps the most extensive in many years. Most of the block parties, museum exhibitions, art shows and concerts to be held between July 30 and Sept. 4 will be part of an International Festival, a huge undertaking that will attempt to dramatize that Brooklyn possesses an unusual conglomeration of residents with varied cultural and ethnic backgrounds.

title: Voter Registration Splits Suffolk
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I.  Assembly Speaker Perry B. Duryea Jr., Republican of Montauk, said in a recent television interview that he would support absentee registration for the new youth voters, the 18to21 age group.

title: Stop Kidding Around!
description: The following piece was submitted by Christopher Arnoll, the pseudonym of a 10yearold Long Island boy who has been active in various militant children's causes for the last three years. Arnoll, whose father is a doctor and whose mother is a piano teacher, was born in bake Zurich, Ill. At the age of 5, he moved with his parents to Wantagh, L.I., where he attends public school. He is president of the Federated Children's Film Societies of Long Island, the author of a forthcoming book, The Image of the Child in Film, a lecturer and a member of the board of directors of a major New York advertising agency.

title: Miss Joan Fleischmann Bride of Maurice Tobin
description: CINCINNATI, July 22 Miss Joan Kruse Fleischmann, whose late grandfather, Julius Flelschmann, was Mayor of Cincinnati and head of the yeast company founded by her greatgrandfather, Charles Fleischman, was married here this afternoon to Maurice Bernard Tobin, head of the Washington law firm of Tobin & Lipsen.

title: Telsey Captures Ensign Honors In Cow Bay Area Yacht Racing
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., July 22Daubert Telsey was the first Ensign class skipper home today as 69 boats sailed with the Port Washington Yacht Club in the Cow Bay area, Yacht Racing Association of Long Island Sound competition.

title: Shelley Leeb Betrothed to Joel S. Peck
description: MILWAUKEE, July 22Miss Shelley Leeb and Joel Slonim Peck, graduates of the University of Wisconsin, plan to marry Aug. 13 in New York.

title: Janis Riback Plans Nuptials Next May
description: Miss Janis Beth Riback, a senior at the State University College at New Paltz, and Sanford Elliot Koeppel, a New Paltz graduate, plan to be married next May.

title: SHOP TALK
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I. Main Street has seen the arrival this summer of an unusual adaptation of a Morocean marketplace. South Fork Fair is the name given to a bazaarlike assortment of more than 20 retail shops, boutiques, galleries and snack bars, all clustered in airconditioned comfort along and below a raised promenade running the length of a building that once housed the local A & P.

title: Rep. Aspinwall in 2d Spot
description: DENVER. July 22 (AP)Northern Colorado Democrats yesterday gave a political novice the position on the first line of the Democratic primary ballot over Representative Wayne N. Aspinall, 76 years old, who has served 12 terms in the House. Alan Merson, a University of Denver professor, won the first lino snot by a vote of 312.3 to 277.7.

title: 5 Killed and 160 Injured In Train Crash Near Naples
description: NAPLES, Italy, July 22 (Reuters)Five persons were killed and 160 were injured when two focal trains collided headon at the mouth of a tunnel just outside Pozzuoli, north of here today.

title: Art
description: THE exact relation of an artist's ideas, or beliefs, to the character and quality of his art remains one of the most vexing problems in the study of modern art. For a work of art cannot be judgedor indeed, even experiencedon the basis of an artist's beliefs, yet it is doubtful if it can be fully understood in complete isolation from those beliefs. Clearly, we need to know something beyond the concrete visual facts that a work of art offers to the retina of the eye. The question is, what?

title: SLAYING OF CABBY TIED TO 2D DEATH
description: Ballistics tests show that a 38caliber revolver used in the killing of a taxicab driver week ago also was the weapon in a fatal shooting of a patron in a social club 15 minutes earlier, the police said yesterday.

title: Alexander Hill to Wed Dicksie L. McCutchen
description: DALTON, Ga., July 22Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Kelly McCutchen have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Dicksie Linn McCutchen, to Alexander Smith Hill, son of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Harvey Hill Jr. of Atlanta.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: Despite a sharp upturn on Friday, the stock market closed generally lower in rather slow trading last week. The closing rally, however, limited the week's losses the leading market averages.

title: State Legion Elects
description: SYRACUSE,. July 22 (AP)The New York State American Legion concluded its 54th annual meeting here today with the election of Herman Harrington of Rensselaer as state commander. He succeeds Robert W. Garlinger of Lockwood. Vice commanders for the coming year are Leroy Wilson of Newburgh, George C. Clow of Syracuse, Joseph A. Herberger of Swarmville, Frederick Hackenburg of Staten Island and Vincent DeStasio of Tilison.

title: 10 Arrested in Raids Here On 2 Gambling Operations
description: Ten elleged collectors and runners were arrested in raids on two small gambling operations yesterday afternoon, according to the police.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Financially pressed municipalities have recently put to use a controversial source of revenuethe socalled airport tax.

title: The World
description: When the British Conservative party was out of office, Reginald Maudling did what comes naturally to many members of Parliament  he engaged in outside business. There are no rules against it, although tradition calls for a member to disclose his personal interest in pending legislation if he joins in the debate. But when the Tories returned to power in 1970, Mr. Maudling again became a Cabinet Minister and, in accordance with the rules, ended his outside relationships.

title: Miss Marisa Knowlton Fiancee Of Andres Domeyko, Engineer
description: WASHINGTON, July 22Mrs. Robert Almy Knowlton of Washington and Santiago, Chile, has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Marisa Knowlton, to Andres Domeyko, son of Juan Domeyko of Santiago, a retired career diplomat, and Mrs. Paz LeaPlaza de Domeyko.

title: The Vietnam war began in 1898
description: The antiimperialists of 1898 to 1904, long ignored, have been honored as prophets within the past several years by protesters seeking withdrawal from Vietnam. The antiimperialists protests against military coercion of faroff darkskinned peoples and their warnings against the perils and iniquities of empire have acquired a new cogency. Daniel B. Schirmer's is one of several fullscale studies to appear since Americans became involved in Vietnamand, although his New Left interpretations (for the most part) follow a familiar outline, his is one of the most thoughtful and interesting of the accounts. The main thrust is an economic determinism that is by no means an innovation of the New Left, since it represents pretty much the ideology of the antiimperialists themselves  and of American protesters against involvement in war and overseas interventions throughout the 1920's and 1930's.

title: WILD PITCH IS KEY
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 22The Mets played San Francisco today on more equitable terms than their previous gameWillie Mays was not in the Met starting lineupand they wound up losing, 21, when Danny Frisella threw a wild pitch with the bases loaded in the ninth inning.

title: Chance at Trophy Lost By Crew of Apollo 15
description: WASHINGTON, July 22 (AP)An honor proposed for the Apollo 15 astronauts has been withheld from them because of their involvement in the smuggling of souvenir envelopes to the moon.

title: Wingate Back at Post
description: Livingston L. Wingate has been reappointed executive director of the New York Urban League, the organization announced yesterday. Mr. Wingate, who will return to his post Aug. 7, had resigned to run in the Democratic primary against Representatvie Charles B. Rangel. The league also announced the promotion of Mahlon T. Puryear to managing director, effective immediately.

title: Peking Document Details AntiMao Plot
description: WASHINGTON, July 22The Chinese Communist party, in a document circulating among its officials, has described a plot, in which Lin Piao, the former Defense Minister, his wife and son and several high military officers reportedly planned to oust Mao Tsetung as China's leader last year.

title: Allen Paces White Sox
description: CHICAGO, July 22 (AP) Dick Allen slugged two home runs and Carlos May hit one today to pace the Chicago White Sox to a 53 victory over the Cleveland Indians.

title: The Establishment's architectplus
description: Justice is about to be done, or else persistence rewarded, or perhaps the inevitable consummated: Architect Gordon Bunshaft has been appointed to design the gargantuan New York City Convention and Exhibition Center, which will be going up in Manhattan during the next four years.

title: Jeffrey Bright Weds Miss Neville
description: SUTTON ISLAND, Northeast Harbor, Me., July 22Miss Betsey Baird Neville and Jeffrey E. Bright were married here this afternoon at the home of the bride's uncle and aunt, Col. Raymond Hawtin, U.S.A., retired, and Mrs. Hawtin. The Rev. Dr. Herbert Stroup performed the ceremony on the Hawtin lawn overlooking the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Coins
description: THE General Services Administration has announced that it will exhibit a number of Carson City silver dollars during the American Numismatic Association's convention at the Jung Hotel in New Orleans. The 81st annual ANA show opens a fiveday run on Tuesday, Aug. 15.

title: News of the Camera World
description: SYMPOSIUM and workshop in photography, entitled The Creative Experience, will be conducted by the Friends of Photography, Box 239, Carmel, Calif. 93921 in August. Designed to bring together prominent authorities and artists, the worskhop will be conducted in two sections that will include presentations, lectures and panel discussions on a wide variety of topics related to photography and the arts. The first section will meet from Aug. 14 to 20, and the second section will meet from Aug. 19 to 25, with tuition for each section costing $200 for nonmembers and $175 for members of the organization. There is also a joint section offered from Aug. 14 to 25; this one to cost $300 for members and $350 for nonmembers. Professional credit is available for educators through the University of California at Santa Cruz. Enrollment for both sections will be limited, with a nonrefundable deposit required. For schedules and details write the Friends of Photography at the above address. The phone number is (408) 6246330.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: DO YOU KNOW ANY IMPORTANT MAN IN BUSNESS WHO DOES NOT READ FORBES MAGAZINE?ADVT.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: There is a critical time for any area when the downward economic forces move it inexorably in the direction of a slum. The Kerner Commission suggests that the critical moment is at hand when more than 30 per cent of neighborhood or area is of low income.

title: Ellen Everett Captures Nuance In Her Vardin aux Lilas Debut
description: One of the most interesting debuts of American Ballet Theater's current season at the State Theater took place Friday night when Ellen Everett appeared for the first time as Caroline in Antony Tudor's Jardin aux Liles.

title: Miss Herrera Wed To Charles Darnell
description: MIAMI, Fla., July 22Miss Carmen Herrera, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Antonio Herrera, was married this afternoon to Charles Darnell, son of Mrs. Chester Curtis of Miami Shores and the late Ray W. Darnell of Chicago. The Rev. Joseph Biain performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass in the St. Rose of Lima Roman Catholic Church.

title: Diary of a Novice Democratic Delegate
description: Dr. Clement Weinstein, never before active in politics, attended the Democratic Convention in Miami as a McGovern delegate from Queens and kept a diary, excerpts of which follow:

title: Advisers Back, Tass Says
description: MOSCOW, July 22 (Reuters) The Soviet press agency Tass reported that the first group of Soviet military advisers withdrawn from Egypt returned home today to an official welcome from military commanders.

title: RED CHINA SOUGHT U.S. TALKS IN 49
description: On May 13, 1949, less than a month after Communist troops captured the Nationalist capital of Nanking, a key Communist diplomat asked the United States Ambassador, J. Leighton Stuart, to visit Peking to discuss future relations with Mao Tsetung and Chou Enlaf.

title: Miss Beard Is Betrothed
description: Mrs. D. Plumer Beard of New York and Newburyport, Mass., and Francis D. Beard of Jacksonville, Fla., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Jennifer Beard, to Vincent Mills Badger of New York, son of Mr. and Mrs. Daniel Bradford Badger of Greenwich, Conn.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The issue Robert Abrams raises in connection with the Manhattan Landing project is, as he states, one of morality. His comments are of particular interest in light of the coverage given the Master Plan hearings and the reactions from around the city to the Manhattan Landing project itself.

title: TRANSPORTATION
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 22  The Federal Government has begun an effort that will attempt to take the guesswork out of car maintenance and repair.

title: Obituary 1 𠄄 No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: Warino, $3.80, Wins by 8
description: STANTON, Del., July 22 (AP) Harry Nesbitt's Warino recorded an eightlength victory today in the $7,500 Never Bend Purse at Delaware Park. The 4yearold gelding paid $3.80, $3.40 and $2.40.

title: The Nation
description: The title was grandiose, the substance at best uncertain. Last week Democratic Presidential candidate George McGovern named Lawrence F. O'Brien as his national campaign chairman. His task: To build bridges between Senator McGovern and two major islands of disenchantmentthe Democratic old guard politicians and the leaders of organized labor. The 55yearold Mr. O'Brien, who achieved political prominence back in 1960, gives something of an oldnew look to the youthful ranks of the McGovern camp. But the announcement made it clear that Mr. O'Brien would not have direct authority over the campaign; some suggested his title was pretty much honorary.

title: Rail Firemen Say Pact Will Have Little Effect
description: DETROIT, July 22There's one thing about the fireman, he knows he's got to try harder because his job is debatable, said Ed Hall.

title: State Funds Aiding ViolentCrime Victims
description: NEWARKA man goes berserk and guns down 12 men who have never laid eyes on him. Six die, leaving widows and children. Six others lie woundedone of them paralyzed at the age of 22, and another, 24 years old, destined to lose part of his right leg.

title: HAZE DRIVEN OFF, BUT HEAT LINGERS
description: HAZE DRIVEN OFF, BUT HEAT LINGERS ened to sue Con Edison to recoup.

title: Atlantic Beach Span a Bridge of SighsExasperating Ones
description: ATLANTIC BEACH, L. I.  Ye gods! moaned a chorus of beach., bound motorists as the red lights flashed and the gate descended in front of them. Slowly, the Atlantic Beach drawbridge was opened to allow a puny sailboat carrying three people to pass through.

title: Astros Conquer Cubs, 72
description: HOUSTON, July 22 (UPI)Don Wilson pitched a sixhitter and Cesar Cedeno hit a threerun homer to lead the Houston Astros to a 72 victory over the Chicago Cubs tonight. Wilson struck out 12 and walked only one. He gave up a home run to Joe Pepitone in the fifth inning and a runscoring double to Billy Williams in the ninth.

title: AMERICAN LEAGUE WILL START ALLEN
description: ATLANTA, July 22 (AP)A host of impressive sluggers will be teeing off in one of baseball's best parks for home runs Tuesday night when the American League and National League AllStars stage the 43d game of their annual midseason clash.

title: Deborah Lavinia Johnson Is Married
description: BOGUE INLET, N.C., July 22  Miss Deborah Lavinia Johnson and Lieut. Andrew Coulter Arje, U.S.N., were married here this afternoon. The Rev. Ralph Whitehurst of the Chapelbythe Sea performed a Protestant ceremony at the Johnson home.

title: New York
description: The sweltering heat and humidity that blanketed New York last week took its toll:

title: Pearl Buck Leaves Hospital
description: RUTLAND, Vt., July 22 (AP) Pearl Buck, the 80yearold author, was discharged today from Rutland Hospital where she had been receiving treatment for pleurisy for three weeks.

title: Education
description: They're compact, cheap and even a child can operate them. All of which helps explain why cassette tape recorders are having a major impact on education.

title: Brundage: Games Getting Too Big for ideals
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., July 22 (AP)  The Olympic Games are the greatest social force in the world, but they're getting too big and their ideals are being undermined by creeping commercialism says Avery Brundage.

title: Luncheon for OneIndividually Catered
description: LOS ANGELES . Sandwiches from the Moveable Feast are not as famous as chili from Chasen's, the Beverly Hills restaurant that has flown its special brand all over the world for Elizabeth Taylor.

title: About Pro Football
description: The College allstar game on Friday night from Chicago will start the television season in pro football. Channel 7 will carry the game here and it will be the first of nine national telecasts of preseason contests during the summer. The allstar game always does well, in the audience ratinzs because it is the first big event of the season, even though the outcome is largely predictable. This year, the defending National Football League champions, the Dallas Cowboys, will be favored by a large margin. The allstars have won this game only once in the past decade.

title: The Nation
description: CUSTER, S. D.It was George McGovern's 50th birthday, and his friends, gathered here for the party last Wednesday, provided him with a cake shaped like the White House. Around the edges were 36 tiny state flags (there wasn't room for the other 14). Whether by design or Freudian slip, one of the missing flags was that of Illinois.

title: Son to Mrs. John Sherwin
description: A son was born July 5 to Mr. and Mrs. John Graydon Sherwin of 1192 Park Avenue at the Lenox Hill Hospital. Mrs. Sherwin is the former Miss Patricia G. Hilbert of New York. The child, the couple's second and their first son, is named Kyle Francis. His father is a television sales executive with Blair Television Co., television stations representative.

title: Storm Drives Away Haze, But Temperatures Stay Up
description: Frazzled by a week of withering heat, foul air and power crises, hundreds of thousands of New Yorkers trekked to parks, pools and beaches yesterday to bask in the forgetfulness of shade and surf.

title: Reagan Praises Agnew
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., July 22 (AP)Gov. Ronald Reagan today praised the President's decision.

title: Japanese Premier Invited To China to Discuss Ties
description: TOKYO, July 22  Premier Kakuei Tanaka of Japan has been invited by Premier Chou Enlai of China to visit Peking to discuss the establishment of diplomatic relations.

title: Ellsberg Lawyers Prod Prosecution On Wiretap Order
description: LOS ANGELES, July 22Defense attorneys in the Pentagon papers case charged today that the Justice Department had failed to comply with a court order to disclose if any defense lawyers or consultants had been wiretapped by the Government.

title: WORLDWIDE ACTION ON PLANNING URGED
description: ATHENS, July 21Eightyfour scientists, scholars and intelluctuals called this week for concerted worldwide action to build human settlements in which man could live happily.

title: U.S. CREW UPSETS WORLD CHAMPIONS
description: MUNICH, West Germany, July 22 (AP)The United States Olympic eight, making its first start, upset world champion New Zealand today by two lengths to win a preliminary heat of the West German rowing championships. The United States covered the 2,000 meters on the $20million Summer Olympic facility in 5 minutes 48.58 seconds.

title: 25 Food Concerns Cited for Violations Of City Health Code
description: The Health Department has cited 25 more restaurants and foodprocessing establishments for serious violations of the city Health Code.

title: Ellington Gives Wisconsin His Music and Thoughts
description: MADISON, Wis., July 22The Duke Ellington Festival, which ended Friday night, was a weeklong tribute to the jazz pianist that started on Monday when Gov. Patrick J. Lucey proclaimed Duke Ellington Week in Wisconsin.

title: Port NewarkElizabeth Complex Becoming the World's Container Capital
description: PORT NEWARK  On a narrow strip of reclaimed land, wedged in between the New Jersey Turnpike and Newark Bay, moving to completion is a bustling port that many say will be the largest and most efficient shipping complex in the world.

title: Jeanie Albert Wed to J.S. Robinson
description: QUOGUE, L.I., July. 22Miss Jeanie Copland Albert and Michael Alexander Robinson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph S. Robinson of New York and Westhampton Beach, were married here this evening.

title: Television
description: OME assorted outtakes from coverage of the Democratic convention: It began with ominous talk about the possibility of anarchy in the streets of Miami. It ended with Abbie Hoffman being catty to Barbara Walters on the Today show. When Ms. Walters mentioned that Hoffman was 37 years old, the Yippie leader quickly insisted that he was 35, adding with a purr, the same as you, Barbara.

title: U.S. Aerial Team Will Map Amazon Basin in Peru
description: For the next three months, an aerial reconnaissance team from the United States will crisscross one of the world's most isolated jungles to prepare the first thorough map of the Amazon basin of eastern Peru.

title: Linda Hiddemen, Nils Wessell Plan to Be Married on Sept. 16
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 22Miss Linda Margaret Hiddemen and Nils Hartley Wessell plan to be married on Sept. 16.

title: Football Giants Get Taste of Jersey
description: WEST LONG BRANCH Geographically, as well as spiritually, the organization known to two generations of New Yorkers as The Football Giants has begun its transfer to New Jersey, but the natural enthusiasm of Jerseyites is being given only limited, lowkey stimulation by the Giants themselves.

title: Boy, 16, and Aussie, 44, Swim Across Channel
description: DOVER, England, July 22 (AP)A 16yearold British schoolboy and a 44yearold Australian salesman swam the English Channel today from France to the English coast.

title: A Suburban Rabbi Sees Power Shift
description: ENGLEWOOD  An increasing number of Jewish suburbanites in New Jersey are making their mark on the national Jewish scene, and one of the most prominent is Rabbi Arthur Hertzberg of Temple EmanuEl here, newly elected president of the American Jewish Congress.

title: Ervin Plans a Measure To Guard News Sources
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., July 22 (AP)Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr., Democrat of North Carolina, said today that he would introduce legislation to help newsmen keep news sources confidential.

title: Hanoi Claims 7 Planes
description: TOKYO, Sunday, July 23 (AP) North Vietnam said today that its antiaircraft gunners shot down seven American planes yesterday when waves of them attacked residential areas in Hanoi and the provinces of Namha, Ninhbinh and Nghean.

title: IN THE NATION
description: In his acceptance speech, George McGovern said the convention that nominated him was truly representative of the Democratic party and a product of the most open political Process in our national history. Some other Democrats are not so happy about what they call a quota system that guaranteed adequate representation to blacks, Chicanos, women and the young, but shut out some other people.

title: Town to Vote on Plan to Help Buyers of Poorly Built Homes
description: EAST BRUNSWICKA new attempt to enact pioneering legislation to protect buyers of new homes against shoddy construction practices will be voted on by the Township Council here this week.

title: Mary Weed Wed To a Psychologist
description: BERNARDSVILLE, N. J., July 22  Miss Mary Jane Bouton Weed, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Bouton Weed, was married here this afternoon to Dr. Cesar Octavio de la Garza, former chairman of the psychology department at Fairleigh Dickinson University, now with Drew University. The Rev. Philip K. Jensen, a Methodist minister, performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents.

title: Jersey City Awake, A 2Month Festival
description: JERSEY CITY  For the first time, the city fathers of this urban center are bringing culture In a big way to the masses.

title: Arthur Hodges, 71, Editor Of The Garden City News
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L. I., July 22 Arthur L. Hodges, managing editor since 1969 of The Garden City News, died last evening of a heart attack at his home, 15 Wachusett Street. He was 71 years old.

title: The Nation
description: The diesel engine first came into use on American railroads in a small way in 1924 but it was not until 13 years later that its effect on railroad labor first became an issue between unions and management. In that year the railroads suggested in contract negotiations that the firemen needed to shovel coal on the old steam locomotives might no longer be needed on the diesels.

title: Depression cutup, authentic blacks, modern gothic
description: Julius Lester has an eye for capturing the essence of a human experience. He is also an excellent storyteller whose reinterpretations of original source material, from history or legend, boldly proclaim the heritage of Afro  Americans. Long Journey Home, his third effort for young readers, consists of six stories powerfully recalling the era of slavery and its effects on black men and women.

title: N.Y A. C. W ins 3 Relays But Two Are Protested
description: The New York Athletic Club won three of the six events yesterday in the annual National Amateur Athletic Union relay championships at Downing Stadium, Randall's Island, but two of its victories were protested on charges of using an ineligible runner.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To THE EDITOR: The If You Go tailpiece to the excellent article on the Army War College at Carlisle Barracks in Pennsylvania (Travel section, June 18) may have given the impression that the Military History Research Collection is open only to military personnel or senior scholars. In fact, the Research Collection is open to any serious inquirer or researcher, civilian or military. Our users range from secondary schools to graduate schools and from generalists to specialists.

title: Leaking Tanker Spreads Oil Slick off Maine Coast
description: PORTLAND, Me., July 22 (UPI)At least 40,000 gallons of heavy oil leaked from a Nor wegian tanker early today and spread over a 30square mile area off the Maine coast about four miles from Portland, the Coast Guard reported.

title: World News Briefs
description: LONDON, July 22ChiChi, thought to be the oldest giant panda in captivity, died in her den at the London Zoo today. She was 15 years old.

title: HEROINUSE STUDY REFUTES BELIEFS
description: WASHINGTON, July 22  A study conducted in the BedfordStuyvesant and Fort Greene areas of Brooklyn says that heroin addicts in those parts of New York have more money and are better educated and more numerous than was previously supposed.

title: Merckx Turning Tour de France Into a Victory Cycle
description: VERSAILLES, France, July 22The race has been over for a week, and tomorrow, when it ends officially in Paris, Eddy Merckx will become the second man to win the Tour de France in four consecutive years.

title: Raiders Acquire Garay Of Jets in Martin Deal
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., July 22 The New York Jets sent Tony Garay, offensive tackle from Hofstra, to the Oakland Raiders today to complete an earlier deal for Don Martin, defensive back, and the team also went through a scrimmage.

title: ROYALS TOP ORIOLES ON SCHEIN BLUM HIT
description: KANSAS CITY, July 22 (AP) Richie Scheinblum capped a fourrun rally with a threerun triple, lifting the Kansas City Royals to a comeback 85 victory over the Baltimore Orioles tonight.

title: Sheep Flock at Low
description: CHEYENNE, Wyo.  For generations Wyoming sheep families have grazed their flocks on the prairie grass of the high plateau west of here. But in the last decade a number of threats to their traditional way of life have developed.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: We are indebted to A. Leonard Hausman for clarifying a heretofore dangerous problem [The Despondent Men, letter July 16]. Under the misguided impression that skyjackers had found either a quick route to a half million taxfree bucks or a politically inspired means to further embarrass the defanged forces for law and order, I plead to having been unsympathetic. Now that Mr. Hausman makes it all so plausible by explaining the personal integrity syndrome, I shall indeed calm my outrage and sympathize with these frightened, despondent men.

title: LETTERS
description: Mr. Dale's lameduek theory of President Nixon cannot be objective since it has no basis In Mr. Nixon's past budgetary programs. Mr. Dale assumes, a socalled conservative Congress, and President will cut down on total Government spending. Neither Mr. Nixon nor his political adherents in. Congress have shown any hesitancy, in committing vast sums to military spending, the major budget item, and the item that Senator McGovern has pledged to cut back considerably.

title: Miss Gardner Plans Nuptials
description: ROCKY HILL, Conn., July 22Mr. and Mrs. Marshall L. Gardner have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Sharon C. Gardner, to S. Phelps Platt 3d, son of Mrs. Leila Bronson Platt of New Canaan and Mr. Platt Jr. of New York.

title: Katherine Nelson Wed to R. R. Gumpert
description: SOUTHBURY, Conn., July 22  Miss Katherine Lindsay Nelson and Richard Ralston Gumpert were married here yesterday afternoon in the Church of the Epiphany (Episcopal) by the Rev. Frederick Pratley.

title: Bitter Fight Is Expected for Kiernan's Post
description: Edward J. Kiernan, president of the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association, plans to resign before the end of the summer, a step that could lead to a bitter fight for the union's top post.

title: Rumania Leads Soviet, 21
description: MOSCOW, July 22 (AP) Itie Nastase and Ion Tiriac defeated Alex Metreveli and Sergei Likhachov, 62, 64, 63, in doubles today, enabling Rumania to take a 21 lead over the Soviet Union in Eurbpean Zone B Davis Cup final.

title: Holzman Will Keep Wearing 2 Knick Hats
description: The guessing game is over. Red Holzman, who coached the Knickerbockers to their first National Basketball Association championship in 1970 and took them to the final round last season, will have the dual role of general manager and coach for at least three more seasons.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: ARLINGTON, Tex, July 22 (UPI)Aurelio Rodriguez figured in three Detroit scoring rallies with a home run and two singles to pace the Tigers to a 62 victory over the Texas Rangers tonight.

title: Student Loans Now Linked To Need, Not Family Income
description: WASHINGTON, July 22 (AP) The Office of Education has notified colleges and universities to resume processing student applications for federally guaranteed loans, but on a basis of need rather than family income.

title: Theater Recalls Diflinger's Death
description: CHICAGO, July 22  He came out of the Biograph Theater at 10:45 P.M., wearing a white silk shirt, gray flannel trousers, white shoes and a girl on each arm. He lit a cigarette, his last, as they moved to the left down Lincoln Avenue.

title: Stamps,
description: Jonas Haligrimsson of Reykjavik forwarded a cover bearing Iceland's stamp commemorating what was to have been the start of the SpasskyFischer world's championship of chess in the capital city of Iceland. Dated July 2, 1972 (2 VII 1972), it will, of course, signify the firstclay for the stamp. The championship, after the American's tantrums, a trip home by the referee, and other difficulties, had its first move, by Mr. Spassky, the Russian champion, on July 13. The stamp, black on pale green, shows a chessboard on which a map of the world is imprinted.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, July 22 (UPI) Senator George McGovern, the Democratic Presidential nominee, said today that if elected he would halt all aid to Greece within 10 days of his inauguration.

title: Coronet Among the Grass
description: Now what would you think of a novel in which the male protagonist is named Clever Drawers? Never mind.

title: 9 Chicago Police Suspended
description: CHICAGO, July 22 (AP)Nine Chicago policemen were suspended for 30 days yesterday for refusing to testify before a Federal grand jury investigating alleged shakedowns of tavern owners, Police Superintendent James B. Conlisk announced. Mr. Conlisk said he would seek to have the nine removed from the force. Two other policemen were jailed for contempt of court Wednesday for refusing to testify before the Federal panel.

title: John Krieger Marries Monica Schoelch
description: POUGKEEPSIE, N. Y., July 22  Miss Monica Rose Schoelch, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frank Schoelch of Toronto, was married at the Vassar College Alumnae House this afternoon to John Newton Krieger, son of Riven Krieger and Dr. Leah Krieger of Ellenville. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Hugh Nevin of the Long Island Campus Ministries.

title: Gardens
description: IN this jet age, can a National trend in any expressive subject such as flower arrangement be described? With the present speed of travel, almost any thought expressed today in one country, is copied or adapted in another within the space of weeks. Yet the more I travel the more I face the demand from some to know more of what the other is doing. I am most frequently asked to explainthe raison d'etre of English flower arrangements.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONWe are just spinning our wheels, Senate Majority Leader Mike Mansfield lamented early last week as Congress returned for a fourweek session between the national conventions. By week's end, however, the legislative wheels were finally beginning to touch ground, churning up some decisions along with much partisan dust.

title: Worldwide Drive on Smallpox Pressed in the Face of Statistical Rise
description: W.H.O. is now preparing for a critical 18month offensive that Dr. Donald A. Henderson, head of the agency's Smallpox Eradication Unit, believes will bring an end to the disease within sight. But Dr. Henderson, an American on loan from the Public Health Service, is keeping his fingers crossed. The number of reported cases of smallpox, after falling sharply between 1967 and 1970, has been rising rapidly since last year.

title: Editorial Cartoon 2  No Title
description: Editorial Cartoon 2  No Title

title: 14 Executed in Nigeria
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, July 22 (AP)  Fourteen convicted armed robbers were executed today by an army firing squad before a cheering crowd of thousands in Port Harcourt, it was reported in Lagos. The executions brough to 171 the number of Nigerians shot since the death penalty was decreed for armed robbery two years ago.

title: Grich Replaces Harrah
description: KANSAS CITY, July 22 (AP) Bobby Grich of the Baltimore Orioles was named tonight to replace Toby Harrah of the Texas Rangers on the American League team for the allstar game in Atlanta on Tuesday. Harrah has been bothered by shoulder ailment.

title: Social
description: Mr. end Mrs. Murray Weintraub. Huey 36 anniversary. We love you.

title: DugIn North Vietnamese Slash at the Lifeline Connecting Hue and Quangtri City
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, July 23Route 1, the vital supply link between Hue and the counterattacking Government troops in Quangtri Province to the north, remained virtually cut yesterday by North Vietnamese soldiers who have dug in along its sides.

title: Arson Arrests Here Increased By 26% Over First Half of 71
description: Arrests for arson here were up 26 per cent in the first six months of the year over the same period last year, according to figures released yesterday by the Fire Marshal's office.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Board of Education is planning to name a new $20million high school after Norman Thomas, a founder of the Socialist party and six times his party's candidate for President. A board spokesman said yesterday the name would be voted on at the board's July meeting Wednesday night.

title: Bishop Hill, Illinois: Failed Prairie Utopia
description: THIS land good, Olaf Norlund had written, in clear control of his feelings, if not his new language; his words were found on a panel uncovered not long ago by a team of enthusiasts who were restoring a church amid the remnants of a Swedish communal colony in Illinois.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I should like to voice my dissent from Robert Abrams criticism of the Manhattan Landing project (Manhattan Landing An IllAdvised Plan, July 2).

title: Jigme Dorji W angchult Is Dead; King of Tiny Himalayan Bhutan
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, July 22 (AP)Jigme Dorji Wangchuk, the Dragon King of Bhutan who tried to modernize his little Himalyan nation, died here last night. He was 45 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Mr. Robert Abrams is to be commended for his article. He expressed the opinion of thousands of people who have no way to express their disapproval of such an expensive project.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: LAC DESERT, QuebecAs hefty smallmouth bass smashed our surface plugs, lightning flickered in heavy black clouds over the southern end of the lake.

title: Sally Edwards Becomes Bride
description: HINSDALE, Ill., July 22Miss Sally Edwards was married here this afternoon to Warren L. Simpson Jr., son of Lieutenant Colonel Simpson, U.S.A.F., and Mrs. Simpson of Riverside, Calif. The bride's parents are Mr. and Mrs. Robert Edwards of Hinsdale.

title: Acupuncture Is Demonstrated At Chinese Medicine Seminar
description: SOUTHBURY, Conn., July 22 A new association of ChineseAmerican doctors ended this week its second seminar designed to introduce Chinese medicine to Western doctors.

title: Mormons Building New Temple On 57 Acres Near Washington
description: SILVER SPRING, Md. Mormons in the Eastern half of the United States will soon no longer have to travel halfway across the country for celestial marriages and other sacred rites unique to the Church of Jesus Christ of Latterday Saints.

title: Stability With Change
description: Such stability cannot be static; rather, it must be dynamic, with global balance resulting from movements in the exchange rates of particular countries. Within an overall system of balances, the dollar must be free move like any other currencyfor this country's sake and for the sake of others.

title: Spain Is Tied, 11
description: BARCELONA, Spain, July 22 (Reuters)Frantisek Pala beat Manuel Orantes, 75, 64, 06, 57, 64, to bring Czechoslovakia even at 11 with Spain today in the European Zone A final of the Davis Cup.

title: COCKER SPANIEL BEST AT PUTNAM
description: CARMEL, N. Y. July 22Ch. Sagamore Toccoa, a silverbuff cocker spaniel owned by Mrs. Peggy Westphal of Bedford, N. Y., and shown by Ted Young Jr., was selected by Robert P. Tongren today, as best of 1,484 dogs at the 19th show of the Putnam Kennel Club on the Kent School grounds.

title: That oldfashioned flavor
description: Icecream manufacturers can put more than 60 additives into their product to thicken, stabilize, flavor and color it. And they do not have to list them on the label. Apart from a few natural ice creams with limited distribution, the best way to get a good tasting product, with nothing superfluous added is to whip up a quart or two at home. One recipe here calls for a mechanical icecream maker; the other can be made in the freezer.

title: Shellfish Poachers At War With State
description: TRENTONThe State of New Jersey is waging a nightly and silent battle of wits against a small group of professional fishermen poaching for shellfish in the polluted waters along the coastline.

title: Tommie Smith Wins Sprint For Professional Crown
description: WAKEFIELD, England July 22 (UPI)The reigning Olympic 200meter champion, Tommie Smith of the United States, streaked to an easy victory today in a 220yard dash.

title: Gardens
description: Two SALVIAS ARE well known: the scarlet sage Widely used for summer splendor; and the common greyleaved sage used for seasoning. All the other treasures In this clan that grow worldwide in temperate and warm zones, come as, pleasant surprises to beginting gardeners. Some are aromatic herbs that scent whole hillsides in Mediterrannean countries; others were not discovered until the New World was explored. The singular twolipped flowers that are characteristic of salviiis  vary in size and color and are arranged in whorls on terminal stems.

title: FitzGibbon and Fishbach Gain Nassau Tennis Final
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., July 22Herb FitzGibbon of New York and Peter Fishbach of Great Neck won semifinal matches in the Nassau invitation tennis tournament today at the Shore Tennis Club.

title: Like killing cousins
description: On the night of August 24, 1814, a British army led by Rear Admiral Sir George Cockburn and Maj. Gen. Robert Ross entered the city of Washington and proceeded to burn the public buildings. This was done partly by way of reprisal for the Americans burning of York (the capital of Upper Canada), partly on general principles. Although Cockburn went about his business with a sailorly cheerfulness, it is doubtful if General Ross was ever at all easy in his mind.

title: Miss Kristen Tomassi Is Married To Richard Branson in England
description: who dropped out of school at the age of 17 to make it on his own, and didmarried yesterday, Miss Kristen Tomassi in England. The bride comes from Southport, Conn. The Rev. Hubert McCann performed the Anglican ceremony in Holy Cross Church in ShiptononCherwell, which is near Manor Studios, the bridegroom's property, Blenheim Palace, the traditional home of the Dukes of Marlborough near Woodstock in Oxfordshire, England.

title: Glen Cove Manor to Serve As Addict Treatment Center
description: GLEN COVE, L. I.A gracious, whitewashed brick mansion that has stood locked and empty for the last six years may be reopened soon by Community Hospital as an innovative rehabilitation center for drug addicts of this North Shore area. Renovation of the wideterraced house for its new role awaits only a use permit from the Glen Cove Board of Zoning Appeals.

title: How McGovern Lost a Delegate's Vote
description: TRENTON  A week or so before the Democratic national convention opened in Miami Beach, Lynn Merle, a delegate from Vineland and the Cumberland County coordinator for Senator George S. McGovern, was asked how long she would stay with Mr. McGovern if the convention went more than one ballot.

title: Treehouse By James Morrison. 181 pp. New York: The Dial Press. $5.95.
description: Treehouse is a gentle love story about nice people, which makes it an immediate standout. It incorporates a predictable element, but this is neatly blindstitched into the fabric of the narrative.

title: Monte Alexander's Live Jazz Helps Set the Records Straight
description: Monte Alexander has one of the most strangely split personalities in jazz. The split occurs between the image he presents on his recordsa pianist with an outlook so bland that even when he seems to be aiming at jazz it comes out pop and the reality of his performances in person, when he is an exciting, driving, sometimes electrifying pianist.

title: AGNEW SUGGESTS ACCORD TO PRESS
description: PORTLAND, Ore., July 23Vice President Agnew, freshly affirmed as President Nixon's running mate for reelection, flew in here today and, began campaigning.

title: 2 West European Trade Blocs Sign Merger Pacts in Brussels
description: BRUSSELS. July 22Western Europe's two trading blocs, the Common Market and the European Free Trade Association, were formally merged today in a treatysigning ceremony that produced a freetrade zone for 300 million people.

title: KEENELAND SALES START TOMORROW
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., July 22 (AP)  Yearlings from the secondtolast crop by Bold Ruler and the first by Majestic Prince go through the auction ring this week.

title: DEMENT CAPTURES FLYWEIGHT FINAL
description: FORT WORTH, Tex., July 22 (AP)Tim Dement, making his debut as a flyweight, rapped a steady stream of left jabs to the face of the Navy champion, Richard Dean, to capture the 112pound division final of the United States Olympic boxing trials tonight.

title: Nancy Ann Krumm Is Married To Joseph Sichler 3d in Jersey
description: BASKING RIDGE, N. J., July 22  Miss Nancy Ann Krumm, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert R. Krumm of Far Hills, was married here this evening to Joseph Eberhardt Sichler 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Sichler Jr. of Smoke Rise. The Rev. Walter L. Zeile performed the ceremony in the Somerset Hills Lutheran Church. He was assisted by the Rev. Charles Scott, an Episcopal minister and chaplain of Middlebury (Vt.) College.

title: Nice Note to Teller Fails To Get Teenagers Loot
description: Two 14yearold boys and a 15yearold girl were polite but unsuccessful in an attempted bank holdup yesterday in Brooklyn.

title: Music
description: THE Cultural Presentations Program of our State Department is not always involved with the glamorous (ballet, symphony orchestras) and the newsworthy (jazz, pop, rock). For one thing, the larger groups cost too much to send abroad. For another, cultural attachs in the embassies think it wise that the program occasionally show a change of pace. So last May, it put together the Composer's String Quartet and the New York Woodwind Quintet, threw in Alvin Brehm, doublebass player, for good measure and sent them on a 19concert tour of the Soviet Union.

title: Rikers Inmate Found Dead
description: A 29yearold prison inmate was found dead yesterday by two fellow inmates in a men's room in the Bikers Island infirmary, a prison spokesman said. He was identified as John Smith, of 1109 Forest Avenue, the Bronx. The cause of his death was not reported. The spokesman said that inmates reported finding a syringe near the body.

title: Pact Giving Base Pay of $13,550 Is Ratified
description: After about 20 months of negotiations, jobaction threats and some work stoppages, the 25,000member Patrolmen's Benevolent Association accepted a new 30month contract with the city yesterday.

title: G. E. Martins Have Son
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. George E. Martin of Frenchtown, N. J., last Sunday in the Hunterdon Medical Center in Flemington, N. J. Mrs. Martin is the former Sunny Griffin, the modelactress, and daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James A. Griffin Jr. of Towson, Md. The child is named Kelly. Her father is a producer of documentary educational and commercial television films.

title: CHILE IS PLANNING BELTTIGHTENING
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, July 22 A new, more austere policy for Chile's march toward socialism, emphasizing work, sacrifice and savings, is being undertaken by President Salvador Allende Gossens.

title: New Jersey
description: TRENTONIt was enough to make a grown man cry. What was widely regarded as the most comprehensive tax reform program ever proposed for New Jersey got only the back of the State Assembly's sweaty hand last week and Richard W. De Korte, Gov. William T. Cahill's principal legislative ally, broke down sobbing in the steaming Assembly chamber when he saw the pi6gram defeated by a vote of almost two to one.

title: The World
description: The fifth game of the world chess championship contest in Reykjavik, Iceland, between Boris Spassky, the Russian who is the reigning champion, and Bobby Fischer, the American challenger, began as usual last Thursday. Mr. Fischer was four minutes late. And he was complaining about the arrangements for the contest.

title: Yancey, With 204, Leads By 3 Strokes at Akron
description: AKRON, Ohio July 22Bert Yancey, a former West Point golf captain who has had limited success on the pro golf tour this year, held a threestroke lead today with a 54hole total of 204 in the $150,000 American Golf Classic. He carded a 67 for the third round.

title: Joseph P. McCarthy Dead; Was on JournalAmerican
description: Joseph P. McCarthy, a former assistant city editor of The New York JournalAmerican, died yesterday at St. Simons Island, Ga., after an illness of three months. He was 59 years old.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: SAN FRANCISCOEdward J. Daly, chairman of World Airways, Inc., has been competing with bigness all of his life, a process that has made him big himself.

title: Letters
description: Mr. Markham put his finger on the thread that leaps to an understanding of the cause and therefore possibly the cure of the spread of heroin addiction. Mr. Markham says that youthful enthusiasts, not middleaged pushers, are the true spreaders of heroin addiction. This is half true: it is not the youthful enthusiast but the youthful addict filled with nameless fear about the certainty of his next shot who performs these prodigies of salesmanship. Customers mean an assured supply for his own habit. Remove the legal restriction on heroin and he may continue to make converts but he will no longer feel irresistibly compelled to do so.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: Short, intense Jerry Fishman, a partner in Quote Me, Inc., waxed enthusiastic last week on how the twoyearold apparel producer could within two to three weeks transform daily communications from its European correspondents into knitted sportswear for women.

title: Bridge
description: THE gulf that separates the average domestic bridge player from the national champion is not only technical one, it is also a matter of psychology and selfcontrol. The inexperienced performer, through ignorance, constantly violates the proprieties of the game, by making revealing remarks, bidding or playing with special emphasis, or taking advantage of hesitations or other actions of his partner.

title: NEWSMEN DISAVOW GUILD ENDORSEMENT
description: WASHINGTON, Sunday, July 23 (AP)Nearly 300 Washingtonbased reporters and editors said in an advertisement today that they disavowed and disassociated themselves from the endorsement by the Newspaper Guild of any candidate for any office at any time or place.

title: Alaskans Reported Favoring Nixon
description: ANCHORAGE, July 22President Nixon and Senator Ted Stevens appear to have substantial early leads in their election campaigns In Alaska, in the opinion of political leaders throughout the state.

title: Fischer and Reykjavik Are Both Offering Ice and Fire
description: REYKJAVIK, IcelandIce and fire, one New York chess buff here said, is what Iceland's geography has to offerthe glaciers, the volcanos. And ice and fire is what Bobby is giving Spassky.

title: Mrs. Ettus Has Child
description: A daughter was born in Doctors Hospital on July 12 to Mr. and Mrs. Frank Ettus of New York. Mrs. Ettus is the former Miss Sandra Waldman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Avery Waldman of Far Rockaway, Queens.

title: Family Gets $100,000 For Death in Hijacking
description: SAN DIEGO, Calif, July 22 (AP)The family of a passenger slain during a hijacking attempt aboard a Pacific Southwest Airlines jetliner has received a $100,000 air travel insurance payment.

title: The World
description: Back in the late 1960's, a contingent of foresters from the United States Department of Agriculture was hard at work in South Vietnam trying to develop the timber industry in that country's lush forests, which produce fine mahogany and other valued hardwoods. They might have been surprised to learn that, simultaneously, other Forest Service experts were trying just as hard to burn some of those forests down.

title: S. E. C. Denounced by Proxmire On Earnings Reports by Litton
description: Senator William Proxmire assailed the Securities and Exchange Commission yesterday for its alleged failure to determine if Litton Industries was violating S.E.C. rules in its earnings reports, and called on the agency to start a fullscale investigation.

title: GARDNER WINNER
description: The New York Yankees staged their 26th oldtimers session yesterday in a painfully nostalgic waythey were beaten in the first half of a doubleheader, 10, by Steve Barber and Andy Kosco, a couple of Yankee oldtimers who now work for the California Angels.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTONThe story, is told here of a man who was visiting a small town on the Mississippi. One of the natives pointed to the river and announced that it was one billion and three years old.

title: Unsold Lottery Tickets Prove Jersey Bonanza
description: TRENTON, July 22 (AP)The owner of a Paterson hardware store has reaped a $50,000 lottery windfall because of slow summer sales.

title: WALL STREET
