description: PRAGUE, July 26 (Reuters) Six persons were jailed for terms ranging from 26 months to five years today on subversion charges in the central Moravian town of Brno. It was the fifth subversion trial in Czechoslavakia in the last nine days.

title: 6 Policemen, in Job Action, Snarl Palisades Traffic
description: TRENTON, July 26  Six patrolmen taking part in a job action, today tied up 14 miles of the Palisades Interstate Parkway, from the George Washington Bridge to the Rockland County line.

title: Cards Coach Hoping New Faces Will Prove Aces
description: LAKE FOREST, Ill., July 26To leave last place in their division this coming football season, the Giants will probably have to climb over the St. Louis Cardinals, a team in transition. Such prospects do not seem bright for New York, because Bob Hollway, the coach performing surgery on the Cardinals, says he has made much progress.

title: Retail Clerks Reelect Chief
description: HONOLULU, July 26 (UPI)The 26th convention of the Retail Clerks International Association today elected James T. Housewright by acclamation to his second term as president of the 650,000member union Mr. Housewright, SecretaryTreasurer William Maguire and all present members of the executive hoard were reelected without opposition by the 1,100 delegates.

title: Columbia Evaluates Its Security After Shooting of Dean Coleman
description: Columbia University's chief spokesman said yesterday that the administration would consider new security measures as a result of the shooting of college dean on Tuesday.

title: Philip Morris Sales and Earnings Set Records
description: Secondquarter sales and earnings of Philip Morris, Inc., set records and marked the 32d consecutive quarterly advance, the company reported yesterday. Revenues for the half exceeded the billiondollar mark for the first time.

title: Scott Dropped as an Astronaut; Stamp Affair a Consideration
description: HOUSTON, July 26 (AP)Col. David R. Scott of the Air Force, commander of Apollo 15 and one of three astronauts recently reprimanded for smuggling 400 stamp covers to the moon and back, has been dropped from the astronaut corps and given a space agency desk job.

title: Great Western United Sets Loans for SugarUnit Sale
description: A financing plan and preliminary commitments from institutional lenders have been presented for the purchase by the Great Western Producers Cooperative of the sugar business of the Great Western United Corporation, the companies said yesterday. A letter of intent had been signed by the two parties earlier.

title: DR. DAVID SEEGAL OF COLUMBIA DIES
description: Dr. David Seegal, professor emeritus of medicine at Columbia University's College of Physicians and Surgeons and a leader in research into chronic diseases, died Monday in ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. He was 73 years old and lived at 39 Claremont Avenue.

title: MGOVERN URGED BY SOME BACKERS TO DROP EAGLETON
description: CUSTER, S. D., July 26Senator George McGovern stood firm today against mountjng pressure from some of his supporters to drop his VicePresidential running mate, Senator Thomas F. Eagleton.

title: Barbara Adrian, Artist, Is Bride
description: The marriage of Miss Barbara Love Adrian, an artist, to Franklin Creighton Tramutola, administrator with the law firm of Sage Gray Todd & Sims, took place at the Waldorf  Astoria yesterday afternoon. Rabbi Ronald B. Sobel performed the ceremony.

title: Offering of $20Billion Is Made by Treasury in an Option Plan
description: WASHINGTON, July 26The Treasury today offered holders of nearly $20billion of securities maturing as far in the future as 1975, a package of exchange options, including a new 12year bond to yield 6.45 per cent.

title: MRS. ALFRED V. MORGAN
description: SPRING LAKE, N. J. July 26  Mrs. Annette McDonnell Morgan, widow of Alfred Y. Morgan, a beverage manufacturer, died today, at the age of 91. Her home was at 1035 Park Avenue, New York.

title: Gospel Rings Out Again at Soul Fete
description: A gospel service began the current forthnight of Soul at the Center program last Sunday, and the musical message of Jesus rang out again last night at Alice Tully Hall, punctuated by the shouts, cheers and occasionally the dancinghitheaisles of the small but jubilantly enthusiastic audience. Setting the pace on stage: two veteran exponents of the vibrant gospel style, Sister Rosetta Thorpe and Marion Williams.

title: Business Briefs
description: TORONTO, July 26 (Canadian Press)The Steel Company of Canada, Ltd., announced today plans to build mill at Welland, Ontario, to produce the largest pipe available in North America.

title: Defense Cost Growth
description: The General Accounting Office report on cost overruns of $28.7 billion on current weapons development programs is a useful reminder of continuing Pentagon inefficiency, if not of deliberate attempts to mislead the Congress by low estimates when weapons are being approved. But It misses the real point now in debate as the Senate votes on the defense procurement bill.

title: Among the Delights of Summer, Food Shopping in the Hamptons
description: AMAGANSETF, L. I.For vacationers in the Hamptons, their appetites whetted by salt air and summertime activities, food is certainly no problem, not even for those inclined to do the cooking at home rather than to dine out.

title: Sports of The Timcs
description: ATLANTA, July 26Before the AllStar Game last night, Gaylord Perry of the Indians seemed to sense what the script called for. He grinned at Jim Palmer of the Orioles and Wilbur Wood of the White Sox, two fellow pitchers on the American League squad.

title: Dr. Louis Nahum, 79, Dies; Yale Physiology Professor
description: NEW HAVEN, July 26Dr. Louis H. Nahum, professor emeritus of physiology at Yale and a former president of the Connecticut State Medical Society, died yesterday at his home. He was 79 years old.

title: Reventlow's Will Leaves Bulk of Estate to Widow
description: LOS ANGELES, July 26 (UPI) Lance Reventlow, heir to the Woolworth fortune who was killed Monday, left the bulk of his estate to his widow, Cheryl, according to a will filed in probate court today.

title: United Brands Says F.C.C. Extends Tropical's Service
description: United Brands Company said yesterday that its subsidiary, the Tropical Radio Telegraph Company, had received approval from the Federal Communication Commission to extend its services to Europe. The F.C.C. action makes Tropical the fourth United States carrier authorized to serve Europe, United Brands said.

title: SOYBEAN PRICES SHOW AN ADVANCE
description: A little squeeze play developed yesterday in oldcrop soybeans  the August delivery. Prices moved up about 3 cents a bushel to close at $3.50. The price contrasts sharply with the newcrop beans to be harvested later, such as the September delivery, which, closed at $3.32, up about 1 cents a bushel for the day.

title: Man in the News
description: When Eldridge Waith was promoted to assistant chief inspector in charge of all of Manhattan north of 59th Street a little over four years ago, he became one of the two highestranking blacks in the Police Department.

title: Tests Gauging Ability for Jobs Found Unbiased in 6Year Study
description: PRINCETON, N.J., July 26A sixyear study has shown that written tests to gauge future job performance do not discriminate against minority groups when the examinations are carefully administered, the Educational Testing Service announced here today.

title: NEWCOMBE BEATS STOLLE, 62, 64
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., July 26 (UPI)Topseeded John Newcombe polished off Fred Stolle, 62, 64, in the quarterfinals of a $50,000 tennis tournament today.

title: REVSON QUALIFIES FOR POCONO RACE
description: LONG POND, Pa., July 26Peter Revson survived a series of bad breaks today, including a blown engine, to lead the field in the second and final day of qualifying for Saturday's Schaefer 500 auto race.

title: Fighting Corruption Top Target For Stern as Federal Attorney
description: For the 19 months Herbert J. Stern has been the United States Attorney for New Jersey, be has, he says, devoted his energies and those of his staff to the nonpartisan prosecution of corruption.

title: Survivor of 32 Syphilis Study Recalls a Diagnosis
description: TUSKEGEE, Ala., July 26They came around one day in 1932 and told Charles Pollard he could get a free physical examination the next afternoon at a nearby oneroom school.

title: Business Briefs
description: DETROIT, July 26 (UPI)The Ford Motor Company will expand its Louisville, Ky., facilities to ease an assembly capacity that has been strained to meet the growing market for trucks, Ford announced today.

title: Ruth McKenney Is Dead at 60; Author of My Sister Eileen
description: Ruth McKenney, the author best known for her humorous short stories collected under the title My Sister Eileen, died Tuesday night at Roosevelt Hospital. She was 60 years old and had suffered from a heart ailment and diabetes.

title: 6 Britons Survive 37 Days Adrift in Dinghy on Pacific
description: PANAMA, July 26 (Reuters) Six Britons, including three children, arrived here yesterday after surviving 37 days adrift in a dinghy in the Pacific Ocean living on emergency rations and raw fish.

title: NET AT THE TIMES UP 22% IN QUARTER
description: Increased earnings and record revenues were reported yesterday by The New York Times Company for the second quarter and first six months of this year.

title: DiplomaMill Rise Disturbs Educators
description: Educators throughout the country are becoming increasingly concerned about the growing number of unaccredited colleges and universities that are sprouting on the fringes of academe.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Democrats need not succumb to despair because George Meany refuses to endorse the McGovernEagleton ticket. In 1968 the Democratic ticket had the solid support of labor; moreover there was no ogre of McGovern extremism to frighten the electorate. Yet the Hubert Humphrey whom Mr. Meany embraced lost to the Richard Nixon whom he abhors. Mr. Meany's support is not worth all that much.

title: NATO Dissension Over Nixon Accords Denied by the U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, July 26The State Department today disputed a dispatch of The New York Times from Brussels that described members of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization as baffled and bitter at President Nixon's signing of a declaration of principles with the Soviet party leader, Leonid I. Brezhnev, in Moscow.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today July 27, 1972
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY Committee on Colonialism, subcommittee on Pacific Ocean territories11 A.M.

title: $1Million Paperback Sale Sets Record
description: Paperback rights to I'm O.K.You're O.K., a layman's guide to selfanalysis by Dr. Thomas A. Harris, have been sold by Harper & Row to Avon Books for $1million. That figure is believed to be the highest for the reprint sale of a single book in publishing history.

title: Advertising:
description: The Howard Johnson restaurants and Motor Lodges account will be returning on Oct. 31 to Boston, which it left in 1968.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Con Edison should be commended for its SaveaWatt campaign. However, in view of the current power crisis, it is unfair to expect city residents to cope with brownouts and blackouts in this heat wave. Fans, air conditioners, refrigerators and freezers (not to mention lighting) are essential for comfort in the summer.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As an Argentine very much concerned with his country, I wish to make a few comments about Juan Peron's recent presidential nomination.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: No one who lived through the third week of July in New York City needs to be told about the electric power shortage.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In his July 14 letter, John Cabot Grampp asks if it is possible that the winning numbers in New York State's 50cent lottery are those of unsold tickets.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, July 26Senator Thomas F. Eagleton's disclosure yesterday that he had submitted three times to treatment for nervous exhaustion and fatigue may he a political event of the first magnitude and it may not. If the American public's view of mental problems has changed, it may be. over in a matter of a few days. If it has not, Mr. Eagleton will canstitutea drag on the Democratic ticket and may even be forced to withdraw as the VicePresiden tial nominee.

title: Market Place.
description: The selling began in earnest yesterdaybut there was a prelude on Tuesday. Behind it was another round of the game the institutions playwhich might be called, Let's get out of old X fast.

title: Chrysler Chief for Nixon
description: DETROIT, July 26 (AP)Lynn Townsend, chairman of the Chrysler Corporation, says that the election of Senator George McGovern as President would be a substantial setback for the tree enterprise, system. Mr. Townsend told newsmen yesterday that he opposed the election of Mr. McGovern and endorsed President Nixon for reelection.

title: Strikes by Protestants Close Most Industry in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, July 26 (AP) British troops and gunmen battled near Belfast's center today, and Protestant workers closed almost all of Northern. Ireland's, industry and commerce with strikes mourning the dead of last week's bombing.

title: SUIT ASKS INQUIRY ON CAR PRICE RISE
description: WASHINGTON, July 26 Ralph Nader and Consumers Union sued the Price Commission today in an effort to compel it to hold public hearings on the automobile companies proposed increases of 2.5 to 3 per cent in the prices of 1973 models.

title: Payments Picture For U.S. Is Mixed
description: The United States International balance of payments, showed a sharp improvement, in the second quarter on one, measure but little change on another, the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company estimated yesterday.

title: Advertising:
description: When a new ad agency opens and is hardpressed for business, some very interesting prospective clients often come knocking on the door with some unusual and generally cutrate arrangements in mind.

title: Executive Changes
description: Eloy Vidal has been elected a vice president Gulf Oil CompanyLatin America.

title: MRS. ABRAHAM BAKST
description: Mrs. Roslyn Bookstaver Bakst, widow of Abraham Bakst, who was a pharmaceutical wholesaler and manufacturer, died Tuesday in Mount Sinai Hospital. She lived at 340 West 57th Street.

title: Many Heed City's Call to Go Fly a Kite
description: The trick was to get 1,000 kites flying and keep the 250,000 feet of string being held by 1,000 children running on Central Park's Sheep Meadow from becoming one gigantic tangle.

title: MRS. MEIR APPEALS TO SADAT TO JOIN EFFORT FOR PEACE
description: JERUSALEM, July 26Premier Golda Meir appealed to President Anwar elSadat of Egypt today to join in making a new start toward peace in the Middle East, to meet as equals, and make a joint supreme effort to arrive at an agreed solution.

title: Enemy of Inflation In Argentina Quits CentralBank Job
description: BUENOS AIRES, July 26Argentina's antiinflationary forces suffered a sharp setback when the resignation of Carlos S. Brignone as president of the central bank was announced by the military Government here just before midnight yesterday.

title: Dr. Joseph H. Bragdon, 59, Led National Institutes Study
description: Dr. Joseph H. Bragdon, a pathologist who had been executive director of the dietheart study at the National Institutes of Health in the 1950's, died Monday at his home in Washington. He was 59 years old.

title: Jewish Groups Seek to Oust District School Chief
description: Four Jewish organizations called yesterday for the removal of Luis J. Fuentes as superintendent of Community School District 1 on the Lower East Side because of what they called his hostility to Jews.

title: MAN SAYS PHILLIPS WAS HOME DEC. 24
description: A man close enough to menbers of the Phillips family to be called Uncle Leo by them testified yesterday that he was with Patrolman William R. Phillips and his wife until 7 or 7:30 on the night that James Smith and Sharon Stango were murdered.

title: House Panel Again Puts Off Vote on an Antibusing Bill
description: WASHINGTON, July 26 (AP) A sharply divided House Education Committee voted today to postpone for another week any action on a strong antibusing bill.

title: Forest Hills Compromise Is Assailed by Both Sides
description: Mario M. Cuomo, appointed by Mayor Lindsay to mediate the Forest Hills lowincome housing controversy, yesterday recommended a 50 per cent reduction in the size of the project, and was immediately assailed by both sides.

title: Education Week Proclaimed
description: WASHINGTON, July 26 (UPI) President Nixon today proclaimed Oct. 2228 an American Education Week, declaring, Education is the doorway to opportunity. He said, Nothing matters more to the future of America than the strength, vitality and the success of its edu

title: Berman Sparks U.S. Five
description: TBILISI, U.S.S.R., July 26 (AP) The United States registered its second straight victory in the Yuri Gagarin basketball tournament, defeating the Soviet Union's National Junior team, 7969, today. Arnie Berman of Brown University led the Americans with 23 points.

title: U.S. Sending First Diplomat To Iraq Since the 1967 War
description: WASHINGTON, July 26 (AP) The first United States diplomat to be stationed in Iraq since the ArabIsraeli war in 1967 will be going to Baghdad shortly, State Department officials said today.

title: Rights to Distribute Soviet Films In U.S. Given to Company Here
description: WASHINGTON, July 26Soviet authorities have given a New York company a virtual monopoly in the distribution of Soviet motion pictures in the United States and in the production of films in the Soviet Union for showing on American television.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAING
description: ST. LOUIS, July 26Physicians who treated Senator Thomas F. Eagleton, holding to principles of medical ethics, declined today to comment or disclose further information on the Missouri legislator's history of psychiatric treatment and hospitalization, including electric shock therapy for depression.

title: Patrolman Slays Holdup Man After Facing a Threat of Death
description: An offduty policeman, lying on an elevator floor and threatened with death by an armed man who had just robbed him, pulled a gun from his ankle holster and shot the assailant dead, the police said last night.

title: 2 Others Given Oil Concessions Sought by Onassis and Niarchos
description: ATHENS, July 26A multimillion dollar Greek oil refinery concession, a bone of contention between two shipping millionaires, Aristotle S. Onassis and Stavros S. Niarchos, was awarded by decree today to two other Greek shipowners.

title: Germany's Biggest Frying Pan Sizzling Issue for Olympic Chiefs
description: MUNICH, West Germany, July 26 (AP)  Organizers of the Olympic Games, which open Aug. 26, knuckled down this week to solve problems uncovered during the five days of the West German sports championships held last week at the Games complex here.

title: $4Million Loan Authorized For Scottish Drilling Yard
description: WASHINGTON, July 26 The Export Import Bank has authorized a $4,455,000 loan for United States imports to be used in construction of an offshore drilling yard at Cromarty Firth, Scotland, the bank announced today.

title: Wallace Unable to Attend Independent Party Parley
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., July 26 (UPI)Gov. George C. Wallace said today that he would not attend the American Independent party's convention in Louisville, Ky., next week, but withheld comment on whether he Would accept the party's nomination for President.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: An offering of 1,081,000 shares of Avon Products capital stock at $117 was announced after the close of the market yesterday by an underwriting group headed by Morgan Stanley & Co., Inc., and Hornblower & WeeksHamphill Noyes.

title: CARLSON CHOSEN AS A.B.A. LEADER
description: At the height of lawsuits, contractbreaking and trust threats affecting the sports world, the American Basketball Association yesterday turned to a lawyer to become its new commissioner.

title: Michael Schneider Is Dead; Investment Banker Was 60
description: Michael Schneider, a director of Burnham & Co., investmentbanking concern, died at Mount Sinai Hospital on Tuesday evening. He was 60 years old and lived at 328 Melbourne Road, Great Neck, L.I.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: ATLANTA, July 26 (AP)Thirtytwo persons were arrested on charges of ticketscalping at the AllStar Game last night.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Adrienne Lederman (letter July 7) seems to think police and fire sirens could be less noisy.

title: Mangan, Raskind Victors In National 35ers Tennis
description: MANHASSET, L.I., July 26John Mangan of Rye, Dr. Richard Raskind of New York and Warren Woodcock of Forest Hills, Queens, reached the quarterfinals of the national claycourt tennis championship for men 35 years and over at the Shelter Rock Tennis Club today.

title: Scientists Say Tidal Waves Will Hit West Coast in 1973
description: MOSCOW, July 26 (UPI) Soviet scientists predicted today that undersea earthquakes would generate three or four seismic sea waves that could threaten the West Coast of North America between 1973 and 1975.

title: DOLLAR AND POUND WEAKER IN EUROPE
description: LONDON, July 26 (AP)Both the U. S. dollar and the British pound weakened in European foreign exchanges today although both currencies tended to firm at the close of business.

title: ADVANCES LISTED FOR OIL CONCERNS
description: Moderate profit advances were reported yesterday by several major oil concerns for the quarter and sixmonth periods ended June 30.

title: Reserve Chief Optimistic on the EconomyCalls Inflation Curb Vital
description: WASHINGTON, July 26 The Federal Reserve Board is in a favorable position to continue pursuing a path of moderate monetary growth, its chairman, Arthur F. Burns, told Congress today.

title: Senate Approves Funds to Begin Construction on a Fourth NuclearPowered Aircraft Carrier
description: WASHINGTON, July 26The Senate, in its first major test on the defense budget, approved funds today to start construction on a fourth nuclearpowered aircraft carrier that will cost at least $1billion.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: Seoul Appears Likely First Talk Site
description: PANMUNJOM, Korea, July 26  North Korean Red Cross negotiators indicated today that they would accept Seoul as the place for the first session of the full  scale NorthSouth Red Cross talks scheduled to open on Aug. 5 to discuss ways of reuniting separated Korean families.

title: MOZART FETE PUTS EMPHASIS ON BACH
description: The Mostly Mozart Festival, which began at Philharmonic Hall on Monday, lost no time in breaking away from Mozart to concentrate on Bach, the guest composer of the festival, as it were.

title: Asbestos Exposure Is Linked to Cancer In Cigarette Smoker
description: Two cancer researchers say they have confirmed through human lung cancer cases the theory that occupational exposure to asbestos enhances the cancercausing effects of cigarette smoke.

title: 50 SAIGON MARINES DIE IN COPTER CRASH
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, July 27 (AP)At least 50 South Vietnamese marines were killed on July 11 in the worst recorded helicopter crash of the Vietnam war, the Saigon command acknowledged today for the first time.

title: NIXON DISCLOSURE ON HEALTH ASKED
description: WASHINGTON, July 26Senator George McGovern's campaign manager proposed today that President Nixon and Vice President Agnew join their Democratic challengers in making detailed disclosures about their health.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., July 26 (AP)Jeanne Evert, Marita Redondo, Robin Tenney and Kathy Kuykendall advanced to the semifinals of the national girls 16 tennis championship.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAING
description: SAN DIEGO, July 26 (AP)The newspaper Guild's endorsement of Senator George McGovern's Presidential hid was criticized today by Guy Ryan, national president of Sigma Delta Chi. The national journalistic society believes newsmen should not get into the political arena by endorsing any candidate or any political party, Mr. Ryan ???

title: 2 City Policemen Answering a Call Shot in Brooklyn
description: Two policemen were shot but not seriously wounded in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn last night while investigating reports of a previous shooting at the scene.

title: Candyville's Victory Caps Baeza's Bittersweet Day
description: Braulio Baeza heard jeers at Aqueduct yesterday, and just about a halfhour later he heard cheers. The impassive rider from Panama was the target of the boos of many in the crowd of 23,049 after he had finished out of the money on an oddson favorite, but he, bounced right back to win the feature and the consequent applause.

title: Credit Markets
description: The Treasury's huge exchange offering, announced after the formal close of bond trading; yesterday, met with general approval in Wall Street despite the reservations of some that the Government might not get as many takers as it hoped.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: The New York Knicks, who lost in the final round the National Basketball Association playoffs to the Los Angeles Lakers last season, will play two preseason games against the New York Nets of the American Basketball Association. The games will be the first ever played between the Knicks and the Nets, who also reached the final round of the A.B.A. playoffs before bowing to the Indianapolis Pacers.

title: General Foods Sees Burger Chef in Black
description: TARRYTOWN, N.Y., July 26The Burger Chef fastfood operation, on which General Foods took a $39.7million after tax writeoff in fiscal 1972, is now operating in the black, C. W. Tex Cook told 750 stockholders at the annual meeting here yesterday.

title: PEGGY GLICK
description: Peggy Norton Rollason Glick, an editor in the Gregg division of the McGrawHill Book Company, died of cancer yesterday at St. Vincent's Hospital. She was 52 years old and lived at 18 Stuyvesant Oval.

title: Stones Are at Exciting Best in Finale
description: The Rolling Stones and radical chic came together last night in a virtually nonradical chic came together stop musicaltheatrical series of events that stretched from Madison Square Garden to the roof of the St. Regis Hotel.

title: Giant Rig Drills for Oil
description: PASCAGOULA, Miss. (UPI)The Ingalls Shipbuilding Division of Litton Industries built the world's largest submersible floating offshore oil drilling rig here in 1965. The rig stands 336feethigher than the Statue of Libertyand is capable of drilling to depths of 600 feet.

title: Chiefs, Metros Tie, 11
description: TORONTO, July 26 (AP)The Atlanta Chiefs and Toronto Metros played to a 11 tie tonight in a North American Soccer League game. The Metros held a 10 lead at halftime on a goal by Walter Muir. The Chiefs tied it at 18 minutes of the second half on a goal by John Cocking.

title: From Ungaro Fashion Show Worth the Wait
description: PARIS, July 26Emanuel Ungaro made it. After being known as promising for several years, he was finally acclaimed today as having produced the best collection in Paris. Of course, the competition wasn't staggering.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., July 26 (AP)Mrs. Moody Jolley paid the top price of $18.000 today as the FasigTipton Company of Kentucky held its first summer sale of select thoroughbred yearlings. Mrs. Jolley bought a bay son NantallahParnava from the consignment of W. K. Taylor, agent.

title: Huston Takes New Look at Life in Fat City
description: In Fat City, John Huston's fine film version of Leonard Gardner's novel, life is having a cigarette and no matchthen finding a match and getting slightly ill on the first puff.

title: DO YOU KNOW ANY IMPORTANT MAN IN
description: DO YOU KNOW ANY IMPORTANT MAN IN ???

title: DRAW BY FISCHER MAKES LEAD 4 TO 3
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, July 26Bobby Fischer and Boris Spassky played to a draw today after 49 moves in the resumption of their adjourned seventh game. The score now stands at 4 to 3 in favor of the American challenger.

title: Retail Food Prices Rose Sharply in June
description: WASHINGTON, July 26The retail price of farmproduced foods, which has been a weak point in the Government's antiinflation program, rose sharply again in June, the Department of Agriculture reported today.

title: JERSEY RACE WON BY NALEES FOLLY
description: OCEANPORT, N.J., July 26 (AP)In her second start since winning the Regret Stakes at Churchill Downs in May, Mrs. Pamela Furman's Nalees Folly came from the middle of the pack to win the $29,450 Seashore Stakes by 1 lengths today at Monmouth Park.

title: Clemente Sidelined Again; His Heels Are Swollen
description: PITTSBURGH, July 26 (UPI) The Pittsburgh Pirates announced today that Roberto Clemente would miss tomorrow's twilightnight doubleheader with the New York Mets because swollen heels impaired his ability to run.

title: News of Dogs
description: Mrs. Clayton L. Thomas is flying high these days. When she's not in a show ring, the Palmer, Mass., resident might be up in the clouds. She is secretarytreasurer of a balloon school. She also is president of the Pembroke Welsh Corgi Club of America and her license plate is CORGI 1.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The overwhelming yearning for peace that begot a McGovern bespeaks the highest aspirations of Americans for the good life. But the movement, already institutionalized, is in danger of deathaborning by its vituperative indictment of those who held other views in other circumstances. This both shortsighted and unjust.

title: Minstrel Miss Captures $16,925 Palomar on Coast
description: DEL MAR, Calif., July 26 (UPI)Minstrel Miss rallied in the stretch today to win the $16,925 Palomar Handicap before a record openingday crowd of 16,149 at Del Mar race track.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: TOKYO, July 26 (AP)Eighty of the world's top professional golfersled by Jack Nicklaus and Lee Trevinowill compete in the $300,000 Pacific Club Masters tournament in Japan in October, a Japanese organizer said today.

title: U.S. Effort in 1947 to Keep Latins Free of Foreign Ideologies Detailed in Book
description: WASHINGTON, July 26 The United States armed services overrode State Department resistance in 1947 and began an arms program for Latin America aimed at consolidating United States military influence and excluding foreign ideologies from the hemisphere.

title: ACCORD IS REACHED BY BELGIAN BANKS
description: BRUSSELS, July 27 (Reuters) The Belgian Central Bank and the banking commission completed details of the gentlemen's agreement with major commercial banks of the plan to withdraw 10,000million francs from circulation through interestfree special deposits by the commercial banks at the Central Bank, the Central Bank said today.

title: Chess Game Is Drawn
description: The seventh game of the world championship chess match in Reykjavik, Iceland, ended in a draw yesterday. The score now is Bobby Fischer 4, Boris Spassky 3. Details on Page 28.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: Madison Square Garden announced yesterday the ticket price scale for the Muhammad AliFloyd Patterson heavyweight 12round bout on Sept. 20. Ringside and loge seats will be $75. Other prices are $50, $40, $30, $20 and $10. Mail orders are being taken now. Box office sale opens Aug. 14.

title: Port Notes
description: The Coast Guard is encountering difficulty in maintaining its enlisted personnel strength at 35,000 men. A service spokesman has reported that the nationwide recruiting target in June was 900 men. However, only 619, of 68 per cent of the quota, were signed up during the month. For the Third Coast Guard District, with headquarters in New York, last month's quota was 108 enlisted men, but only 63, or 58 per cent of the quota, were recruited.

title: Gogolak on Target
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N. J., July 26With Pete Gogolak giving cause for joy with his placekicking and Joe Taffoni, an offensive tackle, apparently ready to start, plans for the football Giants opening preseason game Saturday in Canton, Ohio, took positive form today.

title: Avenue of the Americas
description: On a clear day you can see the futureon the Avenue of the Americas. On a hot summer day, when the city levitates, but relaxes, some of the splendor of the season transfers to the streets.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. The President sent a special message to Congress urging the enactment of a spending ceiling of $250billion.

title: Business Briefs
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 26 (AP)Eleven creditors Martin M. Decker asked the United States District Court here today to delay a ruling made earlier this month by a referee that he was bankrupt. The creditors also asked that Morris Gerber and Matthew B. Weinstein, the trustees of Mr. Decker's $70million realestate empire, be removed.

title: Three Spacemen Start 56Day Stay in Skylab
description: HOUSTON, July 26 (UPI) Three rookie astronauts, looking forward to the next 56 days isolated in a 20foot chamber, entered a mockup of a space station today to conduct experiments and evaluate the cramped living conditions.

title: BETHLEHEM NET REPORTED LOWER
description: Lower earnings, revenues and shipments for the second quarter and first half of the year were reported yesterday by the Bethlehem Steel Corporation.

title: MARGUERITE JOHNSON
description: JAMESBURG. N.J., July 26Miss Marguerite A. Johnson, who taught 48 years in the Kensington School in Great Neck, LA., until her retirement in 1963, died today in the Princeton Hospital. She leaves a brother, S. Taylor Johnson Jr.

title: Mick Jagger, 29, Gets a PutOn, TurnedOn Sendoff
description: Please allow me to introduce myself; I'm a man of wealth and taste, Mick Jagger wrote in Sympathy for the Devil, the song sung at Altamont but conspicuously absent from the latest live performances of the Rolling Stones.

title: Dr. David R. Lyons Is Dead; Neurologist in Jersey, 47
description: NEWARK, July 27 (UPI) Dr. David R. Lyons, chief of neurology and psychiatry at St. Michael's Hospital here, died yesterday at St. Barnabas Med ical Center, Livingston. He was 47 years old.

title: AaronCoody Take Stroke Lead on 62
description: LIGONIER, Pa., July 27  Arnold Palmer and his youthful partner, Jack Lewis, who be came a lastminute replacement for the ailing Jack Nicklaus, scored a 66 today in the open ing round of the Professional Golfers' Association national team championship.

title: JERSEY RELEASES NEW TRANSIT PLAN
description: TRENTON, July 27  The State Transportation Depart ment released details today of a 20year master plan that calls for spending $6.6billion to increase capacity on state roads, improve mass transit be tween Manhattan and northern New Jersey and establish a state system of publicly owned generalaviation airports.

title: Mrs. Cooperstein Triumphs
description: RUMSON, N. J., July 27 Mrs. Walter Cooperstein of Glen Oaks shot a 77 today for a to tal of 232 and won the 39th Women's Metropolitan Golf As sociation 54hole strokeplay championship at the Rumson Country Club.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: The president of the state American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Or ganizations, Raymond R. Cor bett, informed union leaders throughout the state yesterday that the state group would fol low the lead of the national A.F.L.C.I.O. executive council and remain neutral in the Presi dential race.

title: Four Olympic Gold Medalists Receive Silver Medals
description: Four past Olympic gold medal winners, Jesse Owens, Bob Mathias, Johnny Weiss muller and Peggy Fleming were presented sets of ster ling silver commemorative medals depicting great mo ments in Olympic history at a luncheon at The Four Sea sons Restaurant yesterday. Wilma Rudolph, another Olympic champion, also was honored but was unable to attend. The medals were de signed by the noted sculptor, Seymour Chwaste, for the Franklin Mint. CocaCola USA will put the 17medal set on sale through its bot tlers on Aug. 7, and the net proceeds will be donated to the United States Olympic Committee. CocaCola USA will he a participating spon sor of the telecasts of the summer Games from Munich, West Germany. sons Restaurant yesterday. Wilma Rudolph, another Olympic champion, also was honored but was unable to attend. The medals were de signed by the noted sculptor, Seymour Chwaste, for the Franklin Mint. CocaCola USA will put the 17medal set on sale through its bot tlers on Aug. 7, and the net proceeds will be donated to the United States Olympic Committee. CocaCola USA will he a participating spon sor of the telecasts of the summer Games from Munich, West Germany.

title: Chris Evert Draws Mrs. Court as Rival
description: CLEVELAND, July 27 (AP) The first bestofseven match series between women tennis teams of the United States and Australia will start tomorrow afternoon on the Arnold T. Clark Memorial courts.

title: SIDEROWF WINS 2 GOLF MATCHES
description: MANHASSET, L. I., July 27 Dick Siderowf, the Westport, Conn., stockbroker playing out of the country club of Aspe tuck, triumphed twice today in the Metropolitan Golf Associa tion's amateur championship over the par70, 6,596yard Deepdale Club course.

title: A.&P. Chain Facing Complaint on Ads
description: WASHINGTON, July 27The Federal Trade Commission said today that it planned to lodge a complaint against the A. & P. food chain; the nation's largest, because several of its stores had allegedly advertised prod ucts at sale prices but had failed to make them available or had sold them only at high er prices.

title: TREASURY BONDS INCREASE IN RATE
description: Credit Markets

title: POLEMICS MARK SESSION IN PARIS
description: PARIS, June 27The 152d meeting of the Paris peace talks was held here today and Com munist and Western sources said that there had been no change from the positions the United States and North Viet nam took at secret talks eight days ago.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The Western Electric Com pany, the manufacturing arm of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company, received a $205.8million addition to a previously awarded Army con tract for continued research and development on the Safeguard antiballistic missile system, it was announced yesterday.

title: TheHour for Change
description: Israeli Prime Minister Golda Meir gave full recognition to the potential significance of President Sadat's eviction of Soviet advisers from Egypt when she told the Knes set: It would seem that this hour in the history of Egypt can, may, should be the appropriate hour for change. And, if it truly is the hour for change, let not be missed.

title: Connecticut Women Win
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., July 27 The Connecticut State Wom en's Golf Association, which had lost its first two meetings with the women's TriCounty Golf Association, won its third annual team match, 29 to 15 today at Brooklawn Coun try Club.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: TRENTON, July 27 (UPI) Charles J. Garrity, the Trenton bureau chief for The Newark StarLedger, was named press secretary to Gov. William T. Cahill today. Mr. Garrity, 49 years old, of Union City, suc ceeds Thomas J. Flynn, who resigned June 30 to become editor of The Camden Courier Post.

title: Ben Kahn Sold by Kenton
description: The Ben Kahn Furs Corpora tion, a manufacturer and re tailer of furs, has been sold by the Kenton Corporation to, Ernest Graf, president of Ben Kahn, for an undisclosed amount of cash and notes. The fur concern, which has an an nual volume of about $3mil lion, will continue to operate at its two Manhattan locations.

title: STATES URGED TO SET STANDARDS ON POLICE
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy, calling crime rates in the country a national dis grace, said yesterday that state governments should play a stronger role in law enforce ment.

title: President Requests $135Million to Aid Antidrug Campaign
description: WASHINGTON, July 27  President Nixon asked Con gress today for $135.2million in supplemental funds for his campaign against drug abuse, including $2.5million for a new office of national narcotics intelligence.

title: DR. ERNEST J. JAQUA OF SCRIPPS COLLEGE
description: CLAREMONT, Calif., July 27 Dr. Ernest J. Jaqua, first president of Scripps College here, died this morning at his home after a short illness. He was 89 years old.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: Esteban DeJesus of Puerto Rico, the world's sixth ranking lightweight, is a 3to1 favorite to defeat once beaten Chuck Wilburn of Cleveland tonight at Madison Square Garden in the 10round main bout, one of three 10rounders on the card.

title: Mao Is Quoted as Saying Lin Was Killed in Crash
description: PEKING, July 27Chairman Mao Tsetung has broken months of official silence on the fate of former Defense Minister Lin Piao by telling two foreign statesmen in recent weeks that Mr. Lin was killed in an air crash last year while fleeing the country in the wake of an attempted coup. weeks that Mr. Lin was killed in an air crash last year while fleeing the country in the wake of an attempted coup.

title: Advertising:
description: The telephone book is the basic source of names for much consumer research, But is the research coming from it valid if it excludes all those folks with unlisted phones and those without phones?

title: Ginzburg Paroled, But De Sapio Is Not
description: WASHINGTON, July 27The United states Parole Board granted parole today to Ralph Ginzburg, the former publisher of Eros, a quarterly magazine, who was convicted of sending obscene material through the mail.

title: Suspect in Columbia Shooting Described as Under Pressure
description: Eldridge McKinney, who is being sought in connection with the Tuesday shooting of a Columbia College dean, was keenly aware of the pressures of being a black student at the school and his outlet was com panionship with a tightly knit group of young men from sim ilar backgrounds, a close friend said yesterday.

title: Nation's Productivity Shows Strong Rise
description: WASHINGTON, July 27 The nation's productivity, or output per manhour, rose strongly in the second quarter of this year, the Labor Depart ment reported today.

title: Elizabeth Henley, an Editor Of Social Action Magazine
description: Elizabeth C. Henley, associate editor of Social Action, a maga zine published by the United Church of Christ, died of cancer Wednesday at poctors Hospital. She was 59 years old.

title: Melton Lost for Season; Has Rare Back Treatment
description: CHICAGO, July 27 (AP) Bill Melton, the Chicago White Sox third baseman who led the American League in home runs last year with 33, apparently is out for the season.

title: PBW SEAT SOUGHT BY CONNECTICUT
description: HARTFORD, July 27Con necticut has acquired an option on a seat on the PBW Stock Exchange in Philadelphia, in order to trade common stocks directly in the management of state pension and retirement funds.

title: U.S. COURT ENJOINS STUDENT MARKETING
description: WASHINGTON, July 27 (AP)A Federal judge here is sued a permanent injunction today against the National Student Marketing Corporation, barring the company from vio lating antifraud, reporting and proxy provisions of Federal securities laws.

title: On Fat Pitches for Charity's Sake
description: Sports of The Times

title: 2 PHOENIX PLAYS BOW IN DECEMBER
description: The Phoenix Theater, the nonprofit organization of which T. Edward Hambleton is man aging director, will open Eu gene O'Neill's The Great God Brown and Moliere's Don Juan respectively on Dec. 10 and Dec. 11 at the Lyceum Theater, which hag served as Phoenix headquarters in the past.

title: East Coast Heroin Flow Is Reported Cut
description: The supply of heroin for East Coast addicts has declined sharply in the last year, send ing the price of the drug soar ing, according to officials of the Federal Bureau of Nar cotics and Dangerous Drugs.

title: PLAN IS DETAILED FOR SAFE SCHOOLS Training of Aides to Prevent Violence to Begin Soon
description: The Board of Education yes terday made public its school safety plan to get the cops out of the schools and replace them with specially trained but unarmed men and women who will work with students and the surrounding community in an effort to prevent school vio lence.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, July 27  Six Spanishspeaking Ameri cans, all of whom said they were normally Democrats, an nounced their support for Presi dent Nixon today at a news conference sponsored by the Committee for the Reelection of the President.

title: A BOYCOTT IS ASKED ON MAKER OF SLACKS
description: WASHINGTON, July 27Sen ator Gaylord Nelson, Democrat of Wisconsin, announced today the formation of a committee to support a strike against the Farah Manufacturing Company. He called for a nationwide boy cott of the company's products.

title: Roundup: Jenkins Hurls 1Hitter Over ExMates
description: Ferguson Jenkins reminded the Phildelphia Phillies of one of their worst mistakes last night. The 6foot 5inch right hander, whom the Phillies traded to the Chicago Cubs in 1966, allowed Philadelphia just one hit as the Cubs won the first game of a double header, 40, at Philadelphia.

title: As the Demand for Abortions Increases in Britain, a New Type of Clinic Is Developing
description: BRIGHTON, England, July 24  About 30 young women, toting overnight bags, arrive in this faded seaside resort every day outside an old Vic torian mansion that used to be known as Wistons' Girls School. Now it is called Wistons' Nurs ing Home and it is one of the busiest abortion clinics in Brit ain.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., July 27 (UPI)The best Soviet and American teenage track athletes compete tomorrow and Saturday nights at Hughes Stadium in the first meet between juniors of the two countries.

title: MONETARY RESERVES DIPPED DURING JUNE
description: WASHINGTON, July 27 (Reu ters)United States monetary reserves fell $6million in June to $13,339,000,000, the Treas ury reported.

title: SPASSKY DRUBBED: NOW TRAILING,53
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, July 27  Decisively whipping Boris Spassky  even, for a while, toying with him  Bobby Fischer moved into a com manding 53 lead today in the world championship chess match.

title: Van Nostrand, Weld Reach 35ers' Tennis Semifinals
description: MANHASSET, L.I., July 27 Last year's winner, King Van Nostrand of Brightwaters, L.I., and Ned Weld of Weston, Mass., reached the semifinals of the national claycourt tennis championship for men 35 years and over at the Shelter Rock Tennis Club today.

title: NEW HEAD IS NAMED TOLIQUOR AUTHORITY
description: Governor Rockefeller an nounced the appointment yes terday of Bertram D. Sarafan, a lawyer with a 35year career in public posts, as chairman of the State Liquor Authority.

title: PROFITS SOARING FOR AUTO MAKERS
description: DETROIT, July 27The Ford Motor Company and the Amer ican Motors Corporation re ported soaring profits today for the June quarter.

title: $198Million Loss For Boise Cascade
description: The Boise Cascade Corpora tion reported yesterday second quarter income of $1.51million, which a $200million extra ordinary charged reduced to a loss of $198.49million, com pared with $40.24million net loss in the yearago quarter after an extraordinary charge of $44million.

title: Exchange Data Functions Restored
description: Business Briefs

title: Commodity Price Index Off To 119.7 From 119.5 Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and in dustrial materials rose to 119.7 from 119.5 last week.

title: Lawyer Is Indicted on a Bribery Charge
description: A lawyer who had been a city policeman was indicted here yesterday on a charge that he had offered a $20,000 bribe to a narcotics detective to commit perjury in a Bronx heroin case.

title: NEIL M'CARTHY, 84, A HUGHES LAWYER
description: LOS ANGELES, July 27Neil S. McCarthy, millionaire sports man and lawyer and former executive in the Howard Hughes empire, died here Tues day at Good Samaritan Hospi tal after a stroke. He was 84 years old.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: IF YOU'RE; NOT DRINKING WILLIAM ??

title: HARRIET HAYES
description: CARMEL. Calif., July 27  Miss Harriet Hayes, who retired as professor of education at Teachers College, Columbia University, in 1947, died yester day in a nursing home here after a long illness. She was 88 years old.

title: Ramsey Clark Joins a Group Leaving Moscow to See Dikes
description: MOSCOW, July 27Former Attorney General Ramsey Clark has joined an international in quiry group that plans to leave Moscow by air for Hanoi tomor row to investigate the reports of United States bombings of dikes and towns in North Viet nam.

title: F.T.C. Issues a Complaint Challenging Heublein Deal
description: The Federal Trade Commis sion issued yesterday a pro posed complaint challenging the acquisition by Heublein, Inc., of a controlling interest in United Vinters, Inc.

title: Nicklaus Out of Hospital Hopes to Defend Title
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, July 27 (UPI)Jack Nicklaus was re leased this morning from University Hospital after undergoing surgery on an in fected right index finger. He said he was hopeful that he would be able to defend his Professional Golfers' Associ ation title next week at Bir mingham, Mich.

title: POTATO FUTURES SCORE ADVANCES
description: Potatoes, platinum and silver scored impressive gains yes terday in futures trading.

title: British Port Strike Voted Despite Dockers' Release
description: LONDON, July 27Militant dockers voted today to keep all British ports closed, despite the pleas of their top leaders and the release yesterday of five jailed colleagues.

title: Many at Grumman Face Layoffs in Loss of Contract
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., July 27 Five hundred to 600 workers may be out of their fobs as a result of Grumman Aerospace Corporation's loss of the con tract for the space shuttle to North American Rockwell Cor poration, company officials said here today.

title: STOCK PRICES OFF THIRD DAY IN ROW
description: There was a nervous under tone to the stock market yes terday as prices registered their third straight setback and as another big glamour issue Holiday Innsplunged sharply.

title: JERKENS'S ENTRY 1,2 AT AQUEDUCT
description: Blessing Angelica and Sailly Le Sec engaged in a tense stretch duel in the feature race at Aqueduct yesterday, with the former prevailing by three quarters of a length.

title: PILIC TOPS LAVER IN STRAIGHT SETS
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., July 27 (AP)Nikki Pilic defeated Rod Laver in straight sets today to gain the quarterfinals of the $50,000 Pro Classic at Louis ville.

title: Bache Is Recruiting More Black Brokers
description: Bache & Co., the nation's secondlargest stock broker age house, disclosed yester day that it wants to hire more black stock brokers and is actively recruiting to find them.

title: Paper Resumes Publication
description: CANTON, Ohio, July 27 (AP) Publication of The Canton Repository, halted for more than five months by a News paper Guild strike, was resumed today with an 84page edition. The strike, which began Feb. 19, ended last Friday, when the guild accepted a new contract providing pay raises of $25 to $45 a week and improved fringe benefits.

title: Robert B. Peck, a Rewriteman For Herald Tribune, 87, Dead
description: KINGSTON, N. Y., July 27 Robert B. Peck, who for 43 years was a top rewriteman on The New York Herald Tribune and its predecessor, The New York Tribune, died yesterday in a hospital here. He was 87 years old and had lived on a farm near Skokan in the sum mers and in Charleston, S. C., in the winters since his retire ment in 1955.

title: U. S. to Evaluate Acupuncture For Safety and Effectiveness
description: The National Institutes of (Health said yesterday that it planned to conduct a major study of acupuncture to deter mine whether the Chinese needle technique was safe and effective as a painkiller in sur gery and when used for the re lief of chronic pain arising from (certain diseases.

title: Rogers Offers Briefings To McGovern and Eagleton
description: WASHINGTON, July 27 (AP)  Secretary of State William P. Rogers will make himself and his aides available to brief Senator George McGovern and Senator Thomas Eagleton on foreign affairs, a State Depart ment spokesman said today.

title: EXCHIEF DEFENDS SYPHILIS PROJECT
description: WASHINGTON, July 27 (AP) A former Government doctor who played a key role in a Federal syphilis study involv ing Alabama black men says, There was nothing in the experiment that was unethical or unscientific.

title: Rail Freight Traffic Up
description: WASHINGTON, July 27The Association of American Rail roads reported freight traffic on United States railroads dur ing the latest week totaled an estimated 14.7 billion tonmiles, 11.3 per cent above the corres ponding week last year.

title: Once More, Columbia Starts Work on a New Gym
description: Without ceremony, work be gan yesterday on a new Co lumbia gymnasium, a project that has vexed the university since the end of the last cen tury.

title: Footlights at Williamstown Lure Pros and StarryEyed
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., July 27On the day that Bertolt Brecht's The Resist ible Rise of Arturo Ui went into rehearsal at the Wil liamstown Theater, Peter Hunt, the director, told the male apprentices who had been cast in minor speaking roles and walkons that they would have to cut their long hair and shave their beards.

title: Executive's Wife Kidnapped For Ransom in Minneapolis
description: MINNEAPOLIS, July 27 (AP) Mrs. H. C. Piper Jr., wife of the board chairman of Piper, Jaffrey & Hopwood, Inc., an investment and brokerage con cern, was kidnapped by two masked men from her home today and held for ransom, the Federal Bureau of Investigation reported.

title: New Bombings and Killings
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, July 27Terrorist bombings and shootings continued in Northern Ireland today as the British Army pressed its steppedup offensive against the I.R.A.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Son of Former Czech Party Official Is Sentenced to 2 Years
description: PRAGUE, July 27 (Reuters) The son of the former Com munist party secretary Jaroslav Sabata was sentenced to two and a half years in prison for subversion, it was announced today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: MONEY EXPANSION EASES FOR WEEK
description: Monetary expansion, which accelerated markedly in the first half of July largely be cause of temporary seasonal factors, appears to have sub sided to more normal levels in the tatter part of the month, the Federal Reserve System re ported yesterday.

title: Candidate Eagleton
description: The issues that should concern American voters in the Presidential election are now obscured by the belated revelation of Senator Eagleton, the Democratic nominee for Vice President, that he was three times hospitalized for nervous exhaustion and depression.

title: MARGARET LOBSENZ
description: Margaret Lobsenz, who was one of the first women to be hired as a teacher in the New York City school system, died yesterday at her home, 327 Central Park West, after a long illness. She was 80 years old.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: TORONTO, July 27 (AP)Three men have been picked up, questioned and released as the police press the hunt for the person who used a baseball bat to remove a goldmedal horse and rider from Canada's 1972 Olympic team.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: CUSTER, S. D., July 27The quiet euphoria that filled Sena tor George McGovern's Sylvan Lake vacation retreat as re cently as last weekend, when staffers gathered in the com mon hall of the lodge among the pines for a singalong with the Presidential nominee, has disappeared.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Walcott's TiJean Opens in Park
description: It is vital for any classic theater to have a life that is not completely entrenched in the past. Joseph Papp's New York Shakespeare Festival has understood this very well, and its activities at its Public Theater on Lafayette Street are almost exclusively contemporary. However, for its Central Park productions the company has clog to the classics, with, of course, a very solid emphasis on Shakespeare.

title: Store Sales Up for Week
description: WASHINGTON, July 27The Department of Commerce re ported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $818million, 12 per cent above the yearearlier $729million. Total retailstore sales were about $8,745,000. 000, 10 per cent above the yearearlier $7,709,000,000.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, July 27 (Reuters)Interest rates on conventional home mortgage loans increased slightly in June for the second month in a row following three previous months of decline, the Federal Home Loan Bank Board said today.

title: CHESTER JONES, INTERNIST, DIES
description: BOSTON, July 27Dr. Ches ter Morse Jones, a noted gas troenterologist and former pres ident of the American Gastro enterological Association and chairman of the American Board of Internal Medicine, died last evening after a long illness. He was 81 years old and had been staying at his summer home in Jaffrey, N. H.

title: ANN LIPMAN
description: Miss Ann Lipman, who head ed her own publicrelations agency, died Wednesday in Lenox Hill Hospital, after sur gery. She was 32 years old and lived at 11 East 74th Street.

title: Podiatrists Name President
description: BOSTON, July 27 (AP)Dr. E. Dalton McGlamry was named president of the American Podi atry Association today at the group's annual convention here. Dr. McGlamry, a graduate of Temple University, is chief of podiatry service at Doctors Hos pital, Tucker, Ga., and serves on the surgical staff of Mc Lendon Memorial Hospital in Atlanta.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Yankees Triumph, 62, Over Red Sox
description: Home runs by Bobby Murcer and John Callison, plus another save by Sparky Lyle, were chief ingredients last night as the Yankees successfully opened the second half of the season.

title: Advertising:
description: Tinker, Dodge & Delano, which has been a Warner Lambert agency for some time, has just been assigned the company's Pristeen, a feminine deodorant spray.

title: Bridge: TopRated Teams Start Play In Second Round of Spingold
description: DENVER, July 27  The second round of Spingold knockout team champion ship play here this afternoon saw the first appearance of the topseeded teams, which had a bye yesterday.

title: New Air Force Jet Tested
description: EDWARDS AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., July 27 (AP)  Flight testing of the Air Force F15 Eagle, the first United States jet fighter with more thrust than weight, began here today. A spokesman said that the singleseat, twinengine jet was in the air for 50 minutes, and that all systems worked as ex pected.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, July 27 (Reuters)The Federal Re serve Board has proposed an amendment to its truthin lending regulations, which would require home buyers be informed of the annual percentage rate and other terms of their loan at least 10 days before the date on which their note is to be executed.

title: Sadat Ignores Meir Peace Bid, Says Egypt Won't Admit Defeat
description: CAIRO, July 27President Anwar elSadat, ignoring Pre mier Golda Meir's bid for di rect peace talks, vowed to night that Egypt would not admit defeat and would not surrender.

title: SOVIET NAVY GAIN IS CITED BY JANE'S
description: LONDON, July 27 (UPI)  The Soviet Navy is expanding to every ocean and can snap its fingers at all the maritime countries, the authoritative Jane's Fighting Ships reported today.

title: Sports News in Brief
description: YONKERS, July 27 Albatross, the Mighty Bird Stanley Dancer's stable, may not start in the $50,000 Good Time Pace here a week from tomorrow night. Dancer awaiting a report on Xrays taken yesterday.

title: Curbs on Black African Bars
description: SALISBURY, July 27 (AP) Prime Minister Ian D. Smith's Government announced today regulations that will effectively close black bars in white areas.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Trovatore Given At Roman Theater In South of France
description: ORANGE, France  This Provencal city of about 25,000 people was the capital of the operatic world earlier this week with the Spanish soprano Mont serrat Cabell heading an inter national cast for a onceonly performance of Verdi's II Trovatore that packed an au dience of 7,000 into the spec tacular Roman theater.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Market Place: Fault Is Found With Fact Sheet
description: Remember the item a while back about the contro versial For Internal Use Only fact sheets on new issues and secondaries that brokerage firms hand sales men before an offering reaches the market?

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Bank Merger Is Put Off
description: CLEVELAND, July 27 (Reu ters)  The Union Commerce Corporation said it had with drawn its offer to merge with Fifth Third Bank of Cincinnati since the offer was subject to favorable action by the direc tors of Fifth Third and that such action was not forthcom ing. Union Commerce said it still considered possible a fu ture combination or affiliation with Fifth Third Bank.

title: A NUCLEAR PUNT CURBED BY A.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, July 27 The Atomic Energy Commis sion disclosed today that it had ordered the R. E. Ginna nuclear power plant of the Rochester Gas and Electric Company to reduce power because of dif ficulties with some of its fuel rods.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, July 27 (UPI) The disclosure that Senator Thomas F. Eagleton of Missouri received psychiatric treatment is not enough to make neces sary his withdrawal as the VicePresidential nominee, Rep resentative Herman Badillo said today.

title: Notes on People
description: Lyndon B. Johnson flew by helicopter from Fort Sam Houston, Tex., where he was hospitalized Mon day night, to his ranch, near Austin.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: City to Sue Hotels on Health Code

title: A Leader of Mafia Is a Fugitive From Jail After Visit to Dentist
description: A reputed Mafia leader who was indicted Tuesday on extor tion charges while serving a 10year prison term disappeared Wednesday afternoon after he was permitted to visit a dentist on Long Island without an es cort, the Federal Bureau of In vestigation said yesterday.

title: EARL OF SWINTON, BUILT AIR POWER
description: NORTH ALLERTON, England July 27 (Reuters)The Earl of Swinton, whose ministerial appointments spanned the years between 1920 and 1955, died at his home in ncarby Masham today. He was 88 years old.

title: Harold Snedcof Weds Miss Yaggy
description: The marriage of Miss Mel anie Reed Yaggy, an assist ant for public education at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, to Harold Snedcof, an associate with the Rocke feller Brothers Fund, took place here yesterday after noon. The Rev. Richard Leon ard, a Unitarian minister, performed the ceremony at the Explorers Club.

title: Defense Loses Plea to Delay Pentagon Papers Trial
description: LOS ANGELES, July 27The United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit denied today an effort by the defense to block the Pentagon papers trial until the Justice Depart ment discloses details of a wire tap incident involving the defense.

title: Many Black Rhodesians Fleeing Homes
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, July 27 (UPI)Hundreds of African tribesmen have fled their an cestral homeland in Rhodesia's Inyanga Mountains to avoid ar rest in a dispute with white landowners.

title: Week's American War Toll Is Put at 10 Dead, 9 Hurt
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 27 (AP)American casual ties in the Vietnam war last week included 10 persons killed in action, one killed in non combat duty and 9 wounded, the United States command an nounced in its weekly sum mary today. Two men were listed as missing, presumably in an air crash. This compared with 8 killed in action the pre vious week, 5 other dead, 14 missing or captured and 26 wounded.

title: RALLIES TO PROTEST BOMBING OF DIKES
description: WASHINGTON, July 27The National Peace Action Coalition announced today that it would sponsor demonstrations in 13 cities in early August to protest American bombing of North Vietnamese dikes.

title: TACKLE OF GIANTS IS REALLY A ROVER
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N.J., July 27In the threedeep de fensive depth chart that Coach Alex Webster prepared today for Saturday's opening pre season game, Jack Gregory is listed as the left tackle.

title: MEAT GRAND JURY INDICTS SUPPLIER
description: The first indictment of a yearlong investigation into an alleged conspiracy to inflate meat prices in the metropolitan area was announced yesterday.

title: WASHINGTON
description: The issue in this whole sad Eagleton business is not only Senator Eagleton's health, but Senator McGovern's judg ment. He has had bad luck, but he has also misjudged the problem of picking a Vice President, overrated the efficiency of his new young staff, trifled with the idealism of his main supporters and mishandled the conse quences of his own and Senator Eagle ton's blunders.

title: New Chairman of Amex Paul Kolton
description: Man in the News

title: Personalities: Golfer Is Silenced
description: Apparently, It is risky to criticize the Ladies' Profes sional Golfers Association. An official admitted yester day that Sandra Palmer, who spoke harshly of the L.P.G.A. for suspending Jane Blalock, was censured for her state ments. Miss Blalock, who will begin a defense today of her Lady Pepsi open title in At lanta, has been accused of moving the ball while it had been in play. She was sus pended, but received a court injunction that permitted her to compete until the case is decided. Miss Palmer said that one of the affadavits signed against Miss Blalock wasn't true. We can't have one of our players calling an other a liar, said Bud Erick son, the association's execu tive director. One member of the board reportedly wanted Miss Palmer suspend ed for shooting off her mouth

title: Green Berets Deny Staged Kidnapping Surprised Officials
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., July 27 (AP)The 20th Special Forces Group has denied that a staged kidnapping came as a surprise to officials of Alabaster, a town some 20 miles south of here.

title: U.S. Places Ceiling of 4% On Dividend Rises in '73
description: WASHINGTON, July 27  The Nixon Administration an nounced today that the ceiling for increases of corporate dividends in 1973 would be 4 per cent, the same limitation that has been in effect this year as part of the wageprice controls program.

title: Books of The Times
description: PIAF. By Simone Berteaut. 488 pages. Illus trated. New York: Harper & Row. $10.

title: 3 ECONOMISTS SEE NEED FOR TAX RISE
description: WASHINGTON, July 27 Three leading Democratic econ omists told Congress today that it would have to raise taxes next year, to become ef fective in 1974, and warned that the Nixon Administration Was likely to try to slow the current economic expansion, prematurely.

title: Burlington Will Close Facility On Research in North Carolina
description: Burlington Industries, Inc., is closing its research center in Greensboro, N.C., and moving all research operations to smaller laboratories in 11 divi sions of the company, Ely Callaway, president, said yesterday.

title: Mrs. Cornelius Engert, 87 Dies; Helped Defend a U.S. Legation
description: Mrs. Sara Cunningham En gert, wife of Cornelius Van H. Engert, a retired United States diplomat, died in Brussels July 14 while on vacation in Europe. Her age was 87.

title: Sales Also Decline
description: The Kennecott Copper Cor poration reported yesterday de clines in sales and net income for the second quarter and first half.

title: BRITAIN BOLSTERS TROOPS IN ULSTER
description: LONDON, July 27The Brit ish Government, in a major move to cripple the effective ness of the Irish Republican Army, is sending 4,000 more soldiers to stricken Northern Ireland.

title: Librarians Picket Nabisco Offices to Protest Stale Ad for Snacks
description: Fortyfive librarians picket ed the corporate offices of Nabisco here yesterday, pro testing the crumby way they felt they had been dealt with by the cracker company in one of its advertisements.

title: Hot Issues
description: Every investor dreams of buying the next I.B.M. or Xerox or Polaroid when its stock is first issued. In pursuit of that dream, many small investors acquire hot issues that soon drop like a lead balloon. Wall Street has traditionally treated the wildly gyrating new issues market as an inevitable and necessary feature of dynamic capitalism. Its lofty view has been that venture capital is essential for the growth of new businesses, that new issues are inherently risky, and that little sympathy should be wasted on greedy in vestors who don't know what they are buying and cannot afford the risks.

title: Pompidou Conferring With Italy's Leaders
description: LUCCA, Italy, July 27 President Pompidou began a twoday meeting with Presi dent Luigi Leone and Premier Giulio Andreotti here today, displaying once more his own style of French diplom acybilateral talks at the top level.

title: Publisher Makes Sea Trek
description: NEWPORT, R.I., July 27 (UPI) A Massachusetts newspaper publisher, Philip Weld, crossed the finish line Wednesday night 39 days after he had set out from Plymouth, England in the single  handed trans  Atlantic yacht race. The 57yearold Weld was jubilant at having completed the grueling, 4,500 mile trek. But I won't do it again, he said.

title: CARL SEEMAN JR.
description: Carl Seeman Jr., president of Roll Biscuit Company and Wonder Bar Products, Inc., both of the Bronx, died Satur day at the columbiaPresbyteri an Medical Center. He was 59 years old and lived at 87 Shel drake Road, Scarsdale, N.Y.

title: McGovern Aides Relate How They Learned of Eagleton's Problem
description: WASHINGTON, July 27  Aides to Senator George Mc Govern first learned the com plete history of Senator Thom as F. Eagleton's psychiatric treatment at a breakfast meet ing in the Senate Dining Room on July 19, six days after the Democratic Presidential nomi nee chose Mr. Eagleton to be his running mate.

title: Seoul and Pyongyang Offer Glimmers of Hope
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.An essential building block in the construction of a system of peaceful relations in Asia may well have been constructed by the recently announced accord be tween South and North Korea.

title: Rather Like Dining In a Country Home
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and dcor (four triangles to none).

title: STOCK PRICES. DIP ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Shares had another day of downward drift on the Ameri can Stock Exchange yesterday with the index closing at 26.76, off 0.07. The trend in the over thecounter market was also down, and the NASDAQ index closed at 135.80, off 0.50.

title: June Gains Trailed At Chain Retailers
description: Tropical Storm Agnes and a generally rainy month adverse ly affected chain store sales in June, according to a survey of The New York Times com pleted yesterday among 28 leading chain organizations.

title: Gold Price at Peak; Dollar Shows Gain
description: LONDON, July 27 (Reuters) The value of gold rose to a new postwar peak in late trad ing here today.

title: Positive Thinking Nourishes Bjorklund
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. 1., July 27 While his New York Jets playbook was resting on the floor beside his cot, Hank Bjorklund, a Princeton man, was propped up in bed at Hofstra reading a copy of PsychoCybernetics by Dr. Maxwell Maltz, a Columbia man.

title: Transcript of the President's News Conference on Foreign and Domestic Matters
description: WASHINGTON, July 27The fol lowing is a White House transcript of the news conference held today by President Nixon:

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Leading New York Demo cratic politicians and labor leaders called on Senator Thomas F. Eagleton yesterday to withdraw as the Democratic VicePresidential candidate.

title: Celtics Sign Art Williams
description: BOSTON, July 27 (AP)The Boston Celtics signed today Art )Williams, a guard, to a oneyear contract to play for the National Basketball Association club in the 197273 season.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: HARRY BIRTHDAY, JOHN BOWLES HA HA YOU'RE 10  LOVE PUB Advt.

title: St. Paul Companies Net Up
description: The St. Paul Companies, Inc., a major insurer, reported yes terday that secondquarter net income had risen to $18mil lion, or $1.72 a share, from $14.86million, or $1.41 a share, a year ago. Revenues rose to $171.8million from $146.8mil lion.

title: Mrs. Phillips. Recounts Husband's Actions on Dec. 24
description: Mrs. William R. Phillips took the witness stand in a packed courtroom here yesterday to give her husband an hourby hour alibi for the night that James Smith and Sharon Stango were murdered.

title: Allen E. Gant, President Of the Glen Raven Mills
description: GLEN RAVEN, N. C., July 27 Allen E. Gant, president and chief executive officer of Glen Raven Mills, died of a heart at tack at his desk Tuesday. He was 74 years old.

title: A CatholicEpiscopalian Couple Who Married AgainAs Jews
description: A few months before he was to have been ordained as an Episcopal priest in Santa Fe, N. M., James Richards and his wife, Wilma, a Roman Catholic, sat down and talked about just what they felt themselves to be.

title: Marijuana Smoking Said to Have Power To Deter Glaucoma
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 27 (UPI)Marijuana smoking re duces fluid pressure in the eyes and may prevent glaucoma, a significant cause of blindness, researchers reported yesterday.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAING
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., July 27  The director of Gov. George C. Wallace's Presiden tial campaign is expected to an nounce here Saturday that the wounded candidate will not run on a thirdparty ticket this year.

title: COMPANY CONTENDS ITS MINE WAS SAFE
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., July 27John Corcoran, pres ident of the Consolidation Coal Company, defended today the safety record of the company's Blacksville No. 1 mine.

title: COWBOYS' PASSING THREAT TO STARS
description: CHICAGO, July 27  The Dallas Cowboys are heavily fa vored, by 17 points ac cording to one Las Vegas source, to beat the College All Stars tomorrow night in the annual game that marks the start of the pro football ex hibition season. The game will be televised in the New York area on Channel 7, beginning at 9:30.

title: KOCH, B'NAI B'RITH BACK PLAN BY CUOMO
description: Mario M. Cuomo's recom mendation to Mayor Lindsay that the controversial Forest Hills lowincome housing proj ect be reduced 50 per cent in size won the support yesterday of Representative Edward I. Koch, DemocratLiberal of Man hattan, and the AntiDefama tion League of B'nai B'rith.

title: Rocket Richard to Coach Quebec City Six
description: Maurice (Rocket) Richard, romantic figure in the history of hockey, returned to the game yesterday as coach of Les Nordiques of Quebec City, a World Hockey Association club.

title: Assails Radio Report by Jack AndersonVows to Remain on Ticket
description: HONOLULU, July 27Sena tor Thomas P. Eagleton, the embattled Democratic nominee for Vice President, denounced as a damnable lie today a charge by the columnist Jack Anderson that he had a record of arrests for drunken and reckless driving.

title: Prospects for Fishing and Boating This Weekend
description: AREA AStriped bass fish ing on Long Beach near Surf City picked up the last few days, with surfcasters doing well on smalltomediumsized fish. Rebel plugs have been effective. Bay fishing for fluke has been reasonably good near the inlets and light tackle enthusiasts are having a field day with small blue fish a short distance offshore from Barnegat Inlet. Farther offshore, on Barnegat Ridge, large blues are being taken. A few weakfish are being caught in Great Bay and scat tered kingfish are along the beach. School tuna have ap peared off the north end of Barnegat Ridge in 110 to 120 feet of water and bluefish to 10 pounds are being caught trolling from two to six miles offshore.

title: Asian Drug Inflow Found Greater Than Realized
description: WASHINGTON, July 27  A secret analysis by the Govern ment's top narcotics enforce ment agency has concluded that the amount of highquality heroin being smuggled into the United States from Southeast Asia Is greater than previously realized.

title: Fed Bank Data Available
description: The New York Times has dis continued its publication of the weekly table of the assets and liabilities of major banks in large cities. This information is available, without charge, in the Federal Reserve Board's weekly statistical release, No. H.4.2. Readers desiring to ob tain copies should write Publi cations Services, Division of Administrative Services, Fed eral Reserve Board, Washing ton, D.C. 20551.

title: Reprieve in Britain
description: By seizing on a legal technicality, Britain's Industrial Relations Court has headed off the country's first gen eral strike since 1926 and eased a confrontation between the Conservative Government and organized labor. Both sides know, however, that the Court has provided only a reprieve; diehard dock unionists are pressing a tieup of all ports and great gaps must still be bridged if Britain is to be spared economic chaos in subsequent show downs over the fivemonthold Industrial Relations Act.

title: Joyce Bleiman Bride Of Richard I. Kandel
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., July 27Miss Joyce Blei man and Richard I. Kandel, graduates of Syracuse Uni versity, were married this evening by Rabbi Daniel Schwartz at Temple Israel of New Rochelle.

title: SPACE PACT HELD LIFT TO CALIFORNIA
description: DOWNEY, Calif., July 27  Champagne flowed into the early morning hours at they Tahitian Village restaurant here today. The North Ameri can Rockwell Corporation had won the richest aerospace con tract in yearsthe one to de velop the space shuttleand its employes celebrated with a nonstop eighthour victory party.

title: NIXON, CRITICIZING WAR FOES, CALLS WALDHEIM NAIVE
description: WASHINGTON, July 27 President Nixon charged today that Secretary General Wald heim of the United Nations and other well  intentioned and naive people had been taken in by Hanoi's propaganda into following a double standard of criticizing the United States war effort while ignoring North Vietnam's invasion of South Vietnam.

title: Business Briefs
description: TOKYO, July 27 (Reuters)  The I.B.M. World Trade Corporation of New York is planning to borrow about $300million from Japanese city banks in dollar loans, local banking sources said today.

title: Spruce Falls Power Plans To Build Sawmill in Canada
